I'm now using this as a router for our back-up connection (conduct most or all of your business online and that too becomes a modern necessity) and just don't see a substantial difference (positive or negative) between this and my (similarly priced) Airport Extreme 802.11N (5TH GEN).  The LinkSys, it's worth noting, also seems to be iOS device-friendly, I suffered regular drops with an older Netgear with our iPhone and iPad (driving my move to the Airport Express) and none of that is apparent with the Linksys.All in all, this is a great and powerful option for the typical user.  I note the concerns of the more technically proficient amongst us in the other reviews, and acknowledge them as entirely relevant concerns -- just not generally for the average person who wants to fire it up, quick configure, and then never worry about it again.

You will almost certainly, as other reviewers have noted, end up disabling the buttons on the side of this mouse.  Inevitably you will hit them when you don't intend to, resulting in entirely unintended effects in different games and applications.  While I have not (yet) played Diablo III, I absolutely intend to upon its release, and look forward to using those same buttons for quick and easy access to potions -- until then, they're simply (for me, and apparently for others) sort of a poorly placed inconvenience.That aside, there's not much to dislike about this mouse.  It's well designed, comfortable in the hand, the same rubberized feel you're going to get with a lot of higher end mice, with a low profile and lighter (nimbler) feel in the hand.  It is as precise and clean in wheel and button function as any normal gamer might require.  Casual users may find the lights a little more garish than they'd prefer in a non-gaming environment, but the aesthetics stop well short of being distracting or intrusive.This is, all around, a great mouse even if one doesn't intend to tether themselves to Diablo 3 long-term upon its release.  It offers many of the features and feel of more expensive options while providing an extra edge to that particular game.  The software is easy to work with, those side buttons easy to disable (rendering any complaint I might have about them nearly moot) -- I'm simply (quite) happy with the mouse and the value it represents.

Sharp right angles aren't particularly common in all-plastic storage containers because, one would assume, how these would represent stress points that would be prone to cracking and/or complete breakage.  So the immediately apparent advantage one sees to these boxes is that you're going to be making a more efficient use of space when you stack these, or store them next to one another on a shelf somewhere.  No (or significantly less) lost space between, under, behind, etc.  So the clean and squared-corner geometry is immediately a selling point, and Bankers Box then at least partially nullifies the benefit of the translucency of most plastic containers by adding in its own pair of large clear plastic windows giving you a clear and near complete look at the contents of the box.  Of course, should you not want the contents of the box on display, these windows are only on one side so it's easy enough to face them into the back wall of your closet (for example).The boxes are easy enough to assemble, of as solid/sturdy construction as one is going to get from this material while enjoying all the lightweight benefits of the same, and the pattern printed on the exterior brings an unobtrusive sense of clean style.  The plastic handles add a level of comfort and structural reinforcement when moving the boxes around, at the cost of there forever being two substantial open holes to the box on either end -- not the end of the world insofar as you'll never be using these for archival or otherwise delicate purposes, but it does mean that anything stored inside may not come out as 'fresh' as it goes in.The cost per unit is comparable to the average plastic alternative, perhaps a hair on the high end of the same, but the aforementioned benefits it brings over the same are worth (in this reviewer's mind) the additional expense.  Good, all-around solid, solution.

A lot of "if" qualifiers are floating around in my head as I start to think about the shape of this review.  So let's see how it plays out.  The Rockwell 3RILL ("Thrill") is a terrific solution if:- You already have more powerful drill for bigger, more demanding tasks.- You want it as a quick, easy, and conveniently manipulated (changing bits) option for driving screws, punching quick and small holes, as a power nut driver, etc.- You're not determined to have all (or most) of your power tools share the same battery set.- Light, small, and accessible are selling points for you.I like the Rockwell a lot, but then it's not at all the only driver/drill I have in the house.  When available as an alternative to a much heavier and more powerful option(s), it often is a much better fit for the lighter-faster jobs I have around the property.  So it's with that primary caveat (it's a better supplement than takes-on-all-tasks solution) that I'm able to sort of glow about this little, green, lithium-powered machine.The lithium batteries take and hold a charge quickly and well, respectively.  There's sufficient power here to do heavier jobs even if this may not be the ideal tool for them, which is to say that you're more than covered for any of the normal/lighter stuff you might be doing around the home.  The size makes it more accessible to the whole family, and the ease of use of the hand chuck makes it accessible to all without regard to their experience and comfort levels with powered tools.Like other reviewers, I wish this had come with a chuck adapter allowing you to use any of the standard round-bore size-varied bits you may already have around the house.  As is, the Rockwell requires the hex base present on all of the five bits and heads that come with the drill, which is to say that you're not going to just buy this driver and then drop your existing bits/heads into it without an additional purchase (unless of course they already feature that 1/4" hex base).So, as I opened, there are a lot of "if" qualifiers.  Consider the totality of the "ifs" raised in this and other reviews, and you may well still come to the conclusion that they are selling points and not detractors.  I did, and that's why (with the aforementioned qualifiers that represent the core focus of this review) I find myself feeling and writing very positively about this little, convenient, but still powerful, tool.  Extra credit to Rockwell for putting the inline light on the tool, it's a marvelous and entirely welcome perk.

Everyone has different needs and priorities when it comes to a pair of gaming headsets.  In my case, I wanted something I could use while my wife and the dogs slept that would still allow me to pick up the important/relevant audio elements of the game I was playing (most recently (while using this set) Battlefield 3 multiplayer).  Not surprisingly, the audio quality is on the better end of the scale.  I expected as much from Sennheiser, and while I wasn't blown away and won't be confusing these with a pair of high end audio-only phones, it was still every bit as good as you would want.  But, unfortunately, that's sort of where the strong positives end.My immediate concerns are about how they connect, how comfortable they are (or aren't), and how the microphone's non-adjustable sensitivity threshold may be causing some communication issues when you're trying to be quiet (and why wear a headset when you're not trying to be quiet?).The connection issue isn't going to be a problem for those not using HDMI or fiber for their audio.  I go straight from the 360 to a Denon receiver with fiber, and then from the receiver to speakers with MIT cables.  At no point in the equation (at the 360, on my tv, or even on the Denon do I have easily accessible RCA jacks.  The instructions indicate you should just plug it into your tv -- this is terrific if you're using your tv for audio -- I'm not, others don't, so consider that issue and how you'll resolve it before buying these.  So that connectivity is an issue for me and will be for some, and with that issue comes a little less convenience in terms of setting them up and breaking them down before, and then after, a gaming session.  The same could be said about the wires themselves.  Microsoft placed a premium on disconnecting gamers from the hardware, giving them the freedom to move around as they please.  With a standard pair of 360 phones you're tethered to the wireless controller (unless you've splurged for the on-ear wireless option), but not the console.  With the Sennheiser you're tethered to both, and to something else as well.  Jack into the controller, USB into the console, RCA into your TV or perhaps your receiver (as long as that's close enough to the rest -- another issue that confounded me).  I want to just say I wish this had been a wireless solution, that if I can send and receive audio through the controller jack with other headsets I should be able to hear -- and I do wish that -- but I can't speak intelligently to why Sennheiser felt it necessary to create this web of connections, there may well be a valid reason.  Whether or not that's true doesn't change the fact that it's an issue.On the mic, the bottom line is that it's just not going to 'believe' that you're talking sometimes.  The real world result is that you're not going to be sending a lot of ambient noise to others.  When I'm playing BF3 I can, at times, hear every sniffle and huff someone makes on the other end.  That's not going to be the case here as the headset does a good job of isolating your voice.  In my own experience, however, that means that sometimes the first part of what you say isn't going to go through, and sometimes you may be told they can't hear you at all if you're not speaking with a normal conversational volume -- a level of volume that you may well be trying to avoid if you're playing at night and a certain potentially grouchy someone is being a more responsible person and is trying to sleep just a few feet away.Finally, comfort -- eh, it's okay -- but just okay.  The mic boom rotates up and down but not laterally, nor does it telescope in and out.  The top band is sufficiently padded and the phones themselves are not terribly heavy, but you're never going to just forget that you have them on.  The ear padding and just the feel of them on your ears is on the better end of acceptable.  "Eh" sort of says it.  They're fine -- not bad even over an extended gaming session, not great, good enough.Bottom line?  I wouldn't advise someone not to get these headphones.  Despite the greater focus on the negatives above, I find these a solid enough option, and the alternatives (those with which I have familiarity, anyway) similarly flawed enough as to not represent a major advantage.  If you want both the game audio and the chat audio in your phones, these are a good option with the caveats mentioned above.  Just think about where and how you're going to plug them in, and put a towel or blanket over the wires on the floor in case you have dogs that like to move around at night and trip on hazards connected to multiple electronics.  >.<tl;dr -- Good, not great.  Wires are bad.  Voice sometimes gets cut off.

If you cook and/or bake, you have a scale -- or you should have a scale.  Soehnle has sort of become to go-to for home-casual options on this front, and for good reason; they're affordable, usually attractive (or at least not unattractive), and generally accurate.I have an older Soehnle that looks a little alien.  It has three cylinders as a base, connecting by posts to a disc in the middle which then, in turn, supports the glass measuring surface that is sort of standard for a Soehnle scale.  What's nice about this design is that you have the display and controls on the top visible surface of one of those cylinders, and then the top of one of the others acts as an easily accessible switch between grams and ounces.  It's the latter distinction that brings me to draw a comparison between my older 'alien' Soehnle (I simply don't know the model number anymore and it no longer seems to be available) and this new Siena.  On the Siena (which is smaller, and has a lower max weight -- but these are non-issues as far as I'm concerned as there are costs and benefits alike), the g/oz switch can only be toggled by picking the whole scale up and flipping it over.  It's on the bottom, like the battery cover.  I won't belabor why this is less convenient except to say that if you're working on more than one recipe and they use different units of measurement, it's a simple truth that easy access to these functions is the better option.So it's with that 'ding' that I say that this is a fine scale.  It has a very clear and easy-to-read display, the controls are as simple as any other Soehnle (press and hold the button to zero out, put whatever you want to weigh on the glass, near-instant results), it has a smaller footprint than a lot of other options (important for those with limited counter real estate), and while it's clearly designed for lighter use than some of the other models, its capacity is still going to be greater than most anything you'll be weighing in a home kitchen.  This remains a economically and functionally efficient option, one I'm happy to have added to my home -- I just wish that one little switch was on top somewhere.

I've had color inkjet printers in the past, I've also had them in all-in-one configurations such as this.  I was never happy with the print quality with those devices, in terms of either the depth of color and the resolution of the color imagery -- or (most importantly, for most printing) in terms of the quality of plain old black text.  So I eschewed color for a simple laser printer with the big, heavy, expensive, (and sometimes but rarely) messy toner cartridges and I was happy enough.  As secondary background, I am an iOS device user.  I looked for a variety of solutions that would allow me to print directly from the iPhone4 and a 1st gen iPad.  Google offered functional but limited-to-email support through their own system, apps (free and not) were offered in iTunes, and every once and a while I could find ways to print from these devices to the aforementioned laser printer.The WorkForce 845 sort of reinvented everything I wanted and expected from a printer within moments of arriving.  In retrospect I wish I had recorded video of the unboxing and setup because it would have made a pretty compelling video review.  It would have been about 5 minutes long, and within that 5 minutes you'd have seen me go from an open box to printing out a spectacular full 8.5x11" glossy full-color, high-resolution shot of one of my dogs from the iPhone.  Had the video gone an extra 2-3 minutes, it could have included me scanning in a document I put in the 845 directly to the same phone, which I was then able to easily email to someone else.  The point here is that I had instant and (importantly) intuitive access to a level of connectivity and control that has escaped me to date.  Moreover, the print quality on plain-text documents rivaled that of my 7 year old laserjet (to the point that they are near indistinguishable), the photo print I ended up with isn't going to be confused with what you'd get if you took a shot from a high-end camera and had a professional printer produce an image for you -- but that's not what I was expecting from (a) my phone, and (b) an economical all-in-one printer.  The image I got, on my first try, from a phone camera, dramatically exceeded my expectations.The printer itself is handsome; gloss black, the tilting touch-screen control panel an impressive touch -- but beyond the pleasing aesthetics what you have here is a workhorse that is clearly ready to do everything I ask it to do, whether I ask through a computer, or through the free app provided in iTunes (I understand Android is supported as well, but I can't speak to that).  I love that the ink colors are individually tanked so that if one runs out I don't have to lose the remains of the rest in order to restore full color (a complaint from my old machines).  I love that I can double-side print without being there at the machine to flip over and properly orient the page.  I guess what I'm saying is that after a month or two of pretty regular (and at times quite heavy) use, I'm a big fan of the machine.More so than I expected, otherwise I might have had that video of the process up to supplement this review.  Count me a happy reviewer, and one that would have no hesitation recommending this printer to friends and family.

As I said in a recent review for the larger Celebrate with a Crowd offering from ig4U, you start with a deep and attractive basket, then fill it (above a buffer) with a variety of tasty and unusual treats ranging from hard pretzels, to delicate truffles, imported sandwich cookies, unusual grain mustard, and number of other welcome surprises, and you have this well-stocked gift basket.  "Celebrate with a Friends" is a good size for a small(ish) family or modest group of friends.The contents are attractively arranged, in many cases they've got their own printed boxes as a presentation/organizational layer with the original wrapping underneath (which is to say that you may open a box that indicates pretzels to find a bag of pretzels within).  The basket is no Longaberger, but the one I received was of a relatively high quality construction level and was genuinely handsome.  The whole package is wrapped in plastic and then a rich brown ribbon with a card -- all in all you're left with a gift that is likely to give the impression that you spent more than you may have.I was pleased with the basket, delighted to discover some new treats with which I was previously unfamiliar, and in general found myself very happy with what I received.  It's worth noting that some of the exceptionally poor reviews below are entirely accurate and not at odds with my own experience -- indeed, even the harshest echo my own feelings about the product as it was represented in prototype in late October.  Without speaking for the company, my understanding is that many of us received prototype packages that saw the aforementioned original packaging represented by things like empty individual serving cereal boxes wrapped in inkjet printer paper.  The end result was, as one reviewer put it, sort of creepy.  The company replaced these prototypes with their final version, and I have gone from seeing this as a 1-star product worth (as others have) warning prospective buyers away, to feeling like they really represent a fine value.  I would have no problem whatsoever buying one of these as a gift for a group of friends.  So my review is based on the 'final' version of the product as it was received in late Nov/early Dec 2011, and not upon the late Oct prototype received.  I only make this distinction for the sake of browsers being able to consider the totality of the currently available reviews, putting the product change timeline into perspective.

Virna De Paul is a well known author but she’s completely new to my reading world.  So I was excited to check out her latest release, Filthy Rich –  the blurb tugged at all of my must read triggers.  Money, power and sexy characters – woohoo!! I could wait to start it.​After a chance encounter at a work related party, Cara and Brendan share an intoxicating moment of lust. It’s brief and intense but it clearly leaves it’s mark on the two.  The scene captures your attention and you are definitely intrigued by this budding couple.  I thought they were charming and quick witted.  Their intelligence and drive made them incredibly alluring characters – I wanted to know more about them both.Their story jumps forward from there and the plot moves along swiftly.  There’s lots of intrigue and mystery surrounding the company Cara works for as well as her new relationship with Brendan.  Someone seems to be out to get them both – it’s very exciting.  There are several jaw dropping moments as well as more highly erotic moments between Kara and Branden.  It is awesome.I thought Filthy Rich started kind of slow but it gradually increased its intensity right along with the build up of passion between the two main characters and that overall it flowed very well.  It wasn’t a book that I would say drop everything and read – however if you’re looking for an enthralling and suspenseful read to fill an afternoon, Filthy Rich is definitely a good choice. It will keep you entertained and get your lady bits tingling.  It will leave you feeling satisfied.So don’t miss out on Cara and Brendan – their adventure was fun and I absolutely suggest you read their book.

Sawyer Bennett is one of my absolute favorite authors and I was completely giddy to dive into her latest release from the Legal Affairs series.  Each of the previous books in this set were sassy, tantalizing reads that I could not put down.  So I was not surprised that Friction was highly enticing legal romance; one that was oh so much fun to read.Leary and Reeve are both intelligent, quick witted and highly sexually charged individuals. They work for two very different types of law firms and are currently opposing council for a huge case.  The plot moves along swiftly.  Most of the book is leading up to the actual trial but their verbal foreplay and their competitive personalities make for spectacular reading.  You're completely invested in the outcome of their case and rooting for them to overcome the pitfalls of being adversaries.Right from the first moments together, Leary and Reeve kept me on my toes.  These two were completely engaging and captivating characters.  I never knew what was going to come out of their mouths or what lines they would cross with their behavior.  It was awesome - I spent the majority of their book with a smile on my face.What was even more impressive was the chemistry between Leary and Reeve - it was monumental.  Their connection was freaking intense and highly sensual.  They could barely keep their hand off each other and as a reader, you are psyched that they cannot.  The passion and lust they exude makes your lady bits tingle and has you devouring page after page.  I loved it.Overall, I thought that Leary and Reeve's love story was incredible - a can't miss romance.  I definitely recommend you read it as well as the other romances in the Legal Affair series.

When you pick up a Roni Loren book you know you're about to enter a naughty, erotic world and you're absolutely psyched to be there. Her characters are always enticing and their drama is highly entertaining. Her latest release, Break Me Down is a provocative and stimulating novella that you do not wait to miss out on.Samantha and Gibson share a strong connection - both emotionally and physically. They know one another from the ranch plus Sam's best friend is married to Gibson's brother.  The trouble is that they both believe they're Doms and that makes future opportunities between the two bleak even though their connection is palpable.  However, one of them is lying to themselves as well as to the other.  It's not done to be malicious - more so because the person is terrified admit some very hard truths.Break Me Down is the story of Samantha and Gibson reaching for the truth and their own version of happily ever after.  And while I really enjoyed their story, I wish it had been a full-length novel. The relationship between these two characters was complicated and intense - it felt a bit rushed at times and I didn't care for that.  However, it's still everything you expect from this author and more.  Break Me Down is an incredible read - one that I definitely recommend.

I am already in love with this new Pier 70 series from Nicole Edwards. Holy hotness!!  Reckless gives readers and fans of this author a whole new set of characters to lust after and to devour. It’s freaking awesome.The storyline in Reckless pairs up Cam and Gannon.  Their relationship builds slowly and even though they are highly attracted to one another, they become friends first.  They find that they couldn’t be more different personality or interest wise but their hearts are telling them that they completely work together.But it’s not as easy as they would both like.  There is a certain level of complexity to their relationship. Yes, it’s intense and filled with passion but they both carry a bit of baggage.  The push and pull dynamic of their desire for one another is really coupled with major hurdles they need to overcome.  They both need to get over their individual fears to make their relationship work.  That additional aspect of personal growth really adds to the book and heightens your empathy for the two characters.As Cam and Gannon really connect and fall deeply in love, so do you as a reader.  You want them to work it all out and to get their happily ever after together.  Their story makes for a great romance and a highly entertaining read.Since Reckless the first book in the series, there is also a lot character and sub-plot introduction.  The point of view switches several times to the other owners of Pier 70 Marina and after meeting Cam’s friends, I honestly cannot wait for more from this group.  I think this is really going to be a sexy, fun set of characters.Definitely don’t miss out on Reckless it’s a must read a fans of M/M erotic romance as well as for anyone who just enjoys well written love story.

I might have a little crush on Brando... No, that's wrong.  I absolutely fell for him and I found myself psyched to be reading his story.  Not only is his romance with Haley enticing and fast paced - it is a really freaking entertaining story.When you first meet his character, you find that Brando is a complete manwhore.  He's an arrogant, sexy player that isn't looking for more than one night of fun from whomever he takes home.  However, as you get to know him better, you find out that his past experiences have left him jaded and unable to trust because he was betrayed by someone he devoted his entire being to.So when Brando is tempted by the one person he thought he had lost forever, he is unable to back down from a bet and he ends up with much more than he bargained for - Haley.  His challenge. He must turn a complete her into a rock star.  Get her on the music billboard charts in one month.I thought Haley was completely badass.  As much as she craves and desires Brando, she owns who she is and how she wants to do things - she is definitely not his puppet.  It's all about her music and she wants to famous but also be able to look herself in the eye when she achieves that fame.The first installment in this series is highly addictive and leave you wanting more from this duo.  I cannot wait to get the next chapter in Haley and Brando's romance.  Definitely check Brando out.

Holy freaking hotness!! The first volume in the Watching series is all kinds of erotic goodness.  I loved it!This novella starts with a bang and is driven forward at a fast pace thanks to the couple's connection.  Celia and Jack have a case of major insta-lust that they know they will act on.  It's unavoidable.Once they do, watch out.  Celia and Jack's time together is sexy, naughty  - fun and it will have your lady bits tingling.  They are so tempting together, you are unable to put their story down.  It's awesome and highly addictive, I cannot wait to see what happens next for this couple!If you are looking for a quick, steamy read - I definitely recommend you grab Watching: Volume 1.

As you may or may not know, I LOVED the first book in this series, Typecast. I pretty much begged Kim Carmichael to notify me as soon as the second book in the series was available because I couldn't wait to get my hands on the continuing saga of the Hollywood Stardust crew.  So I was pumped when I finally got to read Limelight.Here is the deal with this series. Twenty years ago, a group of four young adults made a movie that changed a generation. It was about a cross country road trip to California with three guys and one girl  - they're all friends but they're all also all in love or lust with Erin. Off-camera the actors basically are living through a similar story line except for Erin who is really only in love with one of the three boys.  And who it is a huge secret.Like any good romantic drama, there's an incident and the results from it changed the life paths for all four.  It also almost destroys all the friendships.  Drew disappeared - changed his name and got started on a completely different career path.  He hid himself from the world and especially from Erin. For twenty years, Erin has been searching for a Drew - to mend and correct the errors she made when she was a foolish kid.So when Limelight picked up where Typecast ended with Drew showing up for the twenty year reunion - you're beyond excited to finally get Drew and Erin's story.I was quickly sucked into their world and their drama.  I didn't really like Erin the first book - I thought that she was kind of bratty and spoiled but the author has given the reader more insight to what really makes her tick in Limelight.  Suddenly I found myself having more empathy for her.  I slowly began to like her and I was completely invested on her journey of self-discovery and reclaiming her lost love.  I wanted her and Drew to work things out.It's not an easy path for these two to get their happily ever after. There is a lot of mistrust and insecurities that makes it difficult to move forward and overcome the heavyweight of their past mistakes.  But they are amazing together.  Their scenes made me laugh, and swoon.  They're sexy and sweet.  I loved it.Erin and Drew's story makes awesome reading and the plot incredibly entertaining. I devoured Limelight in just one afternoon because I couldn't put Drew and Erin's romance down.  This book is a top recommendation from me.  Don't miss out on this series!!

The best part of this series is that each book is better and more impressive than the last one. River Savage just continues to increase the passion and intensity between her characters all the while making their storylines more addictive and satisfying reads. It's awesome and Infatuation knocked my panties off - I loved it!!Mackenzie was one of the women that Beau helped rescue from a seriously bad marriage and even though they only spent a few days together, a rock solid connection was formed. She trusted him enough to turn to him once again in a time of need. Maybe because she knew she would be safe in his custody or maybe because she was curious about knowing him.For whatever reason, her arrival changes everything. No one misses their sexual chemistry and every scene with them makes your heart pound. You highly anticipate the moment that they surrender to one another.But their relationship is crazy, complicated so that moment is not one that comes easily. Beau desperately wants Mackenzie but he worries that all that he desires and needs sexually will just be too much. And while Mackenzie is timid, she's more than a little curious what it would feel like to be taken. Craved. Overcome with lust. But all of that takes trust and she's not sure if she will ever be able to give herself fully again nor does she believe in her own judgement.There budding relationship is combined with the mystery surrounding Mackenzie's husband. The club is trying to help at Beau's insistence but all they see to be finding is dead ends and more chaos. Mackenzie's problems create new enemies and problems. It was an excellent sub plot and I loved the scenes with the club members.Overall, Infatuation is just a must read story. Whether you've read any of the other books in the series or not. River's latest book is both suspenseful and engaging as well as sexually arousing. I definitely recommend that you do not miss out on Infatuation, it's a highly entertaining read!

I love a good dark romance book. They're thrilling, seductive reads and when they are written well, you become fully immersed in a world that you never step foot in real life but love reading about. The Stripped Series is an amazing dark romance set of books. It is filled with crazy characters whose lives are so freaking entertaining and alluring.If you're like me, you've read the previous books and have experienced the brief moments with Ivan and Candace, so you're pumped to finally be getting their story in Pretty When You Cry. I have made so many assumptions about these two, that I almost felt desperate to know what really is their relationship. Are they lovers? Are they friends? Foes?What I got blew my mind. Their relationship is complex. Naughty and erotic. It's a twisted and lonely love. Honestly, I promise you that everything you thought you knew about this couple is nothing compared to the complicated relationship that Skye Warren has crafted.Candace always came across as this angry, needy addict to me. However, she would show these random acts of kindness and I think those moments are what made me the most curious about her. As you read, you find out that she's hiding - desperate to escape her past and a man that fills her night mares. And once you understand her, your empathy and compassion for her grows. You want her to find solace and to get her happily ever after.Ivan and Candace's journey together is intense. She wants something more with Ivan - she needs him to fulfil her heart's and body's desires. She loves him. Candace wants a future with Ivan but he cannot see her as anything more than the fragile girl he found. Since the book is completely told from Candy's perspective, you never get a true glimpse inside of Ivan's thoughts or his heart - so you don't truly know how he feels.I loved every moment with their unfolding story. Pretty When You Cry was an awesome addition to the series and even if you haven't read the other books, it would still be enjoyable. That is because it is an exciting and powerful romance. One that completely captured my attention - I was consumed by Ivan and Candace's love. Definitely check this book out today as well as the other books in the Stripped Series.

Ginger Scott's Harper's boys have totally charmed me - I love them. Underneath their tough, bad-ass exteriors lie the hearts of sweet, generous and kind men who have been dealt a tough set of cards in the game of life. These sexy beasts will take on the world to protect their girls. So to say I was a little excited to be read Andrew's story after meeting him in his older brother's book is an understatement.And what freaking book. Wow.Wicked Restless, Andrew and Emma's story gutted me. Their romance started in their teens and it was so innocent - you're completely enchanted by the couple. Their connection is delicate and sweet, yet it's filled with temptation and all the desires that teens feel for their first loves.So I was crushed when one mistake changed the course of their lives. I felt heartbroken. My heart raced as I delved deeper into their lives and the fall out for these two; I was horrified that life could be so unfair. The consequences and price they paid for love was high.When the two reconnect years later, it isn't a happy or joyous reunion. It's filled with secrets and deception. Anger. Lust. My emotions bounced up and down with each new page. Andrew and Emma created this tangled web of lies that you almost cannot see how they will walk away unscathed. They seem to need to experience every moment of pain so that they could be rewarded with ones of happiness and love.I highly suggest you read any thing that Ginger Scott writes - she is one of my favorite authors. Her characters will endear themselves to you and you will devour their happily ever after moments. Emma and Andrew's journey just another example of her genius. Their story is a must read and a top recommendation from me.

Oh, how the mighty have fallen.If you’re a fan of the Rule Series by Monica Murphy, then you’ve been waiting patiently (or not so patiently like me) for Tristan’s romance.  I couldn’t wait to read his story, Slow Play and to see if I would fall in love with Tristan just like I did his best friends.  He was just so anti-love that you knew when he got knocked on his ass by a woman that it would be a page devouring read.Tristan’s pursuit of Alex left you feeling enchanted and your lady bits tingling.  He’s a moody, angry manwhore and she’s a feisty reformed princess.  Their push and pull dynamic leaves you craving more because as a couple these two are erotic and fun – it’s highly entertaining.  But what starts as a case of insta-lust between the two became a friendship – one with a deeper understanding for one another.  Their connection and chemistry grounds them.  It makes them whole.​I could not get enough of this book and this couple. Slow Play kept me on the edge my seat with anxiety – I kept waiting for Tristan to let me down because it felt like it was going to be inevitable.  You expected his sharp tongue or anger to get him in trouble.  You expected him to make a poor choice or to let Alex or his friends down.  So when he shows up and exceeds your expectations, you’re swooning.  You completely understand how he stole Alex’s heart.He wasn’t as easy to love as Shep or quite as charming as Gabe but once Tristan creeps into your heart, you never want him to leave.  I get why he turned out to be the author’s favorite of the trio.Tristan’s story with Alex, coupled with the hilarity of his friendship with Gabe and Shep makes Slow Play a must read conclusion to an incredible set of books.  I loved every moment I spent with these characters and definitely suggest you check it out.

I love the start of a new sports romance series – especially ones about hockey players. These professional athletes are intense and just as badass as any biker or man in a three-piece suit. And it’s because you know that to achieve the level of success they’ve reached, they’re incredibly passionate and driven. So the idea that an author is taking on a team full of those type of characters and having them all fall in love – it’s nirvana for me.However, Major Misconduct isn’t just another book about some hot hockey player.  It’s a well told love story that is about one women finding her true self while meeting her romantic match and it is seriously fabulous.I thought that Lovey was completely relatable and I got caught up in her zest for living.  She worked at finding the best in situations, people and basically out of life.  She’s only just words on a pages in a book but I wanted to be around her and share in her glow.  I devoured her story and her romance with Mark.Lovey seemed a little lost and unsure of herself but it’s only because she grew up in the shadow of her brother, Duncan, who had a major talent in hockey and was able to make a career out of his passion.  Lovely didn’t initially have that – she needed to bounce around life a bit to find her place.  As a reader, I could imagine her life and put myself in her shoes.  So I was more than a little excited for her when her new career started taking off and then when Lovey and Marc give into their feelings for one another.  (I think I might have cheered out loud a little bit.)Their connection was instantaneous – you’re almost knocked over by their desire for one another.  Every stolen moment between these two is freaking HOT.  They have this understanding for one another that heightens their sexual chemistry but that also made them friends. Their romance was kind of taboo and that made it fun to read.  Experiencing them falling in love made me giddy and created or reminded me of that crazy feeling in my chest one experiences when they find their true love.So when they encounter road blocks and emotional hurdles, you are rooting for them.  These made up characters feel real and you want them to win at love.  They are the friends who turn into lovers that you desperately want to get their happily ever after.  That’s what made this book a must read recommendation from me.I thought Kelly Jamieson’s latest release Major Misconduct was awesome. I absolutely loved it. The characters and their romance left me feeling hot AND they made me laugh – I’m completely hooked on the players from the Chicago Aces.  I will purchase every book from this series and I would definitely recommend you do the same.

I met Tazen and Quinn last night and OMG – these two are hilarious! And intense. Holy hotness!!  Hard to Break is seriously, seriously awesome.  I loved it!!  Bella’s An Alpha’s Heart novels might be my favorite books from her – ever.  They are entertaining and incredibly sexy reads.Quinn is completely badass – she made me want to run out and learn the difference between an alternator and drive shaft. (Or at the very least, she made me want to stare at hot peeps who know the difference)  Anyway, at the start of the book, her life is beyond chaotic.  Her father is drinking himself to death and their business is dying right along with him.Enter Tazen.  He’s a successful custom car builder and he wants the property Quinn’s auto shop resides at.  He also wants Quinn, has a past, and several mistakes that he’s trying to outrun.  Did I mention that he’s also sexy as all hell?!? You will love him.The intense attraction between these two is instantaneous.  They fight it at first – battling their lust with quick wit and snarky banter but that only makes you anticipate the moment that they surrender to their passion.  As soon as they stop fighting, their lives become completely entwined and you are bewitched by their connection.  I devoured their story because of it.  Everything about their journey toward happily ever after was enjoyable and I finished the book simply feeling happy.One of my favorite things about this series is that it is about females who excel in male-dominated professions.  I loved Quinn’s rebellious and fierce personality – her determination to succeed freaking rocked.  I was cheering her on and psyched that she didn’t except less than she knew she was worth.  It’s nice to read an erotic book about a renegade character and to have that person be a women.Hard to Break is a top recommendation from me, as was Hard to Fight and honestly, I cannot wait to read the final book Hard to Forget because I think it’s probably going to be awesome, too.  Bella Jewel has another winner with this series!!  Definitely meet Tazen and Quinn today!

I almost passed on Alasdair.  I'm so freaking over vampires and I'm not a huge paranormal romance fan. But I just couldn't miss out on a book written by Ella Frank - I  love her stories. Her books and her MM romances are some of my all time favorites, so I had to read her latest release. Even if it was about vampires.I now want to kick my own ass for almost making a huge blunder.  I'm so thankful that I went outside my reading norms because Alasdair was INCREDIBLE. The characters and their story blew me away, it's really all quite brilliant. The plot is intense and seriously, seriously make my panties incinerate erotic - plus it's only the start to what I can only assume will be an epic adventure.  I cannot wait for more.The Masters Among Monsters series starts with Alasdair's book.  He spotted Leo one evening and from that moment on, he was completely bewitched. Alasdair's attraction and desire for this man was unlike anything he had felt for thousands of years. They seem to have this enigmatic bond and that makes Alasdair weary. But he's not the only one - Leo is not sure what the hell is going on with his life.  He finds himself in an incredibly dangerous situation and while he's scared, he's fascinated by this strange man that he is desperately lusting after.The book's perspective alternates back and forth from their personas and I was completely entralled by all of it. I thought there was a lot of character development and ground work being laid out for the entire series in Alasdair.  You're introduced to all the various characters that will be important throughout Alasdair and Leo's journey. And while the book focused on the passion between these two main characters there really wasn't a lot of romance, however I believe their relationship will develop into more in the following books.At the core of this story is a lot of Greek mythology, a mysterious plot and lots enticing M/M vampire sex.  Alasdair and Leo's lives are obviously entangled for a reason and I believe that the purpose of their bond will slowly unfold throughout the three books.  I have no clue what the author has in store for these two but Ella started this series with a hit.Alasdair is an alluring and captivating book - an absolute must read. Definitely start it today.

Everything I Left Unsaid was one of the most beautiful and raw stories I've ever read. It was my first book from Molly O'Keefe and I absolutely loved it.  It is a must read recommendation from me.The story all starts with a phone call and a man - a stranger asking her if she was safe. But Annie was far from ok - she was on the run and all alone. Terrified. You can feel her desperation. It oozes off the pages and you want her new home to be a place of solace. You want the world to be a little less lonely for her.But you'll find that you quickly want that for Dylan, too. They're both so scarred from life that you cannot help feel hope that fate has brought them together for a positive reason.  Even though their verbal foreplay is AWESOME, you want the voice on the other end of the phone to do more than awaken Annie's sexual being, you want Dylan to be the man who gives her a happily ever after.There is an edge to their romance and it's thrilling.  The passion and intensity of this couple, before they ever even meet rivals any of the romances novels on the book market. The push and pull of boundaries is incredible. Dylan's drive to fill Annie's desires and to awaken everything she has repressed, is tantalizing and seductive. Erotic.I devoured their conversations. They left my heart pounding and aching for more. And when they finally meet and touch - I was blown away by the magnitude of their connection. Annie and Dylan's journey tugged at my heart as well as my panties. It's spectacular.Everything I Left Unsaid is the first book in this series and it's conclusion left my jaw on the ground. (This book is not a standalone) I cannot wait to read the next installment and to see what the author has in store for this couple!!

Everything about Dirty English kicks ass - I freaking LOVED the twins and Declan's romance with Elizabeth.  The time I spent in their world kept me completely entertained and I  am addicted to this new set of characters Ilsa Madden-Mills has created.  It's an awesome love story and an absolute must read.The story starts with a heartbreaking prologue.  Within just a few pages, she had my empathy and I genuinely hurt for Elizabeth.  When the jumps forward two years, I understood by she guarded her heart and why she made the vow to never love again.  Elizabeth is a truly a remarkable character.  I was impressed with her drive to move forward and I liked how she knows where her personal boundaries are but yet still tries to push herself beyond what makes her comfortable.Enter Declan.  He's all kinds of panty melting goodness.  One half of a hot British duo, Declan is a fighter and a protector.  He's enticing - his personality is both sweet and sexy.  His reaction to Elizabeth is what every single female truly wants.  He's captivated and enthralled by her; unwilling to give up on the attraction he feels for her even though she consistently rejects his advances.And she does that because Declan makes Elizabeth feel to much. Her heart races and she is consumed by her attraction to him. So much so that even though he's everything she does not want and hopes to avoid, she eventually cannot resist his charms or her feelings toward him.  Their relationship and connection is intense much like their personalities.  They're both a little damaged but together they're stronger.  Better.Their romance was fun to read even though at times my heart ached for these two. The author did an incredible job balancing out the right levels of angst and hopefulness - you're easily and emotionally attached to both characters. I loved it.I definitely recommend Dirty English and I'm praying that it is the start of a new series revolving around this set of family and friends. (I desperately want Dax's book next!!) One click this book today - you'll love it too!

Arrrggggg!!  I'm not sure if I like this series or not. Don't jump up my butt - I know people really love it but I feel seriously exhausted after reading the first two books. Brooklyn's life is one freaking hot mess and her crazy saga continues in Brooklyn's Survival.Brooklyn has a very dangerous stalker/murderer after her. He is cruel and relentless in his pursuit of her - killing women who look exactly like her left and right. Hurting the people that Brooklyn loves. He's always present. Taunting her. You're not sure if he wants to get her angry and engaged in his crazy game or if he desperately wants to break her spirit.I loved this aspect of the story.  It's exciting and intense.  Suspenseful.  It made me want to recommend this book to everyone.However, this drama is coupled with the ongoing adventure that is Brooklyn and Mark's relationship. Sweet Jesus. These two made me feel angry and frustrated. You know they are souls mates and that they know it, too. Their connection and history ties them together but is almost too much to overcome. Yet they cannot stay away from one another and whenever they are left alone they cannot ignore their passion for each other.  I was left screaming at my Kindle - GET IT TOGETHER ALREADY!!  They made me feel a bit stabby and after a while that feeling got old.Elizabeth York's writing style was tough for me. I almost want to describe it as being too fast paced but that wasn't it. I felt her story telling jumped around and she inserted details or people into scenes that were meant to have your jaw dropping but instead it felt like she was trying too hard to shock the reader.  Several times while I was reading,  I had to stop and go back to reread a scene because I wasn't sure what exactly was happening.  I had a lot of WTF moments in both books.Overall, the plot and the characters (while irritating) in Brooklyn's Survival are interesting and entertaining. I am looking forward to reading the final installment and meeting the evil behind all of the misery as well as the happily ever after for this couple.  I would definitely suggest that you check the Brooklyn series out and see what you think of it.

Reviewer’s Note – Sinner’s Steel is the third book in the Sinner’s Tribe MC series.  I did not realize that fact when I started reading it but I was still able to enjoy this storyline even without knowing the past misadventures of the group and finer details about their rivalry with the Black Jacks. The author gives enough of an overview that you quickly know who is who and what their role is within the club. However, I would strongly recommend reading the books in order because I think Sinner’s Steel would be even more satisfying with the back stories.* * * * *I was so excited when I stumbled upon Sinner’s Steel.  I absolutely devoured Sarah Castille’s extreme fighter’s series and I could not wait to check out her MC books.  Her stories are always provocative – plus with each new publication her books get hotter and more stimulating.  So I knew she would give me a bunch of incredibly badass alpha men to enjoy.  And I was not wrong – holy hotness – I loved this group of ruffians and their kinky ways.  I cannot wait to get to know them all.Zane, Evie and Jagger (who is the President of Sinner’s Tribe) have best friends with each other since they were kids.  Long story short – as young adults Zane and Evie’s feelings became way than just friendship but tragedy struck and the future they dreamed of together was crushed.  They both feel betrayed by the harsh realities of their lives and have carried the weight of their past mistakes for nine years.Sinner’s Steel is Zane and Evie’s second chance love story.  Zane was a freaking severe and powerful character.  His smart, dirty mouth will get your lady bits tingling; while his protective side will have you swooning.  Everything about him will make you want to rip off your clothes and tie yourself to his bed.  He is balanced out with a completely kickass female lead in Evie.  She was just as fierce as Zane as well as smart, clever and independent woman.  Honestly, these two were quite the duo and I was consumed by their scenes – I couldn’t put their book down.This couple’s road toward happily ever after is rough and under heavy gun fire.  They need to deal with all kinds of crazy MC drama which impedes their already complicated reunion.  It’s a hot mess but it makes for especially entertaining reading.I absolutely loved every moment of this story and definitely recommend this MC romance.  No one wants to miss out on the intense and erotic connection Zane and Evie share.

I am a competitive person by nature, so I really enjoy books where the main couple's unfolding romance initiates from a competition.  If it is written well, this type of storyline can be incredible. The character's ensuing battle to further their own personal ambitions versus what their heart desires can be the foundation to hijinks, work place hilarity and some serious sexual tension - thus giving a reader a impressive book to enjoy.  So Irresistibly Yours' blurb called to me like a siren's song and I could not wait to read it.As someone who has not read any of the Stilettos books, (an error I plan to correct asap) I had no clue the greatness that was waiting for me inside the pages of Irresistibly Yours. It was seriously amazing - I was completely enraptured by everything in this book. The friendships. The romance. The quick wit and banter. The plot.  I devoured Cole and Penelope's book in one afternoon because I just didn't want to stop reading their story.Cole and Penelope's relationship was lust at first sight but initially they stay just friends because of their delicate work situation.  Their personalities play off one another well and it created a fun dynamic.  But that connection was nothing compared the intensity of their feelings once they gave into the attraction they feel for one another.  That was truly spectacular.I think this author consistently creates characters that make you feel engaged with while you are reading their developing story - you want to be apart of their world. This group was seriously hilarious and entertaining.  After a few chapters, I wished I could just show up at the Oxford office so I could take the guys out for a beer (so I could flirt and drool). Or be friends with their wives so I could get invited to their dinner parties and gossip. (Their scheming and match making was the best!!) The scenes when they're just being friends, mocking and bantering with one another made laugh out loud.Irresistibly Yours is an awesome book and Lauren Layne is the master of writing fabulous romances.  Her characters gave me all of these great moments that made me happy plus a delectable love story that left me swooning.  I just loved it all.  I definitely suggest meeting Cole and Penelope as well as all of their friends - they are remarkable group of characters and have a can't miss romance.This book is a top recommendation from me and it already has me anticipating future books in the Oxford series.

September had me emotionally revved up. Sweet Jesus. I was furious at Mia a few times – screaming at my tablet – DO NOT EFFING DO ANYTHING YOU’LL REGRET. It was stressful. I ended up binge eating all my kids snacks to help get over all the freaking drama Audrey Carlan decided to put me through this month.Yep. September gave me all kinds of the feels. Sad. Happy. Angry. Scared. Generally stabby.  That’s a lot for only 105 pages.So much occurred in a small amount of time. It felt like everyone was in some sort of crisis and Mia’s heartache filled the pages of this month.  It was an emotional ride and I desperately needed to know how all the various situations were resolved.  I think I devoured it all in less than an hour – September was incredible an reading experience.  It was suspenseful, entertaining and it left me curious what was next for Mia.The Calendar Girl novellas are hands down my favorite serial series and I’ve got everyone I know hooked to Mia’s year long adventure.  Every month has a fresh plot that carries certain elements forward from previous months.  You never know where the author is going to take Mia and you – it’s exciting and I absolutely love it.If you’ve some how stumbled across this novella and are unsure whether or not you want to start the series; I highly recommend that you take a chance and read the first few months because I believe that is all that it will take to make you a fan as well. Mia’s story is a must read.

I absolutely adored The End Game.  It was entertaining and the characters were so driven that I couldn't help be captivated by the paths their lives were on.The book starts almost in the present and then it jets backwards a few years to when Brody and Jordan first met. Experiencing the two falling in love during their college years was fun and sweet but it was also incredibly tantalizing and alluring. Holy hotness!! It's excellent reading - definitely a book that you will not want to put down.The drama of their romance comes when the two move forward in their chosen careers.  Both are completely dedicated to competing in professional sports as well as to one another.  Except their new lifestyles tend to not allow for successful relationships. The physical distance is toppled with the pressure to excel and it all quickly becomes a heavy weight to carry.  How can you reach for a happily ever after with another when you are aiming for almost unreachable or unattainable stardom for yourself?!I thought that The End Game gave a realistic glimpse into what it's probably like for college athletes whose careers are turning professional. The hurdles and challenges are overwhelming but the author expressed it all well.  She created people that you felt such empathy for that as you read it felt like you were struggling through their issues with them.I was rooting for Jordan and Brody.  My heart was pounding for most of this book and I felt everything - the passion and the pain.  Highs and lows.  And I loved it all.I thought this was an awesome book.  It has everything you could ask for from a romance book - swoon worthy moments, laugh out loud scenes and amazing characters.  I highly recommend The End Game, get it today.

I have read a few books from M.S. Parker and they are consistently intriguing stories filled with interesting characters. The Wicked books, her newest series might be my favorite one yet from her – simply because I could not get enough from the characters. Their story is intense and was always leading me down an unexpected path.  It is truly awesome.In the first book, you are introduced to all the various characters and learn about their connections to one another.  Shae and Allen have a basically happy marriage and normal life – all seems well with them both.So when the plot shifts, you feel completely blindsided.  The safe cocoon of their world is rocked and suddenly you are curious as to what the hell happened.  Everything you knew is gone and where you imagined the story was going to go is nothing like the genius the author wrote.  Again, it is awesome.Honestly, as someone who has read this entire series – my recommendation is to save yourself time and just purchase all three books now.  Thanks to the thrilling and jaw dropping conclusion, the instant you finish A Wicked Lie, you will want to know what happens next.Definitely check this series out.

I absolutely cannot miss out on anything Kindle Alexander writes.  Her romances are always AMAZING and her latest release, Closet Confession was everything I could have wanted from a novella.  I devoured it in one sitting and would definitely recommend it to fans of this author or to new readers interested in m/m romances.  It was filled to the brim with enticing men who are way sexy as well as incredibly sweet.The novella dives right into a busy evening at the ER with Dr. Derek Babineaux and Justin Delacroix. Their story alternates from both of their perspectives and they are equally intriguing people.  After a few chapters with them, I was ready to fake an illness and head to their hospital.  Because seriously - holy freaking hotness!!  Intelligent and altruistic men are completely alluring and arousing - especially when they want each other.  I loved these two!For the majority of the plot, it feels like Derek and Justin are strangers but then you realize there is much more to their connection.  Since this is a quick read, I don't want to give away too many details regarding what is going on with them but not knowing all the particular facts about their lives was a bit confusing at times. However, this was not a flaw for me - it only cemented my desire to know them better and to read faster.You definitely get to a point in Closet Confession when everything all just clicks into place.  There is just enough story to be satisfying without leaving you as a reader feeling like you need more time or history from the characters, Derek and Justin.  Plus, I loved that this novella was freaking erotic and realistic.  It hits on all the right whoa momma triggers and left me with a huge smile on my smile.  It's awesome reading and you will completely enjoy getting to know these men.I think that Kindle Alexander does an excellent job creating characters that you're easily invested in.  She does this by teasing and tantalizing you with their lives, making you want just a few more pages and private moments. Everything she has produced is a top recommendation from me, including Closet Confession. I highly suggest you read it today!

As I finished the latest Cold Fury Hockey book, Ryker, I realized had the biggest smile on my face. I felt satisfied and happy in that way only an awesome romance can make you feel. I was all melty and in love.  It was amazing.When I originally saw the information for Ryker’s book, I could not wait to read his story – although it might have had something to do with the cover. Holy freaking hotness.  But then I met him in Zack’s book and I desperately wanted more because I instantly liked him.  He was loyal, smart and funny – his personality was sincere. Even though he came to the team with a broken heart, his two kids and a ton of baggage; I knew he would be a strong leader as well as an amazing addition to the team.Gray Brannon was the mastermind of bringing Ryker to the Cold Fury team but that isn’t what has her standing out in this story.  Her father just promoted her to be the General Manager of the team and she is the first women to ever take on this position.  The pressure to succeed is intense and Gray does not want to let anyone down.  Not her father, the team or the fans.  So her attraction and connection to Ryker could not have come at a worst time.As the season continues, the two realize that they have to hide their relationship even though they both want to share what they have found with their friends and family. However, there it too much is on the line – championships, careers and ultimately public opinion of everyone involved.  It tugs at your heart and you constantly carry the hope that it all works out.  That some how they all end up winners in their individual lives and in love.Gray and Ryker’s love story unfolds exceptionally well and I could not put it down.  Every moment between the two captured my attention and their story deepened my affection for the players on this team.  I absolutely loved this book.I cannot recommend Ryker or this series enough.  Definitely become a Cold Fury hockey fan today!

Holy crap. Being welcomed into Miguel and Blake's world (and their bedroom!!!!!) felt like a gift from the smutty book gods. Unsaid was filled with an oh so delicious and tantalizing plot as well as a spectacular love story.Fans of this series have been waiting a long time for Miguel and Blake's relationship to happen. We've been teased and tempted - desperate for this connection and attraction to no longer be ignored. And it was well worth the wait. Miguel and Blake are freaking intense sexy beasts who love fiercely and who like to play rough. They are perfect for one another.Thanks to a little interference from their friends, Miguel and Blake are given a chance to explore their chemistry. Except the road toward happily ever after for these two is a long and arduous one. They need to get past their previous relationship mistakes and their own individual fears. They have to learn how to be intimate with one another and most of all, they have to learn how to trust in love.Also thrown in for the reader's pleasure are updates on all that is Vive, Taddy and Lex - Blake's best friends. The drama and chaos of these four friend's lives on top of the boy's love story makes for such entertaining reading. I couldn't put the book down because of it.Overall, the sexual moments in Unsaid are incredible, but the storyline in the book is so much more. Miguel and Blake's romance balances between being hilarious to sexy - sweet to intense. I loved every moment of their journey. This book was seriously awesome and I highly recommend you check Unsaid out.

The conclusion to the Stark International trilogy, Under My Skin was incredible. J. Kenner not only wrapped up Jackson and Sylvia's story with the same passion that she started the series with - she exceeded all of my expectations.Diving back into their world, I remembered all that overwhelmed this couple. Criminal charges, extended families and their minor relationship issues. These two characters have to fight so hard just to enjoy their lives and one another. And the more I read, the more I honestly could not wait to see how Jackson and Sylvia would find their solace and get past all that troubled them.Their journey toward happily ever after goes back and forth quite a bit. Jackson struggles to depend on Sylvia because he fears his future; while Sylvia battles her own insecurities regarding what will become of their lives. With all that they have endured, you almost feel desperate for them because you feel their love for one another and it makes you want them to figure it all out.Overall, I truly liked this trilogy and how the plot played out. The characters and their drama kept me entertained for three books - I think I could have done without a few things but I am glad I found this series. It was an intense and passionate read - one that I definitely recommend you check it out.

So many long, hidden truths were revealed this month.  It.  Was.  Freaking.  AWESOME.August picks up right where July left off - with a happy and settled Calendar Girl.  Mia's year long journey to pay off her father's debt is past the half way point and she's truly feels like she's taking her life in the direction she wants it to go.  She's excited about the future and eager to finish her last few jobs.This month, Mia is off to Texas to pretend to be a version of herself for a wealthy cowboy named Maxwell Cunningham.  (He needs someone with her name and birthday for a specific reason) Max and his family is very nice and welcoming to Mia - it almost feels like he wishes their lie was the truth.  And before long Mia does, too.  However, there is something a little off to the whole situation.As the story unfolds, you're emotionally drawn into Mia's life more so than previous months.  It wasn't all about Mia interacting with some hot, sexy man candy - a new and shocking reality hits her hard.  Everything Mia thought she knew about her life might just be a lie.It left me desperate for more. Honestly, I'm not sure how I am going to feel at the end of this series - I think I'm going to have to grieve the loss of Mia's debt and the end of her career as a escort. I anticipate each new month and it's because the latest release is always better than the last installment.The Calendar Girl series completely surprised me.  When I first heard about it, I didn't jump at reading it.  I figured it would just be 12 installments of same erotic sex scenes with 12 different strangers and I wasn't sure that I could read it without eventually judging Mia's character.  But Mia has had the most incredible odyssey of self discovery and I'm glad I'm on it with her.  It has been an especially entertaining and ever evolving storyline.I love it and the Calendar Girl series is a top recommendation.

So if you ever meet me in real life, you will find that I have OCD.  I love order - I need everything to be black-and-white.  See a problem. Fix a problem.  (I totally appreciate the grey aspect of life but prefer structure) I tend to not be a fan of paranormal romance books because they go to places that my brain usually has difficulty accepting.  However, I find myself addicted to the Dr. Charlotte Stone series by Karen Robards and it's all about loving the most unavailable man ever.A quick refresher or introduction to this series.  Dr. Charlotte Stone aka Charlie is an expert in criminal pathology and she studies serial killers that are on death row at a local prison. (Sounds like a good time, right?!)  Anyway, Charlie met, interviewed and fell in love with Michael Garland - man convicted of murdering quite a few women.  However, he is now dead and comes to Charlie as a ghost. The man she is in love with is an apparition. A freaking ghost!!Anyway, moving forward in my review - we're onto book 4, The Last Time I Saw Her, the authors latest release in this series. Charlie has just returned home after helping the FBI with a case and her life is in shambles.  She's lost the love of her life and karma has placed what looks like his identical twin in her face. Feeling like she finally has the missing piece to the murders Michael was convicted of - she is on a mission to prove his innocence.Except it all goes to hell. Charlie's world becomes absolute chaos. As it unfolded, my jaw was on the ground and I was swept up into the drama. Charlie is in danger and trapped. She's putting so much fear and desolation out into the world that Michael feels it. And their love for one another is so powerful that even death cannot keep him from trying to save her.Everything that follows that moment on and until the end of the book is spectacular. Some scenes require you to suspend your disbelief in reality but you're so invested in this couple getting their happily ever after that you do it willingly.As a fan of romantic suspense books, there isn't a moment in this book or the other stories in this series that doesn't do it for me. The criminal mysteries are awesome. They're intense and captivating. The love between Michael and Charlie - it's the stuff that we romance lovers dream of. A love that cannot be forgotten and will follow us even if we are no longer of this world.So I guess I will leave my review with this - Karen Robards is a masterful writer.  Her books about Charlie and Michael are a top recommendation from me.  They make my heart pound because of the chemistry between the main characters and the from the undying connection they share.  Definitely don't miss out on The Last Time I Saw Her.

This series is like a freaking onion - there are so many layers that you need to peel away to get towards the center and find the truth of Shae Lockwood's love life.Shae is trying to move forward and is learning to cope with shocking reality surrounding the death of her husband, Allen. She is struggling through the legal battle with Allen's family, mysterious threats and learning how to run their vineyard. Through it all, Jasper has been her friend and companion in grief. However, in the second book their relationship changes. It develops into something more and it felt like I could finally sigh in relief for Shae.That feeling did not last long.Because M.S. Parker hates Shae and is determined to put her through all kinds of hell. Although it sucks for her - it makes for crazy, entertaining reading.  This book's plot is seriously awesome and I devoured A Wicked Kiss in one sitting. I was on the edge of my seat, waiting for the next moment of passion or danger.  (The scene in the closet!!!!)I didn't think after the conclusion the first book, A Wicked Lie, that the deception or drama could get any crazier and then I finished A Wicked Kiss. Sweet Jesus. I still don't think I've picked up my jaw up off the ground. My inner romantic is determined that Shae finds some peace and happiness  because it refuses to believe there is any legitimacy to all that I fear about some characters.  Even though I have a few doubts (well planted seeds M.S), I will accept nothing less than a happily ever after.Overall, this book left me feeling desperate to get the final installment next month and find out the truth.A Wicked Kiss is not a standalone - you need to read A Wicked Lie first to understand all that is going on in the second installment.  I highly recommend you get caught up on this highly erotic suspense series today - then you will understand why I think it is a must read.

The premise of this series is incredibly fun. Three wealthy, attractive playboys who are all best friends are going to have their feet knocked right out from beneath them by a little thing called love. The first book was awesome (I loved Shep!!) so I was desperately waiting for In the Dark - Gabe and Lucy's story.  I was slightly worried that I would not like it as much as I did Fair Game.  But I was wrong.  I LOVED Gabe.  He constantly surprised me and his romance with Lucy made me smile.Every summer, Gabe is required to spend time with his family.  He usually endures the time drinking and sleeping his way through the local female population - taking nothing seriously because his life is already planned for him.  He will work in the family business.  He will marry the appropriate woman and not only will she be 'perfect'  but she will also bring some sort of beneficial social or business connection for the Walker family.  The idea of it all makes he miserable.So when Gabe starts spying on the hottie who lives in the house beside their vacation home, he just thinks it will be another fling.  He has no clue that his heart has found his mate and there will be no other choice but to surrender to it.Lucy is the girl next door and she is nothing like Gabe assumed she is.  Funny and kind - you instantly like her. Plus she doesn't fall over herself to get Gabe's attention even though her heart pounds in her chest whenever he is near.  As their romance blooms, you're quickly enchanted by the couple. You are quickly caught up in their sexual chemistry and passion.  It is intense and exciting.But both Gabe and Lucy have secrets hanging over their heads.  You are anticipating the moment that their truths are revealed - that Gabe can only marry someone his family deems worthy and that Lucy's life is nothing like the image he has painted in his head.  Reality finds them both when they return to university in the fall.  When it all falls apart, you're holding your breath.  Hopeful that they can work it all out and find their happily ever after together.Monica Murphy's In the Dark captured the feeling of being young and how it felt to have a summer romance that was suddenly so much more.  It was spectacular.  I highly suggest you read it as well as the other books in this series.

I am squealing out loud while doing the Larry/Balky Dance of Joy. I LOVED JULY!!This month we are off to Miami for an adventure with the super enticing and amazing Anton Santiago. He was so completely different from what I expected and I absolutely loved him for it. Her time spent with Anton provides Mia with a safe harbor to overcome and heal from all that happened last month.  Her transformation emotionally from the start of the book to the end is incredible.But that isn’t what has me so freaking giddy.Each month in the Calendar Girl series readers have been introduced to new and for the most part fabulous characters. Individually and as a whole they have impacted Mia’s life. However, there has been one person who changed the course of her life more than anyone else.  In July, a huge part of the storyline is about Mia being honest with herself and with him.It’s a huge leap of faith for her. And it is FREAKING AWESOME!!July might have been my favorite month but the lead into August has me stalking Audrey Carlan for teasers and hits.  I can’t wait to read it – this storyline just keeps getting better and better!  If you have not started this series, get caught up now – I think it’s about to go nuts in Mia’s world!

I LOVED this book – Chaos seriously rocks.Each time Jamie Shaw releases a new book in the Mayham series, I anticipate how she will outdo the previous story.  I get absolutely consumed with each book’s plot and even when I think her romances can’t get any better, they always do.  With her latest release, Chaos, this author gave me everything I wanted as a romance reader and more.Kit Larson is incredibly bad ass. Fierce. In Chaos, she has decided come hell or high water that she is going to achieve her dreams – she wants to be a professional guitarist with the band The Last Ones to Know. But more than that – she’s wants to be a freaking rock star.There are only a few obstacles standing in her way.  Because even though her goals are her own and she will achieve them – her life is now entwined with that of Shawn Scarlett. The only other item her heart desperately aches for and craves.Kit and Shawn as well as the other members of the band went to the same high school.  However, other than one moment in time, they have no ties or history between themselves. But in the present, they develop a friendship and connect on a deeper level because of their love for music. They mesh together like they’re two parts of the same whole.It’s spectacular reading. But not nearly as amazing as the moments when Kit and Shawn give into their attraction for one another. The passion and lust – you feel it to your core.  I could not stop reading their book because I craved more from them.* * * * *The thought of being trapped on a tour bus – even one filled with ridiculously hot men – for any extended period time does not sound enticing.  At all.  However every time I join The Last Ones to Know on tour, I realize something. I would totally run over my grandmother to spend time with this band.It’s because they make me laugh. They make me swoon. They get my ladies bits tingling. I devour every moment in these books and I am often ready to start all over again once I reach the last page. It’s awesome.Chaos was a great addition to the series and is a top recommendation from me.  Definitely take the time to read the Mayhem series.

The Secret Sister is the perfect example of how a well written book can mix a dramatic and  suspenseful tragedy with a sweet and romantic love story. The author plays the two aspects off one another, intensifying the characters connection to each other - creating a more solid bond as well as entertaining plot.Maisey returned home to help her brother overcome his personal issues but maybe more so to try and heal herself.
