Like so many people here, I'm a fan of the original Filmation He-Man series, and was quite skeptical about ordering this 2002 version.  But the price was almost unbelievably low (still is as of this writing) for the entire series, so I figured I'd take a chance.  And I'm glad I did, because this He-Man is actually a very good series.  True, it lacks some of the lighthearted tone and cheerful optimism of the original, but the fact is, the animation is a LOT better.  Almost old the old characters are here, just with more modern makeovers.  I also like the fact that Prince Adam and He-Man really seem like two different characters, rather than the Clark Kent/Superman-style not-so-secret identity used in the original show.As a hardcore fan of these characters, I'll always prefer the original series.  It was, after all, the last fully American hand-drawn animated series produced by a major studio.  Most every action cartoon since has been influenced by highly-overrated Japanese "anime" (this is apparent in the fight scenes of this series, though no where near as prevalent as it is in the 1990 The New Adventures of He-Man, Vol. 1).  But if you'll give the 2002 series a try, you might find that it's really not SO different after all.

As a huge fan of Halloween, monsters and cartoons, I expected to absolutely love this rarely-seen 1972 Rankin/Bass special.  The t.v. special had fallen into relative obscurity over the years, even though it was a sequel of sorts to the earlier stop-motion cult classic Mad Monster Party.  Indeed, this DVD debut was the first time I'd ever seen it.  Unfortunately, "Mad Mad Mad Monsters" uses hand-drawn animation rather than RB's wonderful stop-motion magic, and that's only the start of the problems.The main thing (and again, I WANTED so much to love it) is that the special just isn't very engaging or funny.  The marginal plot has Baron Von Frankenstein (voiced by a fairly good Karloff imitator, since the legendary star had passed on by this time) creating a bride for his monster, then planning a wedding packed with some wonderfully ghoulish guests.  Getting all the classic monsters together worked fine in Mad Monster Party, but just falls flat here.  The original feature was helped along by some inspired, wacky musical numbers.  Sadly, these don't exist in the follow-up.  The humour, such as it is, falls a few steps below the "Laugh-In"-style gags of Groovie Goolies: Saturday Mourning Collection (sample joke: Upon seeing his two creatures meet, Frankenstein declares, "It's like you were MADE for each other. . .wait a minute, you WERE made for each other!").Fairing slightly better is the bonus feature, an episode of Rankin/Bass's "Festival of Family Classics" entitled "Jack O'Lantern" (also from 1972).  The half-hour shows were retellings of popular folk heroes and children's stories.  Like the main feature, it features hand-drawn animation akin to "Frosty the Snowman."I've given the disc 3 stars because I feel it is imporant to have rare, almost-forgotten animated shows released, and because the prints used by Classic Media are really quite good.  There are no additional features, including addtional subtitles or language tracks.  If you have kids (even grown-up ones) who are monster fans, this might even find a place among their annual Halloween viewing.  And for the money, you could really do a lot worse.

OK, I realize this is a toy, and that it was designed to be put together by a child's small fingers.  But as an adult Doctor Who collector, I had some trouble with it.  This is my first build-your-own toy from Character Building (apparently, a British version of Lego toys), and I was amazed at the number of small pieces included.  The stickers, though very atractive and required to complete the TARDIS, were problematic as well.  Thankfully, a few extras were included for those who, like myself, are inclined to make mistakes.Anyway, it's a nice TARDIS replica, and the Doctor and Amy figures are just adorable. He even has a tiny little sonic screwdriver.  I look forward to collecting the other figures in the set, but haven't decided if I want any more playsets.  If you are a collector, or have a child who enjoys the show, I think this is a pretty good item overall.

Some shows thrive not on the quality of their writing or production values, but on the strength of likable, dependable personalities in front of the camera.  Melissa & Joey is such a show.  Sure, WHO'S THE BOSS? already tackled the "manny" premise (although it was called "housekeeper" in the 80's), and mismatched couples have been the bread & butter of sitcoms since at least the 1960's.  But by casting two beloved t.v. stars (no coincidence, either, since Hart and Lawrence do double duty as executive producers), the show manages to rather easily hook viewers.Truth be told, I found the first 3 or so episodes to be very average.  But things start to pick up as the chemistry builds between the leads, and the relatively small supporting cast starts to find their own voices.  Melissa Joan Hart has been a gifted comic actress since her pre-teen Nickelodeon years, and it's to her credit than the somewhat edgy Mel Burke remains a thoroughly likable character.  Joey Lawrence, himself a 30+ year t.v. veteran, is solid as well, with a slightly more believable character with which to work.One word of caution: Don't be fooled by the "ABC Family" logo.  Melissa & Joey, while never really wallowing in gutter humor, can aim low with the best (or worst?) of them at times.  Still, for appropriate ages, it's as good as anything on network television at the moment.  Whether you consider that a compliment or not probably depends on how much t.v. you watch.  My wife and I watch quite a bit, and even though the show IS very familiar at times, it's still entertaining and fun to watch.  And really, does a sitcom need to do more than that?

Now THIS is how you make a DVD of a fan-favorite show!  In addition to the rarely-seen special itself (more on that in a minute), you get a wealth of great extra material.  I, for one, enjoy learning all the behind-the-scenes info about shows, especially animated ones.  There's over an hour of documentary material here, focusing on the holiday special itself, and the universe of He-Man in general.  There's a pair of great-looking art cards (apparently there are 16 available in all; I got a terric watercolor painting of She-Ra, and one featuring characters from both series), the rarely-seen music video "I Have the Power," plus a brief making-of segment on the video, a well-designed "character profiles" feature, trivia, and the complete script.  The packaging itself is full of colorful artwork, an added bonus for fans.As for the show itself, it holds up fairly well (SPOILERS AHEAD).  Unlike many cartoon holiday episodes, however, Christmas is really only a small part of the story.  Orko's bumbling accidentally brings two Earth children to Eternia, where they share the news of Christmas with the denizens of She-Ra's world (and since this IS a kids' fantasy show, the legend of Santa take precedence over the Christian holiday, which gets only a throwaway line about Bethlehem).  It's all innocent fun, although He-Man fans may cringe at how easily Skeletor is swayed by the Christmas spirit.If you're a fan of He-Man and/or She-Ra, there's no question you should have this in your collection.  And if you just like animated holiday fun, give it a try.  As a fan of both shows, I couldn't be happier with this first-class package.

As a child of the seventies, I have great memories of this and many other Hanna-Barbera Saturday morning cartoons.  Viewing them now at age 43, I still enjoy them, although many years of exposure to so much animation has perhaps made me a bit more jaded.As you may know, HB were pioneers of the art of "limited animation," which came about in the late 50's and early 60's.  A simple description of limited animation is that the characters don't move nearly as much as, say, those of the Looney Tunes of the Golden Age from the late 1930's thru the 1950's.  It's a time-saving and money-saving technique that worked well for animated shows made for the demanding schedules of weekly television.Anyway, there were still many colorful and funny cartoons made using this technique.  And thankfully, Speed Buggy is one of them.  Like many other HB cartoons of the seventies (Goober And The Ghost Chasers, Josie and the Pussycats - The Complete Series, etc.), Speed Buggy follows the comic adventures of a group of young people as they get involved in various mysteries or tangle with madcap villains.  It's all done with a sense of innocent fun, with the Mel Blanc-voiced lovable title character front and center.Like other recent cartoon releases from Warner Bros., Speed Buggy is "made on demand" using DVD-R discs.  This is my second such purchase (after Herculoids: The Complete Series), and I'm happy to report that the series looks and sounds great.  There are, however, no extra features of any kind.  No alternate-language tracks or subtitles, just a menu allowing you to select episodes or "Play All."  And as much as I still enjoy the cartoons, I just can't justify a perfect score for a bare-bones release.  Hopefully, WB is seeing that there is still a market for classic animation, and will start putting a little more effort into these releases.  However, if you have fond memories of Speed Buggy, or want to introduce your children or grandchildren to the show, this is definitely worth adding to your collection.

As any boy who came of age in the late 60's or early 70's can tell you, The Herculoids was probably the greatest thing to ever hit Saturday morning television.  In an era when funny, talking animals shows were starting to give way to more adventurous fare like Johnny Quest and various superhero shows, the Alex Toth-designed Herculoids delivered the goods better than any other series.For the uninitiated, the show followed the adventures of humanoids Zandor, Tara and their son Dorno on the planet Quasar.  A unique assortment of creatures aided them: Zok, the flying dragon; a giant with rock-like skin named Igoo; the fireball-shooting triceratops-like Tundro; and the amusing blob-like Gloop and Gleep.  Trouble came (and came often) in the form of invaders for whom the planet Quasar must have seemed the ultimate prize.  Hideous monsters and robots of all sorts set their sights on the heroes' homeworld, and were met with deadly resistance.  You want morals at the end of your cartoon?  Forget it. . .the Herculoids were going to defend their turf, and justice was final on planet Quasar.This two-disc set collects all 18 original shows (technically, 36 episodes, since each half hour is comprised of 2 segments of 10 or so minutes each).  There is a very brief featurette about the series, in which various modern artists and writers gush about Alex Toth, and celebrate the boyhood fantasy charm of the show (one commentator points out that the Herculoids was pretty much non-stop stuff blowing up).  And that's the gist of the series, really: monsters, ray guns, lots of action.  As a fan from childhood, I was happy to see that in today's PC world of bland animated kids' shows, The Herculoids holds up very well.As is becoming more and more common, these Warner Archive discs are manufactured DVD-R's, meaning it is possible that customers may experience some playback difficulties in some machines.  I played both discs on my DVD recorder/player and my computer using WMP with no problems.  The prints used are of good quality, although the occasional debris does pop up.  As classic animation remains a niche market and sells no where near as well as modern shows, I'd imagine this is the best release we'll ever see of The Herculoids.  Certainly it's a no-brainer for fans.  And for parents who aren't overly considered about the cartoon violence, I think it's still a fine choice, especially for young boys.

That's a quote from Ronnie Dunn on a recent CMT interview.  And although I was a little perplexed by the comment prior to hearing this album (What? He didn't enjoy having 20 years of hits with Brooks & Dunn?), I get it now.  Because--and this may be hard to get across in a written review--that album just FEELS so natural and right for Dunn's voice.  I was also concered by the lead single, "Bleed Red," which I was quick to dismiss as another in a line of well-made but somewhat boring ballads akin to B & D's mega-hit "Believe."  And while the song has grown on me, I'm still happy to report that it isn't really representative of the album.RONNIE DUNN contains quite a few up-tempo bar-ready rockin' country tunes.  And that's a good thing.  "Let the Cowboy Rock" and "Singer in a Cowboy Band" wouldn't have been out of place on a Brooks & Dunn album.  Yet, the difference is in the music.  Dunn's band is super-tight, wearing the familiar chords and rhythms like badges of honor.  And when he does slow things down, the band offers up classic country music, well-played. Songs like "I Just Can't Help Myself" and "I Don't Dance" could just be future classics.  There's even a sidetrip south of the border with "How Far to Waco."  Dunn even takes on the economy in the somber "Cost of Livin'", with its uneasy chorus speaking of "Three bucks and change at the pump."Give this solo debut a try, I think you'll enjoy it.

This action camera is very small and light weight. It comes with all the accessories you need to get started. It comes with waterproof housing, USB cable, suction cup mount, helmet mount, and a handlebar mount. It can also be mounted on a standard tripod or selfie stick. The back of the device features a resistive touchscreen. The screen is small but looks decent. These types of touchscreens aren't as responsive as modern capacitive ones but there really aren't many settings to change anyway. You can change the resolution of the videos or photos or you can view photos or play a slide show from the screen and that's about it. There is an HDMI out port on the side for slideshows. The top res for videos is 1080p and they record in the avi format. It says up to 12mp photos on the camera menu but the photo quality especially in low isn't that great to be honest. I thought videos looked pretty decent. The low light is just okay but it works great in daylight. It has a pretty wide angle lens so there is a bit of barrel distortion. There isn't a memory card included. It uses a Micro SD/Transflash. I put in a 32GB card and it says it can record nearly 3 hours of video on the FHD setting. I tested the waterproof housing by running water over it and then putting it in a glass full of water for a few minutes and it seemed to do it's job. You could easily use this as a dashcam also with the included suction mount. Overall, it's a decent value if you consider that you are getting everything you need to get started.I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I always point out any issues I have regardless of how I acquired it.

This cable modem has worked great for me and I haven't had any issues so far. I just got 100Mbps service from CableOne and my speedtest are around 112Mbps so it's definitely working as it should. I understand it supports IPV6 but I guess CableOne isn't offering it yet? Overall, a great choice and it certainly helps not having to pay 6-8 dollars a month for a modem.

I was honestly expecting a much larger and bulky item than this. In the photos which are obviously photoshopped and not to scale it looks like it could be the size of a mailbox. I actually was hoping it would be relatively low profile and it's exactly what I wanted. It's smaller than a deck of cards and will work really well for things like posts, fences and outdoor stairways. It's very lightweight and the back of the unit has a power switch that's covered with a clear membrane to make it water resistant.  I've placed mine on the post on my front porch. I plan to acquire more and put one on each one. I didn't really find anything wrong with the item. I did note that one of the photos on the listing show a 3M adhesive pad to install it but that definitely wasn't included in the package I received.I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This comes in an absolutely huge 4 ounce bottle that will last me a long time. I'm not sure what the shelf life is. It also comes with a very nice glass dropper. I need to find more uses for it than just putting it in my diffuser. I've been mixing 5 drops of lavender oil and 2 drops of peppermint oil. This provides a pleasant scent that fills the room quickly and lingers for several hours. It also has the added benefit of relieving nasal congestion. I'm not really sure what else I can add to that. It's a great bargain for the size you get and will likely last a long time.I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This does not affect how I review an item.

These headphones arrive in one of those zip lock bags and I was a bit skeptical when I saw the package at first but I was very pleasantly surprised that there is a small hard zippered clamshell case inside.  Inside the case you will find the earbuds along with different sizes of both black and blue eartips. You also get the little caps that screw off to change the sound. I've compared them side by side and there is a definite difference in the bass so they aren't just a gimmick. I think the Pop version offered the most bass and those are the ones I'll likely stick with most of the time. I do recommend keeping them in the included bag and they are certain to get lost if you aren't vigilant. The headphones feature high quality a metal design and the cable is flat and tangle free which I really appreciate. There is an in line control but it doesn't have volume controls. The audio quality if quite good and they produce a lot of volume. Overall, they are a great pair of in ear headphones.Sentey sent me a pair of these in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I haven't gamed in nearly 5 years and the last game I had was probably Oblivion. I recently purchased a new mid range gaming computer and decided to try Skyrim out since Elder Scrolls games have always been my favorite games. I have really been impressed with the quality of this game even if it is 4 years old. It gives you many many hours of entertainment and at the current price for the PC versions it's a true bargain. The graphics are still amazing and I love games that let you explore and choose your own path. You also get all of the add-ons when you purchase this Legendary version which add even more value.

I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. Being I guy I decided that I couldn't use it so I gave it to my mother. She was really pleased with it and thought the quality was very good. It arrives in a nice micro-suede drawstring bag. We were pleasantly surprised by how nice this set looks. The main gemstones/crystals are large, clear, and really gleam in the light. There are small crystal colored stones on the leaves of the bracelet and earrings that are kind of hard to distinguish in the photos. The necklace and bracelet chains both look great and are well made and have nice lobster clasps. The earrings are equally good. Overall, it's just a generally nice set and a great price for what you get.

I'm not sure if I was expecting too much from this router but I haven't been able to achieve the full speeds of my 100Mbps internet over Wi-Fi. I have an iPhone 6S Plus connected via Wireless AC and the best speed I've got is 86mbps down but 50-60 is more common. My computer connected via Ethernet gets 112mbps. Unfortunately, my newly purchased computer only has 802.11n and no 5Ghz and it has topped out at 60Mbps.Despite the issues above it has been a huge improvement over my old TP-Link WRT841nd which was topping out around 20Mbps. I'm also getting much better coverage in the back of my house where there would be infrequent drops in signal.The design looks great. It features a glossy white polycarb finish with a metallic silver stand that makes it look higher end. The ports on the back are easy to get to while also kind of hiding the cable. There are switches to turn off both the router and just the Wi-Fi.Overall, this has been a decent router for me so far I'm just disappointed that I'm not getting anywhere near the speeds I was expecting. I received the version 1 of the router by purchased just a few days before this review.

I really like the keyboard so far. It features backlighting and you can choose from several different colors. The keys have a decent amount of feedback and I find that I can type quite quickly on it. This is the first time I've used a keyboard that isn't chiclet style in about 9 years or so and I'm finding that I'm liking have full sized keys again. The only downside to that is with this keyboard at least it is noisier to type on. Once you install the software you can assign macros to the G keys on the side. It's has a good amount of weight to it which makes it feel a little more expensive than it is. You may think from the photos that the red bars across the top and bottom are led lit but they are not so you will have to be content with red if you purchase this keyboard. You can choose from 3 levels of brightness or turn the backlights completely off. You can also set the lights to stay on all the time or set them to breath/fade on and off. There are volume and playback controls but you have to press the FN button to access them. Unfortunately, there is only one FN button on the right side and I really wish there were one on both sides of the keyboard. You can lock the Windows key so it doesn't function in order to prevent you from minimizing the window or something else while you are playing a game. Overall, the keyboard is pretty nice for the price. As mentioned above the only things I didn't really like were that the keys are kind of loud when typing and I didn't like that the red trim is permanent. I felt like the red clashes with the colors of the backlight if you change them to anything other than red.I think the mouse feels like it's a little higher quality device than the keyboard. It's made of higher grade plastics, has a rubberized matte black finish, has a nice cloth covered cable, and it's well weighted. You can choose from 3 different DPI settings and the led lit logo on the mouse will change according to what setting you are using. Green is 800 DPI, Red 1600, and Blue 2400. You can set up profiles in the software settings and assigning buttons how you want them. The scroll lights up and has a red grippy rubber ring around it. The mouse fits my hand almost perfectlyu and I find it very comfortable to use. There are extra skid pads included in the box which was a nice extra.Overall, for the price, both the keyboard and mouse are great items. You can definitely find something better quality but I doubt you would beat the price. Also, I would recommend the keyboard for anyone looking for a backlit keyboard.Disclaimer: I was sent a sample of this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This does not affect how I review an item.

This MP3 player is very small and lightweight. It would be great for running or gym if you want to leave your smartphone at home. It features an FM  radio also. You can supplement the built in storage with your own Micro SD card.  The audio quality is pretty good. The interface is easy to use once you learn which buttons to press. You use the M button to make most menu selections. It can also act as a voice recorder. There is video playback as well but I would expect much from it considering the size and resolution of the display. Overall, it's a decent player for the price and like I said above these are great as a secondary device or even a cheap device to give to a kid.I was sent a discount for one of these in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I was immediately impressed with this bike light set when I received it. It comes with a high quality LED flashlight and bike mount, taillight, 2 rechargeable batteries, an adapter for AAA batteries, and extra Cr32 batteries for the taillight. These are all high quality components. The flashlight is made of aluminum and comes with a wrist strap as well. It can be easily detached and used as a regular flash light. It has two power settings and a strobing mode that are turned on by soft pressing the power button. You can also adjust the magnification on the flashlight lens. The rechargeable batteries for this last well and there is an adapter to use 3 AAA batteries in emergencies. The taillight is also pretty good quality and you can set it to stay on or flash. It takes CR32 batteries and there is an extra set included. It attaches very easily with a rubber strap.  Overall, this is an excellent set and I really love the detachable flashlight. Actually, I will probably use the flashlight even when I'm not riding my bike.I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This does not affect how I review an item and I will point out any issues I have.

I don't travel often but I like using a backpack when I do.  That is why I  really like that this backpack can be stored away in such a small pouch when not in use. When stored it is around the size of a small toiletry bag. To open it you just unzip the pouch and pull the bag out. The pouch stays attached when using the backpack so no worries about losing it. It stores just as easily, you just roll it back up and stuff it inside the pouch. The bag is made of a parachute like nylon. It's lightweight but well made. There is a pouch on the inside for laptops but it isn't padded so a pouch or case is essential. The outside features to mesh pouches on the side for stuff like water bottles and there is a zippered mesh pouch on the front. Overall, this is a great bag if you are like me and don't need to use it often and like the ability to store it away without taking up a lot of space. This is small enough you could easily leave it in a car and it will probably fit in most consoles. The only thing I didn't like was due to keeping it stored in the pouch it will look a bit wrinkly most of the time.I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I will point out any issues I have regardless of how I purchased an item.

This comes in a surprisingly huge 4 ounce bottle with a nice glass dropper. I've been using this in my oil diffuser. I put in about 8-10 drops and it is the most effective oil I've used in my diffuser so far. It only takes 5 or so minutes to be able to smell it throughout my living areas. I turn it off after 5-10 minutes and the scent lingers for hours. I haven't used it for anything else yet but as a air freshener it works great. I have pretty bad allergies and store bought air fresheners absolutely kill me and essential oils don't bother me much so I really like using this. I'm considering trying a few drops in my scent free laundry detergent to see how that works out. As large as this bottle is and as little as it takes to put in a diffuser I can see this lasting a long time. I highly recommend it if you like the smell of lavender.I received a discount for this in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This doesn't change how I review an item and I will always point out any  issues I have with an item.

I'm about 5' 11" with a medium build and I got the X-Large and they fit perfectly. These look great and are extremely comfortable. They have two deep pockets on the front and a single back pocket. The back pocket works great for a wallet. The legs are cuffed with elastic. The left leg has Oakley written down the side in large letters. There is a drawstring around the waist. Overall, this is a great, comfortable, high quality pair of sweatpants.

These space bags are of great quality. You get three different sizes. I like that there are different sizes so I can put smaller items in and not have to worry about filling a huge bag. All you do is fold up the items you want in and stick them inside the bags, zip them up, get out your vacuum and attach it to the bag and suck the air out. There are black caps included to place over them to help maintain the seal. Overall, these bags are well made, super easy to use, and save a lot of space.

I haven't had this wallet for long but I'm super impressed with it already. It came is a nice gift box. It's a great quality wallet in general not even considering the added security of RFID protection. It is made of a high quality natural colored leather with a matte finish. It smells like real leather. It features a double stitching around the outside edges which looks great. The inside of the wallet features 10 card slots including the two with transparent windows, 2 hidden card slots, 1 cash slot, and one zippered cash slot. The inside of the wallet is lined with a metallic material that blocks RFID signals in order to protect your cards from theft. Please note this is the type of leather that will likely get that distressed scuffed look over time and while I love this type of finish I just wanted to let you know.Overall, I've found this to be an excellent quality leather wallet. It looks and feels great and is well made. I like the added benefit of RFID protection since all cards are getting chips the risk of theft will certainly grow.DISCLAIMER: I was sent a discount code for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This does not affect how I review an item and I will report any issues I have.

These headphones work surprisingly well. They have built in bendable wires so you can wrap the around your ears and they stay firmly on place. I have always had difficulty finding earbuds that stay in my ears even when not active and I've found these to be the best fitting earbuds I've ever used.They sound great and have a great amount of volume. There is an in line control and mic. There aren't any volume buttons.Probably the only thing I didn't like 100% is the cable isn't tangle free. Maybe it's harder to include that with this type of earbuds but it would have been a great addition.You get 3 sizes of silicone ear tips.Overall, it's a great pair of earbuds and I recommend them especially for running and gym but they work great for general use also.Disclamer: I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This does not affect how I review an item and I will point out any issues that I have regardless of how I acquired them.

This is a pretty good MP3 player. It comes with a pair of decent quality white earbuds, a wrist strap, and a USB cable. It has a really lightweight build. It's rubberized matte black plastic with red trim. There is a loop on to for attaching the wrist strap, power slider on the slide, USB & headphone jack on the bottom, and a Micro SD slot on the left. The front has a nice sized screen and a 4 way control button with a function button in the center.To power it on you slide the power button on the side of the device. Once on, you can scroll through the various options by using the skip buttons. To make a selection you use the center button. To go back you press the vol button.It does feature Bluetooth for connecting it with your wireless speaker or headphones and it works pretty well. Please note unless I was doing something wrong you can only use the Bluetooth function with music and don't have access to the radio or video options while in use.In addition to music you can watch videos, listen to FM radio, record voice, and read text files. I consider text and video novelties only on a screen of this size and resolution.The sound quality is pretty good. It has a good amount of volume and sounds good in general.Overall, it's a nice MP3 PLAYER for the price. The Bluetooth function sets it apart from many other players. It's nice that it has a built in Micro SD slot to compliment the 4GB of built in storage. With the Bluetooth function considered I would recommend this for running or exercising since you can utilize those wireless headphones with it.DISCLAIMER I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This does not affect how I review an item and I will point out any issues that I have.

These earrings arrived in a very nice box. The quality of the earrings is quite good. There is one large center stone and 11 smaller stones surrounding it in a floral pattern. The earrings are pretty heavy and there are nice quality backs included. The stones are clear and very shiny. Overall, this is a nice pair of earrings for the price.

Prior to using this I hadn't ever used a lens kit for phones before. I was kind of skeptical about how well they would work. I'm actually hugely impressed with it. You get 3 lenses, a clip that will work on most phones, and a microfiber bag. I've found the quality of the lenses better than expected. The are made of aluminum and the lenses seem to be pretty good quality.MACRO LENSThe macro is by far my favorite and I would by this kit just for it. It helps take amazing super close up macros with lots of bokeh.  It's great for coins and jewelry. You do have to get your phone super close to the subject so good lighting is key when using it.WIDE ANGLEYou actually have to combine the wide angle and macro together for this. The quality is good and it really adds a lot more range to the shot. This is great for either taking group photos in a small space or getting more into your landscape shot.FISHEYEThis lens gives you a 180° view. I'm not a huge fan of fisheye lenses in general so I don't have a lot to say about it. It does work well but leaves a black ring around the edges of photos that will likely need cropped out. I actually just set my camera to 1:1 square photos when using it to eliminate later editing.CONCLUSIONOverall, this is a great set and a great value for the price. I highly recommend it if you want to get creative with your smartphone camera without spending a lot of money.Disclaimer: I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This does not affect how I review an item and I will point out issues I have.

I just got this Oakley hoodie. It looks great in person. I don't really consider it "Jet Black" as it's actually a dark gray color. It features the Oakley logo in a light gray across the chest. I'm about 5' 11" with a medium build and the large fits great. It's a lighter hoodie with somewhat light material which would be perfect for cooler fall days. It's very soft and slightly fuzzy on the inside. Overall, I'm pretty pleased with it and would definitely recommend it.

I've been using this mouse for the past few days on my Chromebook. So far it has worked great and I really like it.FeaturesIt features a scroll wheel, back and forward buttons, and a DPI selector button. The scroll wheel is a clear plastic with black rubber in the center for added grip. The wheel also clicks and functions as a middle button if pressed down. The back and forward buttons are placed above the area where you thumb rests and easy to press with your thumb. There is also a button just under the scroll wheel that changes the DPI and also acts as a low battery indicator. With each press of the DPI selector it flashes a certain amount of times to indicate what DPI setting you are using. I can't say that I notice in huge difference between the DPI settings in Chrome OS but you may have different experience in Windows. The buttons and scroll wheel all have good feedback.DesignIt's a smaller more portable mouse. Even with it being smaller it feels quite ergonomic and contours to fit my larger hand quite nicely. Please note this probably won't work well for your if you are left handed.  The top of the mouse has a metallic looking gray finish. The sides are a grippy matte black plastic. The bottom is black plastic and features a connect button, on/off switch, and a battery compartment that holds a single AA battery(not included).ConclusionIt functions quite well and the cursor moves very smoothly. Overall, it's just a great mouse for the price.Disclaimer: I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This does not affect how I review and item.

I just got this and set it up. It comes with very high quality and heavy duty metal hardware including tension hooks, wall mounts, and carabiners. I was very pleased that the material was heavier and thicker than I was anticipating so it does offer a lot of shade.You will need some rope/cord and screws on hand to set it up. I recommend trying to find a neutral color rope so it blends in and minimizes the appearance. I simply laid it out where I wanted it to get a good idea of how I wanted it mounted then screwed the mounts in place. You then attach rope to the wall mounts via the carabiner and then hook that to the tension hook and attach the tension bolt to the sail. Once you have them all in place you simply start tightening the tension hooks. If you have any wrinkles you try to tighten the bolts in the opposite direction of the wrinkles to stretch them out. It's fairly easy to take back down if you need to. Just release the tension, unhook the carabiners, and fold it up.I wouldn't really call it a negative but I kind of wish that the hardware was painted to match the shade material. It looks somewhat industrial to me and would definitely benefit from a paint job to minimize the appearance.Overall, this is a very nice item. It is super easy to install, is well made, and includes quality hardware that will last a long time. It is a great, affordable, and modern looking option to use over a patio, porch, or deck in place of awning. I highly recommend it.Disclaimer: I was sent a discount code for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This does not affect how I review and item and I will report any issues I have.

This wallet looks great. It features a pebbled leather finish and two zippered compartments. The zippers are good quality and unzip easily. One compartment has segmented storage and holds many cards. The other holds cash and change. It's a very compact wallet and would be great to either carry, put in a jacket pocket, or handbag. Overall, it's a well made and quality product. If you have many cards to carry this is an excellent and convenient option.I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for an unbiased and honest review. I have a Brother HL2270dw printer. I installed this and I immediately got a paper jam error even before printing anything. After managing to get the printer reset and clear the error it starts all over again after printing a test page. The paper feeds through fine but afterwards the printer once again puts out a paper jam error. I installed a different toner and it works perfectly. This toner, at least the one I received, is either defective or does not work properly on the HL2270dw. I don't recommend purchasing it.

Unboxing this headset was fairly simple. It comes in a clear plastic box and you just have to peel the seal away to open them. Inside you will find the stereo headset, 3 sizes of ear gels, and a USB cable.The headset features a mic, 3 control buttons, and a flat tangle free cable.  The flat style cables are my absolute favorite feature of the headset. The USB charging cable is also flat and tangle free to match the headset.The buttons control volume up and down, skip and forward, play and pause for music. Alternatively, you can also use them for calls. I found the instructions just a bit confusing but I was finally able to figure out that holding the volume down key for 2 seconds that it activates the voice controls on my phone.  If you hold the power/play button for a few seconds it will re fine I also your last call. Once you know what to press and hold they work great. I would like to mention it is somewhat difficult to find the buttons by touch. I found myself wishing the controls had more separation or difference to discern what you are pressing by touch.The ears buds were very easy to setup. If you have an Android phone the chances are you have NFC and if you currently had it enabled on your phone you can simply tap the headsets control to the NFC on your phone to quickly pair them. You do have to get them just right over the NFC chip in your phone to get it to work. Otherwise, the normal Bluetooth pairing process is fairly quick too.The audio quality is pretty good. I don't notice any major background noise. They produce a good amount of bass. The volume is probably my main complaint. Maxing out the volume on both my phone and the headset are just at the edge of what I want to adjust my volume to. Other than not being super loud earphones the audio quality is pretty good.The battery life had been pretty good so far.Ovsrall, this is a great affordable choice.  They work great. I would say i was kind of disappointed that there wasn't a  carrying pouch or box included.I was sent a sample of this item for testing and unbiased feedback and review. This does not affect how I review an item.

I just got this car garbage can installed in my car. It attaches to the headrest with an adjustable nylon strap and there is a hook on the bottom to hook to the underside of the seat to prevent it from flopping around. It has a clamshell closure on the top to hide the garbage and this will help with odor control. The inside is lined with a waterproof material so no need to worry about throwing in a drink and worrying about leaks. You vould definitely add some ice and use it as a cooler instead of a garbage bag. There are cargo pockets on either side that are thr perfecr size for drink bottles. This garbage can looks very well made and is larger than expected. Overall, it's a great well made item.I was sent a discount for this item in exchange for a honest and unbiased product review. I just installed these in the map lights of my car. They are about twice as bright and produce a clean white light versus the previous super dingy yellow old bulbs. They will help a great deal with reading and really improve the look of the car interior at night time.I was sent a discount for these in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was sent a sample of this item for free in exchange for a an honest and unbiased review. When I opened the package I was impressed by how large the bottle is. I don't anticipate needing any more for a long time. I just want to say in advance if you are expecting something that smells like coconuts this isn't for your as it doesn't really have much of an odor or scent at all. I wasn't sure what I would use it for at first but I've been using it as a pre-shave oil for shaving with my double edge safety razor and also as a facial moisturizer afterwards. I simply rub this into my beard then apply my regular shaving soap and it makes for a super smooth shave with virtually no burn or dryness afterwards. I am allergic to the perfumes found in most lotions and after shave balms so I have been really happy to use this as it's virtually scent free. I have not had any kind of reaction or breakout. It doesn't leave my skin looking oily or greasy it just gives a healthy fresh look and absorbs pretty quickly. Probably my only con for it is the included pump. I've noticed if I grab the bottle and squeeze it even a tiny bit it will squirt out without even touching the pump. It's a minor but messy annoyance but I wish it had a better pump with it. Definitely consider putting the cap back on if you are traveling.Overall, it's a great item with a wide variety of uses. The price is pretty fair considering how large the bottle is and a little bit of it goes a long way.

Unboxing these over the ear bluetooth was extremely simple. You simply slide the box open to reveal the headphones already packed inside the included zippered clamshell case. You also get USB charging cable and a short 3.5mm audio cable.CaseThe zippered clamshell case is a nice matte black and the inside is lined with a slim layer of neoprene or something similar. There is a loop on the top for a carabiner but there isn’t one included in the box. If you want to attach it to your bag or something else you will need to use your own. Overall, it looks great and is well made.Comfort and DesignThe headphones are an ultra glossy black with matte red accents. They just fit over the ear for me with no room to spare. They are very comfortable and I can wear the for extended periods without any discomfort. The top headpiece features a thick layer of foam padding for great comfort. The earpieces are equally comfortable. You can adjust the height of the earpieces but just sliding them out. They swivel slightly left and right and up and down. When you are finished using them you simply slide the earpieces back into their original position and fold them down for storage in the case.Wireless & Wireless ControlsThese feature Bluetooth 4.0 and have an advertise range of about 30 feet which I find fairly accurate. There are control buttons on the right earpiece. You have call/play/power, volume up/down, and skip back/forward buttons. You press the power button for about 2 seconds to power them on. To pair you hold the power button for about 2.5 seconds after powering them on to activate the pairing mode. You will be alerted by both a voice prompt and the indicator lights flashing blue and red. To turn them back off you have to hold the power button for over 5 seconds until you get the voice prompt that they are powering down.In music mode pressing the Play/Pause once to pause or play and the skip/previous, and volume buttons work as expected.When not playing music I was able to activate Google Now for voice commands by pressing the play button for a couple of seconds.You can use them on two different phones at the same time. One for music and the other for calls.I have had Bluetooth headphones that work both ways but the volume controls on the headphones are separate from the volume controls on the phone or other device you are using.The Bluetooth battery life is advertised as 15 hours of calls or 13 hours of continuous music. I’ve found the battery life to be great so far.  I’ve charged them once since I got them last week and I’ve used them extensively and they are still going strong. There isn’t any way that I have found to just check the battery level. The light does flash every 5 seconds and they make a sound when the battery is quite low. It takes about 4 hours to charge them. They charge via a micro USB cable included in the box but you will need to provide your own USB port or wall adapter as there isn’t one included. They do power off automatically after a few moments if you disconnect your phone.The wireless range is pretty good. if you are in an area with no walls I have little doubt you could probably get the 30 ft range. I’ve noticed slight skipping when getting probably 15-20 feet away if there are a couple of walls in between.Audio QualityI’ve found the audio quality to be pretty good. They have a decent amount of bass but definitely not over the top. I sometimes wish the bass was just a little more punchy. I haven’t noticed any significant amount of background noise or anything of that nature. I’ve tried them on my desktop computer, Note 5, and iPhone 6 Plus and found the max volume to be pretty low on all of them. I like listening to my music pretty loud leave all the volume controls at max to get close to what I want.WiredThere is a line in port on the headphones for wired use with devices that don’t have Bluetooth. There is no discernible difference in either sound quality or volume. The included cable is just a standard 3.5mm stereo cable and doesn’t have a mic or any controls so if you will need your own cable with controls if you want to use them as a wired headset.Pros:Great build quality & DesignPretty good audio qualityComfortable over the ear headphones if you don’t have huge ears(they just fit me)PriceUse on two different devices at once(one phone & one media)Very nice hard carrying case includedConsNo in line controls or mic when using the somewhat short included cable(you can provide your own)Low max volumeThe ear pads might be a bit on the small side if you have large earsOverall, I’ve found these to be surprisingly very good quality and well made headphones. I liked them enough that even with the few minor complaints I listed above I didn't dock and stars. I would rate them a solid 4.5 if I could. I've found myself listening to them versus my name brand wired headphones because of the extremely convenient wireless functionality. They look more expensive than they are and are obviously very reminiscent of a popular name brand pair of headphones(which I also own) and compare surprisingly well in both design & sound quality for a significantly smaller price.Disclaimer: I was sent a discount code for this item in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This does not affect how I review an item and I will point out any issues I have regardless of how I acquired it.

It is a rugged looking and feeling case. It features a two layer/piece design.  There is a kickstand on the back of the case. It includes a plastic screen protector, microfiber cloth, and a stylus.You can use only the silicone inner piece if you want to. The plastic piece with the kickstand is easily removeable and the case looks fine without it. I find myself using it with just the silicone piece around the house and add the plastic piece when I'm out.It offers a lot of drop protection and the treaded design lends a really good grip to the case. I've found it feels slightly rough and edgy in the hand. The black piece has a matte and rubbery finish which also adds more grip.The case is well made and all the ports and cutouts are lined up well.If you are looking for a more rugged case this would be a great choice.I was sent one of these at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I was given a discount for one of these in exchange for feedback and an honest and unbiased review. I haven't ever used a diffuser before but was excited to try one out.I love to have my house smell good but have bad allergies and things like candles, air freshener and even scented wax plug-ins really bother me. I haven't really had any issue with this and my allergies so far. Maybe it's because there isn't any smoke or wax but this and the spicy essential oil I purchased separately hasn't bothered me so far.The InstaNatural diffuser was extremely easy to set up. You simple unbox it and then fill it to the fill line with water and then place 5 or 6 drops of your favorite essentially oil in the water. You then put the shade on and turn it on. I was surprised at how it started misting and putting out a pleasant scent instantly. The mist feels very cool and dry when you put your hand over it. If you fill it to the line it will last 7 or 8 hours or so.The shade is lit by pleasant blue led lights. It lights enough to cast a slight glow to the mist as well. Unlike what other reviewers say you CAN turn the light off and keep the mist going. The power button works three ways. Once for LED lights and mist, twice for mist only, and three times for completely off. I do wish you could change the color of the lights or even have breathing/pulsing lights which would add to the calming effect.It doesn't take long at all for the scent to permeate a room. It isn't strong enough to fill a whole house but definitely works for a living area, kitchen, bathroom or bedroom.Overall, I was surprised at how well I have liked this. I thought it should have a few more options for the price but it does seem well made so I'm not sure. I would definitely say it needs changeable led colors for the price.

I just got a diffuser for the first time and this is the first oil I purchased to put in it. It smells great. I find it smells like either a chai tea or especially like the recipe of spicy gingersnap cookies I make around the holidays. I can detect hints of all of the oils in it but I find the clove scent slightly overpowers most of the others. I do love the scent of cloves but I would like it to be toned down a bit so you can really smell the citrus, cinnamon, and eucalyptus a bit more.  I put about six drops in my diffuser and don't find it too strong. It comes in a very small amber colored bottle but I anticipate it lasting fairly long. Overall, a great scent if you prefer spicy scents.

I was lucky enough to be offered a sample of these refillable K-Cups to test out and give a honest and unbiased feedback and review. So far I love them. I've had similar ones for my old Keurig 1.0 but hadn't got around to getting one for my 2.0 so I was quite happy to get them. They literally pay for themselves and you save on all the wasted plastic form normal K-Cups. They aren't quite as quick and easy to use as regular K-Cups since you do have to refill them but the cost savings definitely mitigates that. It does help that there are two included in the package so you can basically have an extra one ready to go. I also like that I'm able to use whatever coffee I want to in them even if it isn't available as a K-Cup. You simply fill them about 75% full and pop them in your machine. They appear to be well made. I've had different versions for my old Keurig 1.0 and these look better made and look like they should hold up longer. So far they have worked great and the coffee taste great.

Disclaimer: I was sent a sample of these to test, give honest and unbiased feedback and a review. I've actually been very impressed with them. You get several pages of large black labels and a white dry erase marker. I didn't realize when I ordered them that they were dry erase so I was very pleased with that. I have put them on my large glass gallon canisters that reside on my kitchen counter tops. They look very good, add a bit of charm and are very easily readable even across the room. If I decide I want to change the contents of the canisters I can simply wipe away the old text. I've also added a few to our everyday cups so we can scribble our names on them and avoid mix ups. I plan to put one on my front door which could be used to discretely say welcome or leave messages to the delivery guy like please ring the doorbell when you deliver my Prime packages (instead pounding down my door).Overall, I've been very impressed with them. They are nice heavy vinyl and seem to have a strong adhesive. The white dry erase marker included works great. They appear as if they will hold up nicely.

I'm using this wireless charger with my Note 5. It looks really nice in person. It's a bit wider than a hockey puck and fairly thin. It came with a black USB cable but no charger. The edges are a clear polycarbonate which pulses and glows blue when your phone is charging. There is a raised silicone or rubber lip around the white charger area which prevents your phone from slipping around and prevent wear or scratches.With my Note 5 it takes between 3-4 hours to fully charge with this charger. Since it takes that long to charge I keep it on my night stand and place my phone on it before I got to bed. It does work with my Flip Wallet cover installed on the phone so it will likely work with most cases.Overall, I really like it. It looks great and appears to be well constructed. It doesn't have fast charging though so it's best used as an overnight charger or somewhere where you won't be using your phone for extended periods.Disclaimer: I was sent a discount for this device to test it and offer an unbiased and honest review.

I just got this Flip Wallet Cover for my Black Sapphire Note 5. So far I really like it.Unlike previous generations where you could just pop off the battery cover this one attaches via 4 polycarbonate corners. It is extremely quick and easy to put on. The top, right side, and bottom are all exposed. You have full access to all the buttons, ports, and the SIM tray even with the case on. The left side is obviously covered. There are plus and minus marks where the volume keys reside on the phone. The backside is raised enough to protect the protruding camera which is something I was really looking for. I now feel safe place the phone and a table without worrying about wearing down or scratching the camera lens. The outside of the cover is dark blue/gray with a very slight metallic sheen. It coordinates perfectly with the Black Sapphire color of the phone. The right and left side are slightly curved so it still retains some of the good in hand feel of the Note. The right side is curved enough that the edges don't seem to dig into your hand. It is fake leather and while it is nice it doesn't have quite the same feel as leather would. The flap folds back and closes quite easily and I haven't had any issue where it doesn't quite close yet. It doesn't have any kind of magnet or anything to keep it closed if you put it in a bag or purse so that is something to be mindful of.The inside of the cover is lined with a soft microfiber material. It holds 1 card in the card holder. You may be able to squeeze two in but it will definitely stretch the pouch out and probably make the flap protrude from your screen. It's great to carry your ID or a single credit card in. When you open the cover it does activate the screen. If you don't have your lock screen set up with a passcode or to unlock via fingerprint you should be able to set it to unlock your phone also.The only thing I don't like about this case is since it doesn't have an S-View window it would be great if the indicator light wasn't covered. I find the light very convenient and having a case and especially an OEM one cover it is just annoying.Overall, I'm really pleased with this case. It feels great in and an offers decent protection for the entire phone. The quality is absolutely what you would expect from an OEM case. It just fits perfectly and looks amazing. The wallet part of the case has extremely limited utility. You can really only fit one card in it.

I was sent one of these cables to try out, give feedback, and write an honest and unbiased review. I'm so glad I got it because the 10' length of this cable makes it incredibly convenient. It's great to use in a living room or office where the stock cable will barely reach from the wall outlet to a desk or table right next to it. It looks nearly identical to the stock cable and both of the connectors are the exact same dimensions so there are no worries about fitting in certain cases. I love that it's long enough that you can use your iPhone or iPad while charging it without feeling like you are going to rip the cable out of the wall. Overall, it's a great product and I highly recommend it.

I was sent a sample of this item to test and give an honest and unbiased review of. What I've found is that it is a great, lightweight, and compact sized MP3 player with a screen. It works and sounds great. It produces a lot of volume and has good sound quality. It also features an FM Player, Voice Recorder, video player, and ebook reader. The latter two features are more of a novelty due to the size of the screen and the resolution just isn't good for video or text reading. The version I got have 16gb of internal storage and also has a micro SD card slot to expand on that. The interface is straight forward and easy to use.The back of the player is aluminum and the front is covered in a shiny black plastic. The navigation buttons on the front are a matte black plastic.I recommend this mostly as a device secondary to your smartphone or possibly as an affordable option for use by a child. It would great to use if you don't want to take your smartphone running or to the gym.

I was sent one of these protectors to test and provide an unbiased and honest review. That said, please let me start by saying that I haven't really found a glass screen protector for either of the devices I use everyday that I'm 100% happy with. I have both an iPhone 6 Plus which is what this screen protector review is in regards to and a Note 5. Unfortunately, when it comes to screen protectors neither device is easy to find a quality one for. Both devices have a subtle curve on the edges of the screen which wreaks havoc with glass screen protectors.I installed this one on my iPhone 6 Plus quite easily. It took only a few minutes and I didn't have any issue with bubbles or alignment. There is a pair of cleaning wipes included in the box(a wet and a dry one) but I really recommend you also have a nice clean microfiber cloth on hand. I've found the best place to install protectors is in a humid bathroom especially after a shower as it really cuts down on lint and dust. Another great tip is to use an old cheap plastic screen protector to pull away any lint or dust that your cleaning cloth might leave behind. Glass screen protectors go on so quickly and it's not hard to get any bubbles out or align it. This one turned out really great and thankfully I have yet to notice any dust or lint under it. The edges have a really tiny sliver of a halo effect. This is where the edges don't adhere quite perfectly due to the curved glass edges of the iPhone screen and have a slight halo around the edges. This one is the most minimal out of 3 different glass protectors I've had on my iPhone but I'm actually really happy with it. I plan to keep this one on so that's a testament to it's quality. I haven't had any issues with it lifting off or anything of that nature.It doesn't feel any different on my fingers than the bare screen does and looks and works great with my OEM leather case. Overall, I highly recommend it.

I bought these for the kids. They fit great. To give you an idea of how these fit, my daughter wears a 5T. The extra small is a little big on her, but not bad. It's certainly acceptable, and she has got a little room to grow in this shirt. The shirts are good quality, hold up to abuse well, and machine wash and dry fine. I've noticed no shrinkage. I certainly recommend these Army shirts. They are very similar to what we used to wear while doing Army physical training.

This is excellent easel paper. We tear a sheet out, and clip it to our easel. The paper is great quality, and both my daughter and son have made many pictures on this paper. The kids have used crayons, markers, and paint on this paper. All work well.

I have no idea, why this product had the reviews it did, at the time of my purchase. I consider myself an average sized male. I'm 6 ft, 170 lbs. I ordered a large. The jacket is so short it stops at about 4-6 inches above my belt line. It's one of the most ridiculous looking jackets I've ever tried on. The Army lettering, and basically everything else about the jacket is great. It looks and feels good. In summary, if you're 5'5" or less, this jacket will probably fit you excellently and look awesome on you. If you're above that height I would not recommend this.

This is a nice, quality planner. It's a very simple planner, with each month having a two-page spread in a calendar format. There are no additional areas for information. If you're looking for a planner that has an area for information to input on each day, or something that will allow you to write down appointments, etc., at a certain time, on a certain day, than this planner is probably not for you. Like I said, there is simply a calendar type format spread across two pages. In the back of the planner there is a 'note' area as well as a 'future planning' area. These are blank lines. This calendar works great for me, holds up to abuse (has a nice durable cover), and supports a great cause, the Wounded Warrior Project.

I bought these for my 5 year old daughter. I thought they'd be nice colorful socks that she'd like, and would help to keep her little legs warm in the Wyoming winter. These socks are awesome. My daughter loves them. Her mom thinks they're cute too. These socks are very colorful, and bright. They go up past my daughter's knees. They do help to keep my baby girl's legs warm because they're so long, therefore covering so much of her legs. However, they're not thick socks. They're not paper thin either, but definitely not on the heavy side, when speaking in terms of thickness. The bottoms of the feet have 'grips' which help to keep her from sliding around on tile, lenolium, and hardwood floors. I highly recommend these socks, and if they didn't come in a six pack, I'd buy more.

This is a cool shirt. I'm 6 foot, 175 pounds. I like my shirts to be snug, but not too small. I went with a medium on this and it fits great. The length is good; it's not too short like so many cheaply produced shirts. The arms have a nice cut to them, and form to the body nicely. The neck hole is much wider than I expected, but it's alright. Still looks nice. Remembering Everyone Deployed is important. This shirt is a nice reminder to all those who forget so quickly. I like the reversed flag on the right arm as well. Symbolizing that the flag is always moving forward. Good t-shirt, good message.

As far as what I've been able to find concerning white t-shirts for little boys, this is the best I've found. Which is sad, because these shirts aren't that great. They stretch out from normal wear and tear, and if you dry them, they'll shrink. Even with a good laundry detergent, and bleach, these shirts are impossible to keep a nice bright white. This all being said, there simply isn't a good alternative brand that I've been able to find.

Steven Speilberg had a hand in writing and producing this unforgettable classic. 'The Goonies', although produced years ago, is still as funny and unforgettable today, as it was when I first saw it as a child. My two children can vouche for this. Fondly remembering this movie, I decided to throw it in my son's Christmas stocking hoping that he and his sister would take the time to watch the movie. I was interested to see what their reaction to the movie would be. They love it. And really, who wouldn't? A group of misfit, but good-hearted, kids on an adventure to find the treasure that was hidden by pirates long ago. A treasure map, booby traps, hilarious scenes that'll have even adults laughing, and so much more, this movie is a must for movie lovers of all ages. Sometimes in life, things really are still as good today, as they were when you were a child.

These are smaller Legos. Not like some of the real small Legos I've seen and assembled, yet smaller than what I'd think of as the averaged-sized Lego. At first I was disapointed as I bought these for my daughter, and was looking forward to playing with "normal" Legos. I was also disapointed with the container. It's much bigger than it needs to be. The Legos that come in this "Brick Box" only take up 1/3 of the space in this box. After saying all that, however, I've come to realize there are all shapes and sizes of Legos. These smaller Legos are a lot of fun to play with as well. Perhaps even funner to play with in some cases. And the box being larger than it needs to be, has actually turned out to be a blessing as I can store other Legos in here as well. After my daughter and I played with and used these Legos for a couple of weeks I'm now very happy with this set. This is a quality set, that is nice for any Lego fan. I would, however, not recommend this set for very young children as these pieces could easily be swallowed.

These are smaller Legos. Not like some of the real small Legos I've seen and assembled, yet smaller than what I'd think of as the averaged-sized Lego. At first I was disapointed as I bought these for my son, and was looking forward to playing with "normal" Legos. I was also disapointed with the container. It's much bigger than it needs to be. The Legos that come in this "Brick Box" only take up 1/3 of the space in this box. After saying all that, however, I've come to realize there are all shapes and sizes of Legos. These smaller Legos are a lot of fun to play with as well. Perhaps even funnier to play with in some cases. And the box being larger than it needs to be, has actually turned out to be a blessing as I can store other Legos in here as well. After my son and I played with and used these Legos for a couple of weeks I'm now very happy with this set. This is a quality set, that is nice for any Lego fan. I would, however, not recommend this set for very young children as these pieces could easily be swallowed.

I've had my Doberman on Diamond's lamb and rice dry food for nearly a year. He's always seemed to like that mix, but I thought I'd change it up and try this formula. Right away I noticed the morsels are much larger than the lamb and rice mix. However, this isn't an issue for my dog. He seems to be happy with this change, and is gobbling it up.

My favorite of all of Bingham's albumbs. This CD is packed with excellent, quality, original music. Written and performed beautifully. If you're a Bingham fan and don't have this album, you need it. If you're new to Bingham, this is a great place to start. You won't be disappointed.

Go with a Serta pillow. Last time I bought the Serta Perfect Sleeper, and it is pretty much just that. This time I went with this pillow, and immediately I knew it was a bad choice. It's polyester, and just doesn't feel right, even with a pillow case. Also, it's much too firm in my opinion. There simply is no comparison to the Serta.

Excellent pillow, that I immediately slept great on. In my opinion, it's just right. Not too firm, not too soft. Seems to be well made, and I'm still sleeping great on it. If anything, over time, my opinion has only improved.
Great underwear for my 4 year old. They are well made, hold up great to washings, and my daughter says they're comfortable.
Nice stockings. They look great, and seem to be well made. They come with a loop on the end, so you can easily hang them.

This is easy to assemble, looks great in my kids' bedroom, and effectively holds many of their books. The rack is strong, holding many larger sized, heavy hardcover books. Once assembled, and sat upright, it's very stable, and not something you have to worry about falling over onto small children.
These body sponges are the smallest I've ever seen. I was shocked at how small they were when I opened the package. They can still be used, but they're not as effective as a larger poof sponge is.

I bought this for my full-size bed, as stated it's made for. The comforter really isn't quite big enough for a full-size mattress. Also, the comforter and sheets have a cheap feel, and look, to them. The camouflage looks nothing like any military issued camouflage, nor does it look like anything I've ever worn hunting. It's just kind of it's own odd pattern. Nothing washes and dries well. After only a couple of washings everything started to shrink (and everything was dried on a low heat setting).

I've been using ACT for several years, after a recommendation from a trusted dentist. I've never had a cavity since. I don't know if it's a direct result of using ACT, or not, but I do believe ACT mouthwash has helped preserve my teeth. It freshens the breath, and leaves my mouth with a nice, clean feeling.

The WWP is a wonderful cause that, as a veteran, I'm proud to support. These t-shirts help spread the word. I get compliments and questions from the shirt on a regular basis. The shirts hold up well to wear and tear, and washings.

Divorce can and is for many people (including myself) a horrible experience to go through. This book was recommended to me by a superior at work who himself went through a divorce. Because I have respect for this individual, I took his advice and bought the book. As soon as the book arrived I began reading, and I can tell you this book was a huge help in turning my life in the right direction. So much of what I was feeling, and experiencing, made no sense to me until I read this book. All of the sudden what I was going through started to make sense. I realized much of what I was going through was normal, and I wasn't alone. It's also aided me in making better decisions post-divorce. I can't imagine how much further behind the curve (per say) I'd be without this book. It was quite possibly my life saver. If you're going through a divorce, or are divorced and are up for a little self-help to improve your life and the lives of those around you, I highly recommend this book.

I like the display on this clock and that is it. Unfortunately, and to my surprise, the print on the clock telling the user which buttons do what is hard to read or completely illegible. Some of the buttons simply do not work well. I have to jockey the clock around and bang on the buttons to get them to do what I need. I don't even try to actually use the alarm or radio. Getting the clock set to the right time, then resetting the time during time changes or when the power goes out, is enough. I do not recommend this product.
These fit well, hold up great to wear and washings, and are an overall good product for the price.

The sizing on these are accurate. An added bonus is that the shoulder straps are adjustable to allow you to add length, or shorten the snow pants. The kids are comfortable in these, and they haven't complained about being cold, even in Wyoming, -10 degree Fahrenheit weather.
This is a cool framed poster, however, it's not dry-mounted. Therefore, it quickly wrinkles inside the frame and looks bad.
Good, quality cap and mitten set. My son and I played outside for hours in the bitter Wyoming cold. This set kept him warm. The mohawk on the cap is a nice added touch.
If you like a foaming hand wash, then you'll like this. Works great.

I bought two of these for my kids' bunk beds. They've worked out great. 6" is plenty thick for a child. As a grown man I've laid on these mattresses, and find them to be comfortable. I just can't see paying exuberant prices for mattresses that most furniture stores charge. These do ship rolled up very tightly. Simply take them out of the box and they unfold themselves. After a couple hours they were laying perfectly flat.
I was so impressed by this I had it framed at my local framing gallery. The end result is magnificent. Very nice poster.

Dermatic Topical Probiotic Skin Care spray is a great idea for anyone who suffers with various skin conditions including acne, rosacea, and eczema to name a few. I've actually been applying this to my 15 year old daughter's back and shoulders as she suffers from terrible cystic body acne. She's seen a moderate improvement in her skin from this probiotic alone. I'm actually very encouraged with the results and will continue to use this on her in hopes that there is a cumulative effect. She does continue to have breakouts, but the redness and duration seems to have decreased.I received this product at a discount in exchange for a fair and honest review, which I believe I have provided.

These little bike lights are relatively inexpensive, but since they seem almost disposable, they aren't exactly a good value. You do receive 4 lights and extra button batteries, which is all well and good if the lights themselves would actually last long enough to need a battery replacement. They are absolutely NOT waterproof. I live in SC, and well, we had tons of rain and guess what? Dead lights. Changing the batteries make no difference, so it's apparently something in the contact wires within the lights that have failed. 3 of the 4 are now gone, and I don't expect the 4th to hang on much longer.Great idea, they are cute and go on easily, but they simply don't last. I received these at a discount in consideration of a fair and honest review which I have indeed provided.

This is a great idea and has a tremendous amount of potential. Unfortunately, it simply did not work well for us and we had to return it. This system comes preloaded with several different programs that make it easier for you to enjoy streaming movies, TV and music at little or no cost. Of course, some of the programs, such as Hulu, still require a subscription. There are also expanded capabilities to add additional programs for your viewing needs.Unfortunately, despite updating the programs/ system even with multiple attempts to upload various media, we consistently received screens that would go into "working" for extended periods of time or "failure" to upload anything at all. I managed to get ONE music video to play on one evening, it was the only thing we actually ever watched through the HaigerX system. Every other attempt to download various media to watch was unsuccessful. We honestly spent a LOT of time trying to get this system to work for us, to do SOMETHING, anything and it simply would not.I am sure our biggest challenge was that the speed test (which took multiple attempts to even run) showed a very slow connection, despite having the highest internet speed available from our cable company. The problem was, too, though is that the other devices on the line were consistently pulling in between 40-50 Mbps at the same time that this system barely pulled down 2 Mbps. We have to assume the issue was within the TV box and not the actual internet connection. We tried several different things to improve the speed/ connection to no avail. It was all most frustrating, as we really were hoping this system would let us remove everything BUT internet from our cable bill. This was not the magic box for us, unfortunately.It's also worth mentioning that the remote was absolutely MADDENING as it seemed to be hit and miss as to how and when it responded. Sometimes it was very responsive, other times it was sluggish or unresponsive, then suddenly do everything at once. I've heard other buyers bought a wireless mouse to use with this system, as that danged remote was NOT an efficient way to control this system. There were screens where I never could figure how to navigate because the remote didn't do what it should have.I received this system at a discount in consideration of a fair and honest review. I really wished I could get this to work for us, but it was apparently not meant to be. Keep in mind, too, that the instructions provided are minimal at best. There were things that they suggested you do that we could not even try with the way the remote failed to respond. There was limited information to be found online, too, and I personally looked... a LOT! An exercise in frustration that turned into feeling like a total waste of time.

My 15 year old daughter is a huge Baymax fan. She wishes we lived in a world where we all have our very own Baymax. I purchased this as a birthday present and she loves it! This hoodie is a bright, primary red with a set Baymax eyes across the chest. It is large, thick and comfy!Please keep in mind that it is shipping from China, so please allow yourself plenty of time to get it, especially if it's a gift. Also, I've learned that most items coming from overseas seems to run small, so I sized up. Sizing up a size or 2 and it works great for my daughter.I received this product at a small discount in consideration of a fair and honest review, which I have indeed provided. This is actually one of the few clothing items that I've purchased recently that I was not disappointed with. We love it!

This dress is very pretty, but it runs super small!! I bought a small for my petite, size 0-2 daughter and it was VERY tight on her and hard to zip up around her chest.
