She is tiny, like very thin and not blessed upstairs like some of her siblings and yet we really had to fight to get it zipped up. Even by their size chart standards, this dress is still quite small. It is not even a junior's 2/4.Otherwise, it is a pretty dress. Very flowy and feminine. It would have been adorable in her had it not been so danged tight. You can see in the pictures of the back, how the bodice puckers, as it's so tight around her chest. Unfortunately, unless it happens to fit our 80 lbs 9 year old, we will have to pass it down. I received this dress at a discount in consideration of a fair and honest review, which I have provided. All thoughts expressed are mine alone.

This is a cute dress, and my daughter loves it, but it definitely runs small by US standards. At least the size chart provided actually spells out that an XL is only a US size 8/10... though I think it's sad when an 8/10 is an xl, cause that means for ladies like me (US 16/ XL) could never possibly hope to fit into any of these dresses.The dress itself is a cute, casual dress. I would not really call it a "special occasion" dress, unless church is a special occasion for you. It's definitely more casual. The fabric is a poly blend, which should be easy enough to care for, though I haven't had to wash it yet. The material of this one is thick and substantial, so it's not a light, airy sundress. Overall we are still pleased with it, I just wish the sizes were more predictable.I received this dress at a discount in consideration of a fair and honest review, which I have provided. All thoughts expressed here are mine alone.

First let me say I adore this dress! It is everything I'd hope for. The fabric is soft, has a nice sheen and the pattern is wonderful. The style, very 50's, was exactly what I was looking for. Unfortunately, it runs very, very small! I am so sad, as I ordered this for myself, but am having to hand it over to one of my teenage daughters.If you look at their sizing chart listed, it's Amazon's standard women's sizing chart, which is NOT appropriate for this line. I assumed, since 85% said the sizing was accurate, that it would work for me. I am a US XL (16), so I ordered the XL in this as well. Nope, not even close. My teenage daughter is US M (10) and it fits her well enough that there is no way it's a true XL. My bust simply cannot fit into this dress. While I am admitted blessed in that department, I was truly hoping there would be enough give for this dress to work for me, but it was not to be.There is another size chart further down the listing, which shows that their version of XL is much more in line with a US large. May I humbly suggest that the "size chart" drop down menu actually contain Anni Coco's size chart so that it is more accurate? In certain formats (mobile), the product descriptions are much harder to find and read. I can only home with some more weight loss, I can borrow this back from her for awhile. I received a discount on this dress in consideration of a fair and honest review, which I've provided here. All thoughts expressed are mine alone.

Kashi's Organic Promise Cinnamon Harvest Cereal is my 7 year old son's absolute favorite cereal and snack. It's not unusual to find him eating them right out of the box, dry. He loves the flavor and I love that they are USDA Certified Organic, Non-GMO Project Certified and contain less sugar than many of the other things he could be eating. He thinks he's getting a treat, but I know he's eating healthy.I love Amazon's Prime Pantry, as I can have quality organic products delivered straight to my door at a fraction that I can buy them from my semi-local grocer. I have to drive 30 minutes just to find this in a store and they run roughly $2 higher/ box as of this review. I am saving time and money! The dates are good, it's plenty of time before they expire, not that they last long here anyway!

These are a favorite around here, they never last long. I though it would be a great filler when I had a little of bit of space left in my Amazon Prime Pantry box. However, I should have realized that these crisps are rather thin and they didn't do so well in shipping. Lot of crushed chips, not the best idea. My kids still ate them, so it wasn't a total waste, but I'll likely look for something a little more sturdy next time I have some space to fill.

Stacy's is a favorite in the Fraz Zled household, but I cannot find these Cinnamon Sugar flavored ones locally. Thankfully, Amazon's Prime Pantry offers them up and I can have them sent directly to my door at a cost better than I buy other Stacy's products locally. I love that they are Non-GMO Project verified, because this is important to me when feeding my family. I can't personally eat them (I'm gluten free) but these never last long here at my house. They are a perfect after school snack or packed in their lunch boxes. You cannot go wrong with cinnamon & sugar!

I am currently homeschooling a couple of my children. I bought several books for my 4 year old to do his K-4 work while his older sister does her own. This is a small workbook that I think is actually rated a little high (more like 4-5) but it does have plenty of activities to help keep our little guy occupied while I provide her instruction. There isn't a lot to this little book, but it's priced right for what you get. He seems to enjoy it.

Belly Blaster PM is touted as a night time weight loss pill that helps you lose extra pounds while you sleep. It contains the well known "natural" sleep aids L-tryptophan and melatonin, though it does not specify the amounts of each. This alone is highly frustrating, as it's not as if these are some super secret formulas and frankly people deserve to know what they are taking, especially when it comes to a hormone such as melatonin.The weight loss part is supposed to come from the blend of Raspberry Ketones, White Kidney Bean Extract, Green Coffee Bean Extract and Saffron Extract. The thing is, I've tried all of these products alone and in various combinations in the past without any real results. I suppose I was hoping that the combination of all 4 together would be more effective, but for me it has not. Not only have I not lost any weight on this supplement, but I've been waking up starving, too. I am the type of person who rarely eats breakfast and can go half the day without eating, as I am just not hungry, but this supplement made me absolutely ravenous in the mornings. I've had to eat by 9 am, which has actually thrown a monkey wrench in my weight loss goals. I also have experienced off and on palpitations, where my heart just starts to run faster than it should and seems to flip around a bit. The only thing new or different is this supplement. Perhaps it's all a little too much for me.The only thing I can say for sure is that it did indeed help me sleep, but that is the nicest thing I can say about it. I received this supplement at a steep discount in consideration of a fair and honest review, which I have provided here. All thoughts and experiences expressed here are mine alone. You may well have a different experience.

Quinoa is a wonderful, versatile grain that can be used in the place of rice or pasta in many recipes. I have a rice cooker that I have used to cook my quinoa and it works wonderfully for this purpose. This quinoa is USDA Certified Organic, which is important to me when feeding my family. I love that it is a big, 4 lb bag, too. I've spent more on a smaller quantity of organic quinoa at my semi-local grocer.The flavor of quinoa is very, very light. That in itself is actually a good thing, as it leaves lots of room for creativity when preparing it and cooking with it. I like to make mine with vegetable or chicken broth to perk up the flavor. The fact this one is pre-rinsed and ready to use is a huge bonus to me, too. My only real issue with this particular brand, it is made in a facility that processes tree nuts and I have a tree nut allergic child. Bummer!! He tends not to eat the quinoa I make anyway, but I've often prepared it in soups and casseroles, which I obviously cannot do with this one, lest we have to take a ride in the ambulance.I received this quinoa at a discount in consideration for a fair and honest review, which I have provided here. All thoughts expressed here are mine alone.

This is a great window mounted bird feeder. I am not really sure how squirrel proof it is yet, as I've yet to have a bird feeder they haven't managed to pillage to date... they just haven't found this one, yet. We shall see on that. I have very persistent squirrels.I had an issue with my first bird feeder (like others, mine arrived cracked), but the seller was very responsive and I quickly had a replacement. It is mounted on a living room window near where our cats like to sleep, and I can't wait until the birds are on it when a kitty is nearby. It will be entertainment for all! I love that I can look out my window and watch the birds feed, too. My grandmother instilled the love of bird watching into me at a very young age and I enjoy it to this day. I received this feeder at a discount in consideration of a fair and honest review, which I believe I have provided here. All thoughts expressed are mine alone.

BBQ Grill Master Premium Quality Grill Mats are an excellent option for cooking on the grill, especially for items that you may want to keep separated. I have a sister who has multiple food allergies, as well as a heart condition the makes it necessary for her to severely limit her sodium intake. One of our challenges in the past has been trying to make sure her food isn't coming into contact with those we prepared for ourselves. All the while making sure that the grill has been cleaned well before grilling her steak, as she is very allergic to fish, which we grill regularly. These mats take care of all of those issues!Having never even heard of grilling mats before this product, I was pleasantly surprised to find they work as intended. They clean up easily, too. Wonderful! Now my sister won't have to worry when she comes over for a BBQ at our place. I received these mats at a discount in consideration of a fair and honest review which I believe I have provided.

What a wonderful, huge assortment of colored thread this is!!My 14 year old daughter makes friendship bracelets in various styles and goes through a lot of embroidery floss for this purpose. When I was offered a chance to purchase this lot at a discount in consideration of a fair and honest review, I jumped at the chance. You should have seen her face when she saw this selection and realized they were all for her! Awesome!I am very pleased with the colors and it really is a full rainbow plus various shades of more neutral colors that should meet anyone's needs. As these are six stranded, it's also a great assortment for those who cross stitch, as well. I have't made anything cross stitch in years, but I could see these being great for sampler making. They have a great sheen to the colors, not at all matte like some I've owned. You simply cannot beat this price for the volume of thread that you will receive. The shades all seem slightly different, I don't notice any duplicates in my set. Lots of jewel toned colors in mine, I am very pleased with my lot!

aVo Tea Tree Oil + Oregano Oil is the real deal. It is a super strong formulation that I have used on plantar warts, skin tags, and various small skin abrasions/ injuries including staph. I do not recommend you use this neat (undiluted) except with extreme caution as it is very strong and will burn. I'm using it on an underarm skin tag and have to be very careful not to get it anywhere but directly on the skin tag, as it is a strong oil.As I've had multiple issues with impostor essential oils purchased here on Amazon recently, I took a chance on this one with a healthy dose of skepticism. I have been very pleased that it has performed in the manner in which I would expect it to, including helping to get rid of a very staph-y area on my teenager (what do they get into?!) and has already shrunk/ hollowed out another daughter's plantar warts. Like I said, it is VERY strong, so either dilute it with a carrier oil... plain old olive oil will work if you have nothing else... or apply it cautiously directly to the area being treated. A little goes a long way! As for the smell, it smells exactly as I would expect it to. It smells like a cross between oregano and the woodsy wonder of tea tree. It's a great product and will now be a staple in my medicinal essential oil (EO) stash.I received this oil at a discount in consideration of a fair and honest review, which I believe I have provided. I am a frequent and long standing Amazon shopper and a regular EO user who would never recommend an oil we don't happily use here. If there is any doubt, please feel free to peruse my other EO reviews. I take these products and their reviews very seriously.

This TNP iPad case was actually purchased to replace an identical style foam case that was pink and had seen better days. Unfortunately, upon removal from the pink case, the cracked iPad screen got much worse and it's being taken out of service until I can get it in to the shop and get the screen replaced.This shockproof case is all that it should be and does a great job of protecting the iPad. It was actually in a different type of case when my then 3 year old managed to crack the screen. Being in the (older pink) foam case has actually bought us a lot of time on it that I don't think we would have had without it. Once I get the screen replaced, I'll place it in our new green one, as I know how protective it is. Please note, for the iPad 2 (A1395), the black plastic frame does not fit on the back of the iPad. Without it, though, it slides right in and still has good protection.I received this case at a discount in consideration of a fair and honest review. I was happy to do so, as I've used this type case on several tablets and been very happy with my results. If you let little people use your electronic devices at all, this heavy protection is a must!

Velesco Silicone Baking Mats are all you need to make baked goods of all kinds without the harmful effects of aluminum foil. Not only is it better for your health, it's better for the environment to have reusable products to cook on instead of one time us products like foil or parchment paper. They clean up easily, usually with a simple wipe down, but can also be placed in the dishwasher. Safe up to 480 degrees in the oven, an be used to cook on and I've also used mine over a glass dish like a lid. They are sad to be microwave safe, too, though I've never used mine in the microwave.Fits perfectly over my old, beat-up cookie sheets. I love them! I received this pair at a discount in consideration of a fair and honest review, which I have provided. I am a frequent and long standing Amazon shopper who would never recommend something we don't happily use here.

Naturo Sciences Krill Oil is a great source of EPA, DHA and Astaxanthin which are all known to have healthy benefits, especially for lowering cholesterol and protecting heart health. If you don't know about Omega-3s by now, then you clearly haven't been paying attention. This is only my second time taking my Omegas in krill oil form as opposed to fish oils. Fish oils, unfortunately, have a lot of issues with being rancid by the time they reach the consumer, not only making them unpleasant, but also contributing to less efficacy and side effects, like those dreaded "fish burps". Some fish oils are also known to be contaminated by heavy metals due to the food chain in the seas.Krill are not fish, they are shellfish, very similar to shrimp. They are less likely to be contaminated with toxic metals because they are at the bottom of the food chain. This is probably the biggest reason one would choose krill oil as an Omega source over fish oils. It is the reason I, myself, was curious about this form. Also, the Omegas in krill oil are in phospholipid form, making it more readibly available for proper absorption and use in the body.The capsules are smaller than those of my fish oils and they are easy to swallow. As promised, no fish burps when taking this product. It does, however, still have a strong almost fish-like smell to them. Keep that in mind if you are sensitive to such things. I am not noticing any big changes when taking this product, which is a good thing for me since I am already stabilized on Omegas and my body isn't as if they suddenly went off of something it needed. I simply substituted the krill oil where I would normally take my fish oils. I received this product for free in consideration of a fair and honest review, which I have provided.

This is pretty much identical to The Memory Journalist selfie stick, probably manufactured side by side in the same plant in China. That being said it is also one of the better selfie sticks I've used.This selfie stick has a built in bluetooth button which activates the shutter on your phone, It paired immediately with my Nexus 5 and my wife's iPhone 5. The telescoping arm is thicker than most selfie sticks and extends to 2 feet 7 inches (31 inches). The cradle folds back on the stick making it extremely compact, folding down to just 6 inches.The stick charges via usb, it charged quickly and the battery lasted for several days.HGTUSA sent a sample for review, but that doesn't impact my review or rating. This is a great product.

I am a journalist, and I do a fair amount of travel where I take a lot of photographs and video. I rarely take a tripod because they tend to be extremely bulky. That's one of the things I really love about the Samtree Sampole. This little monopod collapses down to 15" and expands to 50" (4 feet 2 inches). The SmaPole comes with attachments for both a Go Pro camera as well as for Cel Phones. The legs on the mono-pod detach and double as a mini tripod as well. The SmaPole also comes with a holder for a GoPro remote.What's great about this SmaPole is that it's light, easy to maneuver and yet solid and stable enough to place and leave. The legs aren't strong enough for a big DSLR but it held my point and shoot and phone perfectly.I'm impressed by how much is packed in to this little monopod. It's well designed, well made, and extremely useful. It's going to be a permanent part of my gear when I travel.Smatree provided a sample for review, but it did not impact my rating.

I have become extremely dependent on using a car mount for my phone. It's so much safer and easier when using Google Maps or even using the phone to play music in the car. This car mount from Getron has one of the best cradles on a car mount that I've seen. It's easily adjustable and holds the phone perfectly. The problem though is where the cradle mounts to the base. The way in which these two things come together isn't great and it took a lot of work to get them attached. Once attached it really doesn't hold the cradle very straight.The base does stick to the dash very well and aside from how the cradle meets the mount, this is a really good car mount, But the interchange is enough to dock it one star.Getron provided a sample to review, but it did not impact my rating.

I've got a fairly solid library of games, but I was looking for another 2 player, light, easy and fun game which I could use as a warm up or to fill the gaps between two heavier games. Longhorn fits that space PERFECTLY. It's a very simple game that is easily taught (the rules are 3 pages long). The game is basically a light strategy game which involves taking cows from 9 tiles. The number of cows you take then dictates how many spaces you move your opponent. There are a few conditions that end the game, most of which tend to happen within 15 minutes.Since getting this game earlier in the week, we've already played it several time. I played it with my 14 year old and my 8 year old, both really enjoyed it. This game IS a light game, but that's it's charm. It's light, fun, and relatively short, fits our needs perfectly.

There are a lot of selfie sticks out there of varying quality, and this one by the Memory Journalists is extremely well made. The telescoping pole which is the core of the stick is thicker and better constructed than the other selfie sticks I've used. The handle has a bluetooth button which when connected with your phone allows you to activate the shutter with a single press. The Memory Journalist stick charges via USB and I was able to charge it very quickly. It paired via bluetooth with both my Nexus 5 and my wife's iPhone 5 with no issues.The phone cradle at the end of this selfie stick easily adjusted and securely held both our phones. I don't have a go pro, but the size and shape of the cradle seems like it would fit it. One of the great design features is that this cradle folds up onto the base of the stick itself making it very compact (only 6 inches). The stick extends to 2 feet 7 inches (31 inches).Put simply, this is a well designed and well made selfie stick, it's a clear cut above the others out there and well worth the money.The Memory Journalists sent a sample for review, but that doesn't impact my review or rating. This is a great product.

As you'd expect from Bose, these in-ear headphones sound extremely crisp and clear, especially in the mid and high range. Bose has mastered clarity in this spectrum and it's no surprise that they've again delivered with these in-ear headphones. The bass response is very good, but if you are looking for heavy, booming base, it's just not Bose's forte.The headphones come with the half moon ear pieces in three sizes. this seems to be the prevailing style for sport headphones as it helps keep them in the ear. The fit is very good and they don't need to be crammed in the ears to be able to produce good sound, this is fantastic as many in ear headphones sound horrid if they aren't perfectly placed.Sound bleed is there, but not horribly so. They aren't noise isolating or noise canceling headphones, but they do a great job of delivering really exceptional sound.  The cord is feels short, but it's the same length as the stock iPhone headphones (although the v part is less length). I'm surprised that Bose didn't go with the no tangle ribbon style of cabling, it's not enough the doc them stars, but it seems like the benefit of the ribbon style outweigh the detriments.Controls are solid and they work perfectly with Apple devices. I tried them on my Nexus 5 and the skip/start/stop button worked fine but the volume switches did not work (which is the same Bose Quiet Comfort 15). Again no star deduction as it's clearly stated that these are designed for apple.The headphones come with a nice small fabric carrying case with a carabiner, it's a nice little touch. They are water and sweat resistant which is great as they seem custom designed for running/working out. The cable also has a small clothing clip, it's a small thing, but it helps keep the cord from flailing when you run.Ultimately, it all comes down to the sound and Bose has delivered here with a sound quality that rivals many of the other ear buds in its class.

When building a PC it's easy to skimp out on the keyboard, spending over $100 can seem extravagant when it is 10%+ of the total cost of your computer, but you'll spend more time using your keyboard than almost any other component on your computer. When my son recently built his pc he decided to save and go with the Razer DeathStalker Essential Gaming Keyboard which is about 1/2 the price of this Corsair. He immediately regretted it. While the Razer is a serviceable keyboard it's non-mechanical, and for gaming that makes a huge difference.This Corsair STRAFE is one of the more affordable of the Corsair mechanical keyboards, but there's nothing cheap about it.  The Cherry MX keys live up to the hype, they are a MUST HAVE for anyone who uses their PC to game. The Corsair STRAFE Keyboard uses 2 USB slots, but one of those 2 is a passthrough so you can plug directly into the keyboard. The keyboard has textured key gaming keys which you can swap it. It's very easy to do and it makes a big difference.When it comes to mechanical key keyboards, there's really no one doing it better than Corsair and at this price point, it's a no brainer to go mechanical.

First and foremost, these are specifically designed to be used as DJ headphones, if you are looking for a good all around headphone, this may not be the headphones for you. But if you are looking for a good pair of DJ headphones these Phillips A5-Pro's which were designed in collaboration with Armin Van Buuren do a pretty fantastic job.The first thing I noticed about these headphones is that they have some real heft to them. They are as hearty and heavy duty as headphones get. There are also a lot of really great touches that DJ's will appreciate. The headphones rotate easily and collapse down into a small package (it comes with a cloth storage bag). The gold tipped plug can be plugged into either the right or left headphone, it's a small thing, but depending on how you spin, it is a huge benefit to be able to configure this.The ear pieces are replaceable, and the ones that come with it are heavily padded and make a solid seal. There is a fair amount of sound bleed from these, but again they aren't designed to be everyday headphones, they are focused on DJ's. They do a very good job of blocking out external audio so you can really hear the music, which of course is key. The audio quality is exceptional with crystal clear low, middle and high notes. The focus here is clarity, so the bass, while solid isn't as disproportionately booming as many of the other headphones I've tried.  The clarity is exceptional and there's zero noise, or distortion.These headphones seem extremely sensitive to the quality of input. I tried them out via headphone port on my speakers, directly connected to my laptop and on my phone and noticed a significant quality difference in the audio.Everything about these headphones is focused on DJ'ing, so many of the things you are paying for are things that matter more to DJ's than your average audiophile. Still, these headphones are exceptionally built and designed.

Visually, these Gaming Headsets from Etekcity look amazing. Etekcity has nailed cool looking headphones. Both ear phones light up with red led lights and the mic lights up when it's live. The black grill design looks amazingly cool, and the headphones fit relatively well. The headphones are USB and they worked both on my iMac and on our PC.  The cable has a nice volume wheel and switches for the mic and surround sound.The unfortunate thing is that these headsets just don't perform. There is significant audio bleed, and so people can hear your audio pretty clearly. The dynamic range is really tight, the bass is too heavy and really vibrates the headphones, but it's not enough to counteract the overall tinny character of the headphones. The 7.1 surround mode is very subtle and it's often hard to know which mode you are in (there's no real indicator).I tested these headphones with music (from several sources), movies, and games and in all these tests I kept wanting more from the range and found the bass to be too shaky in its delivery.I've never wanted  a pair of headphones to be better. Eteckcity has absolutely nailed the design, but the audio performance just doesn't match (especially at this price point). Etekcity provided a sample for review, but (obviously) it didn't impact my rating.

Beard balms come in a range of consistencies, and this Beardy Beard Balm from First Element is much stiffer and waxier than many of the balms I've tried. This is actually a good thing, as a little goes a long way and it is at taming frizzy beard hair. I also really appreciate the fact that it comes in a 2oz tin as most of my beard balms aren't nearly as travel friendly.In addition to great beard management, the scent of this beard balm is quite light and pleasant. I am scent sensitive, and I have no issues with the fragrance of this balm.  If you are looking for a stiffer balm which is more waxy in consistency, or you travel a lot and need something that will travel well (the tin stays nice and tightly shut in travel), it's hard to think of a better option.*Update* after using this balm for a while I've found that it get's a little gritty and isn't integrating into my beard all that well. I've docked it 2 stars for this as it greatly impacts how good the product works.First element provided me with a sample for review, but I'll happily buy more when this one runs out.

This little pocket chainsaw doesn't look powerful, but it is extremely powerful. Extremely compact (it folds up into a sleeve the size of most wallets), this pocket chainsaw packs amazing cutting ability in a very small package.Yes, it does take a lot of elbow grease to really get this things moving, but it cuts so much more evenly than a hacksaw and once you get going it really chews through wood.I simply would NEVER go camping without taking this Pocket Chainsaw, and I've thrown it with our garden tool box as it's ideal for dealing with thick bush and tree limbs when you don't want to use a power tool.Stunning Gadgest provided me with a sample for review, but I'd gladly pay for this, and I will absolutely be giving this as a stocking stuffer for the holidays!

Libertalia is a well themed and well designed card driven pirate game. Each player is given a limited set of cards they can play, each with a specific "power". The goal is to amass bounty and coins while trying to prevent your fellow players from out looting you. I played this game with 6 players and it played very well. I don't think it would have the same level of excitement under 3 players and its sweet spot seems to be 4-6.I like how this game starts everyone off on an even playing field, but depending on which cards you play and how you play them, begins to shift towards a varied and long terms strategy. I'm docking it one star because it really does need a good number of players to really make it fun.Although it may seem a little complicated to start, once you get rolling this game flows very well and it's easy to go from newbie to experienced in just a couple hands.

When I think of games that are fundamentally fun, I always think of Guillotine. This card based game is easy to learn and easy to play. It scales well from 2-5 players and there's enough player interaction to make sure each game is fairly lively. This edition has a cute stand up Guillotine which stands at the end of the cards, it's a small touch but worth the extra couple of bucks for this edition.Basically, you chose cards from a line up of folks who are waiting to be executed, each card has its own "power" and some can radically shift the line up and shape of the game. Very easy to learn and play and it's good for a wide age range. We've played it with our 8 year, 13, 16 year old kids. They loved it, we loved it, it's just a very fun game.

I got the kickstarter edition of this game, and wasn't crazy when they quickly put out a second edition. Good Cop, Bad Cop is a deduction game, very much in the same vein as The Resistance or Bang!. You have only a few rounds to figure out who are the good guys and who are the bad. The game needs at least 4 people, but it works better with 5-6.I really wanted to like this game, but the few times I've played it, the game didn't last long enough to really be interesting, and at 4 people it felt a little clunky. I like the theme, but I prefer other, richer deduction games like Masquerade.

Sometimes it's nice to have a light, dice chucker, to mix things up between longer brain burning strategy game. This one is the same kind of push-your-luck dice game that Zombie dice is, except of course with a different theme. It's challenging to go on a long streak, but possible. The game also has a nice function where you can challenge a player on a roll (who has decided to stop) to keep rolling. It helps keep the game moving along and is a nice game changing feature when played right.This game has been popping up on Amazon around the $10 mark which is perfect. It's a small, fun, dice chucker that can be used as a warm up game or a quick break between longer, more in depth games

If there was one game that really showed me how much I enjoy "Euro" style board gaming, it was Carcassonne. This game easily scales from 2-5 players and is as fun at 2 as it is at 5. Players take turns drawing and placing tiles to build a city. You have the option of placing meeples on your tiles for scoring (when a city is complete you score, when a road is complete you score and then there are big pastures which can really rack up points).One tip that has helped speed up game play is that each player draws their next tile after their turn is complete. This gives more time to think and plan your next move.True to most Euros the winner of the game may not be the point leader heading into the finish as there are a lot of end game point add ups that can really swing the game in your favor.It's hard to think of a better, clearer. more entertaining introduction to Board Gaming than Carcassonne!

The Builders Middle Ages is the best worker placement 101 game I know of. You recruit workers who each bring a certain kind of materials to the job and then match these workers with the buildings you need to build. The trick is you need to manage the money you have as each worker requires a certain amount of money to go to work and each building nets you a certain amount of money once you build it.The tin that this game is in is fairly small, which makes this a good game to travel with and the rules are well written, easy to follow and the game is very easy to pick up.If you've never played a worker placement game and want to find out if that style is good for you, there could be no better place to start than The Builder Middle Ages. I'm looking forward to more in this series. as it is a series that could easily have other themes.

This is a great party game for 4-8 players. While the game says it supports 3, the sweet spot is really 5 or 6 players as it make the deduction part of this game even more fun.The core of Bang! The Dice Game is rolling dice an trying to eliminate the players you think are on the other side. Sometimes it can be difficult to know who is working against you and who is working for you, and figuring that out is a lot of the fun. Each player has a special ability which helps change up the dynamics of the game and keeps things running (even in the face of bad dice rolls).This is a game that gets a fair amount of play with one of my gaming groups because it's relatively quick, easy to play in a group and a lot of fun. I'd highly recommend it for people looking for good 4+ player party games.

Let's get this right out of the way, this is kind of and oddball in the Humidifier world. The Micro Clean Pot comes with a big bowl which you fill with water and then you place the floating Cool-Mist Humidifier on top of the water. It's kind of an uncommon configuration, but the key here is that it's more sanitary that many of the tank humidifiers and you can really clean out the tank and all the components.Once you get this Micro CleanPot all set up it does begin to produce cool mist within a minute or two. This humidifier comes with two different tops, one which directs the cool-mist straight up (like a volcano) and another which directs it to the side (like a teapot). The external controller has a nice range of cool-mist and is both well made and well designed. All the components of this Humidifier are very well made.How much you like this really depends on if this odd style of Humidifier appeals to you or not. It works, and works well, but the floating bowl style is a bit odd. It does seem to hold more water than conventional tanks, but the downside is that it's open water.Miro recommends using filtered water with this as tap water can cause deposits, and they recommend using low-acid oils for aromatherapy.Another important note, it's important not to let this humidifier run completely dry or operate the floating part outside of water, as without water it can get damaged while running.

My daughter LOVES nature and so she was extremely excited when I got this Nature Bound Critter Barn. It's a very simple and easy to use critter container. In addition to removing the top lid, there's a small hatch which can be used to put small bugs and creatures into this "critter barn". The side of the container has an etched in ruler for measuring critters and there's an LED light as well as a magnifying glass on top.While this is labeled as at "Habitat", it's really not designed for long term holding of critters, it's really more of a short term observation container than a full blown habitat. Having said that, it's well built, designed and perfect size for young kids to hold and use (My daughter is 8 and it is perfect for her).

It's difficult to really judge the efficacy of a supplement so often it comes down to evaluating any negatives associated with it. When it comes to Garlic Supplements and Fish Oil the real issue is a matter of taste: how they go down and if there is any residual coming back up (ie burping). In the case of the BRI Nutrition Garlic Softgels there is absolutely no issue with taste.The supplements are very small little green orbs which are easy to swallow and have no real taste. You are directed to take 2, which I did, and at no point did I burp up garlic or have any form of digestion issues.How well they work, it's hard to tell. But the experience is quite positive, which with Garlic pills is key.BRI Nutrition provided me with a sample for review, but I'd happily pay for these garlic pills as the experience was very positive.

Amazon has built a reputation in it's Amazon Jewelry Collection for providing quality jewelry at very good prices. Here they've got 10K Gold earrings just under the $100 mark. These gold triangle earrings are textured with gold posts. They come packaged in a small cardboard box with a felt drawstring bag inside.The first thing that struck me about these earrings was the fact that they are EXCEPTIONALLY light. To some this may come of as "cheap", which is VERY important if you are buying these as a gift. But once you put them on, they don't look cheap, they sparkle and shine nicely and look really good. For some dangle earrings which are this light may be a big advantage but others may not be able to get past the way they feel.The workmanship on these earrings is solid, and they dangle well on the posts without tangling. The biggest issue though is that they don't "feel" like $100 earrings and while they are nice, there isn't much of a WOW factor, making them less ideal a choice for giving as a gift. Even though they are 10K gold, it's hard to wrap my head around the $180 MSRP. These would more comfortably fall in the $60-$75 range (and given Amazon's seasonal jewelry sales, perhaps someday they will be).  At that budget though, Amazon has better options in their jewelry collection line that has a much bigger impact when given as a gift.This is also another case where I wish Amazon would let reviewers rate 1/2 stars, as this is very much a 3 1/2 star product.

Renting snorkeling gear on vacation can often cost just as much as actually purchasing your own gear. This set from Phantom Aquatics is FAR superior to anything I've ever rented.The flippers are a mix of molded plastic and rubber. This combination gives them a lot more heft in the water and a lot more power. The heel strap is easily adjustable and it quickly zips in and out for the perfect fit (which is very important for control and power).The Goggles are made from tempered glass and did not fog underwater. These are some of the clearest goggles I've ever used and their wide triangular lenses gave a very wide range of view. the mask part of the goggles is made from silicon, which has wide coverage, was easy to adjust, fit perfectly, sealed great, without any leaking.Perhaps the strongest part of this set is the mouthpiece which has a valve stop so that if go under water (or get hit by a wave) you won't breathe in water.All of this comes in two bags. One for the mask which is plastic (and protects the mask well) and a large mesh bag for the flippers. At this quality level and this price, it's absolutely worth buying the Phantom gear rather than renting. The quality simply blows away anything I've ever rented.

Bedside charging of a phone and watch can messy, and this stand makes charging an iWatch and iPhone a snap. The stand is made from a nicely polished wood with cut outs for both the iWatch charger and for a lightning cable. The phone area of the stand has a cut out so you can still easily access the iPhone's home button. The design is pretty simple with nice cord management so that everything comes out of one section in the back of the stand.  The stand also has four rubber feet which helps stabilize it so it doesn't slide or move around.Since this stand does not come with any cables or ports, you can use the phone part with other phones and it fit my Nexus 5 and my son's Samsung Galaxy S5 without an issue (all of which were in phone cases).Niutop has made a simple. quality, and affordable solution for those of us who charge our devices on our nightstand.Nuitop provided a sample to review. But that didn't impact the review or rating in any way.

This MP3 player looks a lot like the old iPod Nano, but that's where the similarities end. Cheaply made (mostly cheap plastic) and poorly designed, this mp3 player fails on almost all accounts. The interface is completely counter intuitive. To select things on the player you have to use the menu button (the center button doesn't do anything in menu mode). To exit menus you need to select the pause button, except if you are listening to music in which case you have to hold down the menu button. The graphical interface/OS on this device is circa 1999.The 16 GB MP3 player includes a USB to Micro USB cable and a pair of earbud head phones. The headphones are nothing short of horrid. The music is tinny, hollow and just plain horrible. I plugged in my Bose headphones and that improved the audio quality considerably. The player has several EQ modes, but they only make very very slight adjustments to the audio. It also has a variable speed mode which lets you slowdown or speed up the audio, an odd feature.The player also plays videos, but they need to be in the oddball .AMV format. The quality is poor at best.G.G. Martinsen provided a sample of their MP3 player for me to review.

Sometimes you buy something that is so easy to use and does its job so well, you wish that more products could be like it. That's the case with the Gideon Handheld Portable Fabric Steamer. This little steamer does exactly what it needs to and does it extremely well. Fill the steamer up with water, switch it on and it starts steaming extremely quickly. It's small enough to be able to maneuver around garments and does a good job tackling even tough wrinkles.We hate to iron and it's nice to have a small, easy to use, and effective steamer to deal with wrinkled clothes quickly and easily.Gideon did provide a sample to review, but it's well worth every penny and I'd absolutely consider buying this as a gift, as I didn't know how useful something like this is until we used it.

I've gone digital with many of my magazines, and let subscriptions lapse to many others. Entertainment Weekly is one of the very few magazines I continue to re-subsribe to and I ACTUALLY read.EW has done a great job of keeping their finger on the pulse of Pop Culture. They're often early  on trends and do a great job with their seasonal wrap ups: New Fall TV, Summer Movies, etc. They've managed to keep the quality of writing up while other magazines in their class have gone to hell. I also appreciate that the print subscription also entitles you to a digital copy of the magazine, which is always helpful when I travel.So much info has migrated online, but Entertainment Weekly continues to maintain its relevancy as one of the last great print magazines.

Reality TV isn't really real, you know that right? In the industry it's never referred to as "reality" it's referred to as "unscripted". Using the platform of a Batchelor-esque show, UnREAL turns the lens on the people who make this kind of programing and rips off the bandaid to expose exactly what lengths they go to in order to make "good TV". This is a smart, well written, well produced, and well acted show that I'm glad I discovered here on Amazon. I plan on binge watching it.

A few months back we had an incident where a worker used a gas powered tool which he left running in our garage. This set off our carbon monoxide alarm and we evacuated the house and called the fire department. Luckily everyone was ok (although my daughter had to go to the ER for oxygen). After I did a lot of research to find alarms which were of high quality but also displayed the level of carbon monoxide.The alarm we had was the Kiddie brand, and it saved our bacon, so I decided to give this one a try. It installs very easily and displays the level of carbon monoxide as well as sounding an alarm. This is helpful because with a single glance we can see that indeed it is a carbon monoxide incident and how bad.If you have oil heating or use gas powered tools in your garage, a device like this could save your life.

Bought these wiper blades for our Volvo XC 90. The previous wiper blades we had disintegrated after a brutal winter. The old brand also never quite fit right, and during the winter slipped off the arm.This isn't the case with these Bosh ICON's. They snugly fit the arm on our Volvo and have provided far superior water elimination. These blades are high quality, well built, and with solid aerodynamics. I'll update my review after having them for a few months, but so far, they've been the best blades we've owned.

Sometimes the simplest and strangest things can elevate an experience from "fine" to "memorable". The same iced soda or milkshake sipped through these classic-style paper straws evokes such memories of childhood soda shop treats and lakeside summer lunches that having a box of these on hand can turn a little snack into a little mental vacation. I have them in assorted colors because that's the way I roll -- but no matter the shade, there's something about a coke float pairing with the taste and feel of waxed paper between your lips that just takes you away. Until the phone rings and someone busts your chops with a dose of reality. Send them to voicemail, take another sip, and stay away a little while longer -- you'll be glad you went that extra inch.Four stars instead of a full five for two tiny reasons: first, and through no fault of the product because it is what it is, if you're planning on nursing your drink, plan on fighting with a limp, wet, collapsing straw. Not too quickly, but like every paper straw, eventually and unavoidably. Second, I might truly enjoy such simple pleasures, but if I got THAT excited about a piece of rolled paper coated in paraffin, it would serve my nostalgic old butt if my kids had me committed to mental facility...

I've moved to a sweatpant-and-tee-and-pullover lifestyle, it seems, and I've purchased many different brands and styles lately. These are comfortable, sturdy, well-designed, and inexpensive -- so for overall fit and quality, I give these a full 5 stars for true value.

Consistent coverage from edge to edge which insures that even your larger stamps will coat evenly and cleanly. A wide range of rich and inviting colors makes this and its sister products a great deal. 4 out of 5 stars simply because I try not to get TOO excited about frivolities such as stamp pads -- but you'd be hard-pressed to find me giving a higher review to a different stamping ink.

Consistent coverage from edge to edge which insures that even your larger stamps will coat evenly and cleanly. A wide range of rich and inviting colors makes this and its sister products a great deal. 4 out of 5 stars simply because I try not to get TOO excited about frivolities such as stamp pads -- but you'd be hard-pressed to find me giving a higher review to a different stamping ink.

I had never tried these make-your-own rubber stamps (and I honestly hadn't thought to question, explore, or employ their actual existence). I'm glad I discovered these. Paired with a clear lucite stamping block (sold elsewhere here -- see my review) these make customizing labels and recipe cards a relative snap. I know that being too "Martha" about things that come from the home and kitchen can make a guy seem a bit to fussy, but I'll cop to that. I'll also cop to the fact that everyone sees the simple, homey elegance of such an offering and responds to my efforts with unanimous favor -- so color me Fussy. I'll survive the label. These are great, and I do believe that in this day and age of impersonal socializing via internet and smart phone, such small measures are all we have left to separate us from wild beasts. Well... y'know... if wild beasts had internet access and smart phones. Don't quibble. Just get crafting.

For price, quality, taste and value, 5 Stars all around. I purchased several different peppercorns at once here, and we taste-tested them straight out of the bags. Fresh, fragrant, and full-bodied -- you'll be hard-pressed to find a better deal on a better product. Highly recommended.

Purchased on request as a gift. No surprises for me or the recipient. Inexpensive, no-brainer installation, and well-built and designed. Overall, a quality product.

I downloaded this for my Droid, and it's as faithful to the full online versions and downloads I've tried as possible.A must have, with nothing I've encountered in the free version that even borders on problematic in terms of ads or intrusion.
The recipient -- a major Groban fan -- loves it.The latest from this artist, and a must-have for the Josh Gro-Fan.

A lovely book, with a lovely backstory (read the jacket notes!), and beautiful artwork to compel and inspire.We all have quirks. And even if the rest of the world doesn't know it, someday they'll see how who you are makes who they are even better by association.A must for young people's libraries. Start by reading it to pre-readers. I promise they'll favor it when they master the skills as they age.Me? I missed it so badly I had to find it and reread it 40 years later.
A timeless story that makes little readers (or listeners) embrace both creativity, the love of family, and the appreciation of how unique and wonderful each of us is.

This is in a nutshell the sit-down-to-pee version of the toilet humor we usually get from the urinal set with such notable movies as "The Hangover".Superb writing, brilliant character actors in abundance, and a sub-plot or two that make it more human than the average, yucky, yuckfest.Highly recommended. And highly necessary to keep the kiddies far away while watching.

This is the greatest deal I've seen on this excellent product.I won't rehash the helpful tips of others as they were invaluable in my decision to purchase and invaluable in my practical application when I got my hands on the product.I will add that you should really experiment with your woods to get to know your smokes and flavors.I am a big fan of smoked cheeses and I found the key to success to be as little temperature exposure as possible. This is helped by spreading out the wood instead of piling it, by putting the rack in first for this process (over the roasting wood) and THEN the drip pan, filled with ice. Place individual tins (or foil boats) of cheeses in on top of the ice, which will maintain cool and prevent (or minimize) the melt, and allow more time in with the smoke.A brilliant product and a superior manufacturer.

Chicago Metallic makes an endless line of quality products and this is no exception.Non-stick and open to circulation, these are wonderful baking pans.Don't forget rule one: if your recipe is no good the pan won't save it. So if you have a popover recipe that works for you it will work as well as you hope in this pan.

I have these in a few sizes.If you're worried about size and sticking, I have two bits of advice to address the misgivings of other reviewers:- Use nonstick cooking spray. I think this should be a no-brainer, but that's to MY brain.- I'm not sure what the surprising vexation is, but the size of the metal ball you see at the end of the tongs, regardless of what size or unit you purchase, is going to be the size of the meatball it makes. You cannot keep giving bad reviews to products because you don't pay attention to the "insignificant" details like size before you order them.A good product. Hard on the fingers, but I use a pair of kitchen gloves and I'm fine.

If you're worried about size and sticking, I have two bits of advice to address the misgivings of other reviewers:- Use nonstick cooking spray. I think this should be a no-brainer, but that's to MY brain.- I'm not sure what the surprising vexation is, but the size of the metal ball you see at the end of the tongs, regardless of what size or unit you purchase, is going to be the size of the meatball it makes. You cannot keep giving bad reviews to products because you don't pay attention to the "insignificant" details like size before you order them.A good product. Hard on the fingers, but I use a pair of kitchen gloves and I'm fine.

Hey, for the price you can't expect much, but it sure delivers beyond what you'd think you're in for.Here in New York City it's so densely packed that even a teenager of above-average height poses a threat to transmission and reception of any electronic sort.This has far exceeded the performance of other antennae we've used for digital tv over-air signals, and I'd highly recommend it.

Powerful stuff, naturally flavored and very useful in recipes that don't call for the additional powdered mass of cocoa or the fat and viscosity (or temperament) of melted chocolate.Try it in a cup of coffee. I find I throw it into everything lately short of broccoli.Ooh! Dinner brainstorm...

My own personal misgivings with this album upon listening -- and Miss Evancho is just blessed with the voice of an absolute angel -- is that in my book, little girls can't be taken seriously with any comfort when they sing of things beyond their scope of experience.Not that I'd want an album of tunes about ponies and rainbows and Girl Scout Cookie sales... but when a barely-teenaged kid sings the word "love" in any context other than discussions of her stuffed animal collection, I get a bit of the heebie-jeebies.

...It does the trick.Make sure to insert the stems fully. And beware the metal shake mixer blade: it's really rather sharp.I had none of the battery compartment complaints of other users. For a cheap little unit, it's portable and practical, and surprisingly more powerful than it looks.
This particular design simply does not work for me.They need to create one that's reverse or ambidextrous, because my fruit -- much like myself -- dresses left.

And as a 46 year-old baby, I wanted (nay... DEMANDED) three things:Fleece Pajamas; a bowl of soup (OK, mac and cheese, but I didn't want to sound like a pig) the size of my HEAD; and THIS MOVIE.One of my favorites from childhood (I saw it first run when it premiered, right around the corner from where I now live, at the fabled Radio City Music Hall) I didn't think twice before searching for it and clicking "Heck Yeah!" on the RENT IN HD FOR 48 HOURS button, and kicking back to enjoy.It did not let me down, and is EVERYTHING it was back then.This movie is just... magic. And what's more, it reminds you of what it's like to be young and hopeful and certain the world is full of mystery and amazement. It only takes a few minutes to suck you in, so when the inimitable Angela Lansbury (starring here as a wanna-be mail order apprentice witch living in the outskirts of London at the onset of WWII) sings to one of her young charges that he's "At the Age of Disbelieving", you can't help but shake your head in agreement and slight pity as you side with her, hoping he'll come around and like you, realize what amazing adventures the world holds in store for you.The extra 20 minutes excised from the original theatrical release (it was contractual: Radio City would run premieres with a full-out stage show, and for time reasons films had to fit strict time constraints or they'd just shut the projector or yank the film from the marquee) have been restored here. And considering I was in the fleece pajamas and full of mac and cheese, I didn't miss the stage show one bit, either.If your kids don't love this movie, you're raising them wrong, and shame on you.If you don't love this too, you were never a child and were dropped here from an icy, heartless planet, and you need to get over all the burdens of the world and allow yourself to fall in love with it.I promise you will.Traguna... Macoides... Tracorum... Satis... Dee!

If you can't stand Bette Midler and you can't stand Lily Tomlin, you're both humorless, and misguided in checking out this video.That's because both absolutely SHINE in outstanding comic performances, each as an identical twins switched at birth and reconfigured to make two mismatched sets of fraternal twins on opposing sides of a battle of wits and wills and politics as Big Business tries to strip mine Little Town.And when you set this or any farce -- bedroom or otherwise -- at New York City's fabled Plaza Hotel, you know you're going to smack your head and say aloud, "that's so stupid" as you catch yourself belly-laughing in spite of your high-brow intentions.A great flick with a big bowl of popcorn and constantly arched eyebrow.

Poor Ms. Boyle didn't know what hit her when she got so famous so quickly, and thus to see her make a live appearance is to witness a deer in a dress and lipstick caught in the headlights and wishing you'd just kill her with minimal fuss and teasing and be done with it.Here, behind the microphone and unencumbered by the distractions of an audience, is where she flies.And in this case, to great heights we've missed seeing her hit lately.Kudos. A wonderful collection.

The AccuWeather alerts are great -- on time, accurate, and allowing (if necessary) direct access to web updates and further info.But the App itself shows so much info laid out so oddly that just checking what the temp will be later in the day becomes a frustrating task.

I have been searching tirelessly for the one single authoritative voice on this subject, and am blessed to report I have no further to look than these pages right here.Plagued by a life's-worth of choices and circumstances that have been the OPPOSITE of Huge Ship Avoidance, I have tried to stay my course and navigate the rough waters with every available title on the shelves of the local booksellers."Stay Away From Big Watercraft"; "Avoiding Huge Ships For Dummies" (both editions); "Huge Ship Avoidance for the Soul"; "Gurl, That Durn Ship Gonna Hit Ya: The Gay Man's Guide to Not Getting it in the Stern"; "What Jesus Knew Before Walking On Water: The Christian Guide to Avoiding Huge Ships"; and the arch and irreverent but poorly edited and uninformative "But Are You TRYING to Take A Steamer to Your Sternum?"They all left me feeling... adrift...With its helpful diagrams and no-nonsense editorial tone, with "How to Avoid Huge Ships" I felt that I was not only being given the information I so desperately needed (Dudes... DESPERATELY with like a capital "Duh") with a minimum of fluff and folderol, but that I wasn't being spoken down to in a way that made me feel like as huge an accident-of-creation moron as those other books did, simply because I totally am.

Fans of "The Chew" will not be disappointed by this much talked-about (on the show itself, especially) cook book featuring some of the best and most frequently referred-to recipes from the five show hosts.

Keep it charged and keep it handy, and it will really help you when you find yourself desperate for a power boost when stopping to plug in a device for a full charge just isn't in the realm of immediate possibilities.You won't get nearly a full tank of e-Gas out of this, but you won't be thumbing desperately for a ride along a parched stretch of desolate highway praying for a service station to miraculously appear.I would say this is for emergency use, not regular daily topping-off of your battery before bed time, because this unit will be shot in no time if you don't treat it with care and respect.Gave five as gifts. All five have reported satisfaction.

Yes, folks, you've heard it before:- Eat fewer calories.- Burn more calories.That's how you battle a plateau, be it after substantial weight loss or because you have attempted nothing at all so far.This book is just fine, if you've been in a cave and haven't heard all of this advice a hundred times before, especially BY Dr. Smith when he appears on the television shows of any of his Oprah-Matic-2000 factory-tooled teleprofessional cohorts.

It becomes rather addictive rather quickly.This has SO LITTLE TO DO with Angry Birds except the pigs are the same ones seen in those original, now-classic games.Here, you're sort of rigging contraptions that are part car, part train, part airplane, part scooter and part Rube Goldberg whatchamacallit to steer your piggie toward the goal of picking up blue prints (and points and bonuses on the way) that are ostensibly part of his plan to avenge his brethren among the Mad Avians by whom they're thwarted.Enjoy!

You can take your laptop away from the wall outlet for a few hours.That's it.Ignore the label's promises for hours of output, and keep an eye on the power meter, and you'll be fine.No worse nor much more brilliant than any other replacement battery on the market, but a good value overall.

Lydia writes with such love and enjoyment of the food and the process that it's infectious.And I swear, if the woman jotted down her method for pouring a glass of ice water, it would probably have you salivating and no doubt enjoying a glass of ice water like you'd never had one before.A truly wonderful collection of essential recipes from a wonderful chef-author.

As others have noted in more extensive reviews I find to serve this conversation more adequately than anything I can contribute, replacements are never as good as a fresh OEM battery in a new, bare-bones computer.And batteries in general are never as good or long-lasting as the seemingly arbitrary number of hours they predict and promise in the package literature.If you're going to grab your laptop, take it on the road, and need a few hours away from an AC source, you'll be fine.

These are handy, and they leave you feeling clean. Especially during the cold and flu season (and especially here in New York City, where it often feels as if every one of the millions of public surfaces with which you come in contact daily has been freshly licked or sneezed upon) throwing a handful of these into your bag or pocket is a thrifty, essential no-brainer. And as a fan of liquid hand sanitizers, I also find these leave me less dried out than the gook in the tube. I always have to moisturize after using those, and this doesn't affect me quite as harshly in that regard.

This was purchased for my Dad for his new Pickup, and honestly, though it does provide security, it required more than a bit of jerry rigging and a trip to the hardware store, as we actually had to punch through the door housing and use our ouwn mounting hardware And it's not what's pictured.We rather figured it to be a replacement for the un-locking pull-handle mechanism -- pop out the old, pop in the new.But think of this more as a tiny, door-handle version of the sort of tiny, permanent, "Club" contraption you'd install on your steering wheel for theft prevention. And that's once you install it.Not that any other comparable unit is going to be easier to retrofit, but this seemed  like an awful lot of seat-of-our-pants instead of manufacturer-planned cutting and pasting.Given it's not a "One Size Fits All" contraption, but that you select the unit for your specific make and model vehicle, this is really rather an unacceptable fact.Two stars for the fact that once the mountains are moved to make it work out right, it works beautifully and secures the vehicle as expected.

The drawback to this cart was simply that, with just five pieces (aside from the four wheels) it took me forever to put together because it REALLY is a two-person job. Not a terrible construction project, mind you; but it is SO much easier to alight the thingie that has to snap into the whatsis when you have four hands to hold and push and press.Besides that, it's a simple little cart that came dirt cheap, and all I needed was a little extra storage in my kitchen in a particular corner for which this seems, dimensionally, to have been built to order.I don't really even need to roll it, but it rolls, so... bonus.

First, the good news:- Inexpensive, as I purchased as an Amazon Prime Add-on product.- Remington is a known and trusted name, so I knew it and trusted it.- It revived the garments I tried first (pet hoodies, of all things) BRILLIANTLY.- Probably the most effective pill remover I've ever tried.Some reviewers complained of fabric shredding pulling issues and such. I had no similar experiences, and I believe if you take care to exercise common sense when using this (ie., pulling cloth taut, type of material upon which you choose to use it, not treating it like a hedge trimmer and hacking at the garment) you, too, will not suffer any damage from using this on your good clothing.Now, the bad:- It's made like junk.- The On/Off switch moves from On to Off, but this seems to be purely for my entertainment because it never actually shuts the motor. Maybe it's just my unit that's flawed, maybe it's pandemic; but certainly, it's a pain.- The battery compartment, once you open it, does not want to stay closed. And I mean when it's empty of batteries because...- THE BATTERY COMPARTMENT COVER DOESN'T FIT WHEN IT'S GOT BATTERIES IN IT.- I had to insert the batteries, leave the cover off, and operate it looking half-built and half-brained. But this didn't make it any worse to use except aesthetically. The batteries stayed in place throughout the process.- But the batteries CAN'T stay in because as I stated above, THE ON/OFF SWITCH IS GLITCHED so the only way to turn the unit OFF is to remove the juice.- This is how I learned the compartment door won't go back on after the batteries are again removed. It just seems that it was made to fit to show all pretty in the package, but once it's been jimmied open, it's just misshapen enough to not fit back where it should be.So now I have a ziplock bag with the unit, the batteries, and the battery compartment door stored together, but disassembled out of necessity.But when I DO assemble it and use it, THE PERFORMANCE ON THIS POORLY MADE UNIT IS UNEQUALED."Buyer Beware" is more a case of "Buyer Be Aware" because if you don't mind the extra fuss, the results are worth the trouble.

I bought this because I got a wild bug up my butt to make spaetzle.This was so not essential.Now, it is not only essential, it's religious. It's poetic. It's life-affirming.I had made spaetzle before. Not recently, mind you, because I'm both stubborn and easily swayed to self-directed anger, and having never secured a proper recipe for the fabulous little dumplings I'd tried from sources other than my own kitchen, I never stopped to think "hey, Italian Boy, maybe this isn't a liquidy typical pasta batter, but an eggy concoction you're underthinking."And I'd tried to run it through sieves and off a spoon and out of squirt bottles, and it always came out like fluffy, semi-doughy garbage.I got the right recipe recently. I got this.I got a wake up call.This simple little gadget, coupled with a recipe that I now hallow (comparable to the one printed right on this product's package) made what used to be a stress-filled, arduous, long and unfulfilling process an absolute snap.It took me 3 minutes to measure and mix my first batch. It took me 3 minutes to boil, cool and drain that first batch. It took me 3 SECONDS to decide to instantly make a second batch.And it took my family about 3 minutes to inhale the two different varieties I'd made and presented to them.This thing makes perfect spaetzle. It cleans up instantly and beautifully.And it now resides on a very accessible shelf in the cabinet, because any time I need a starchy side, I'll quickly opt for a fresh batch of spatzle, made from scratch in half the time as boiling boxed dried pasta, and a quarter the time of boiling plain old rice.I'm devoted. And also, admittedly, more than a touch daft. Enjoy.

For those worried about or critical of the problem of loose grinds, I can happily report that the strainer mechanism on this unit is so fine-meshed that even with (and I know this is a no-no on my part) a fine espresso blend I had NEXT TO NOTHING lingering in the bottom of my cup. This mesh layer DOES require a bit more attentiveness when washing to thoroughly remove all stragglers, but it's a minor inconvenience.I find it sleek yet sturdy, even the slender handle that apparently ruined the lives and well-being of some of the nastier reviewers, so don't sweat that.And the silicone bottom DOES add stability, but DO NOTE: when the carafe is hot, it will slip right out of this rubber footing, so just be mindful. It's perfectly sturdy with it's flat glass bottom being unholstered, but you won't want to put it down thinking the bottom is in place only to find you settled it unbalanced and wind up with a spilling or tipping hazard.A lovely, lovely press that made, for me, two nice-sized mugs of coffee -- the second of which was still pleasantly warm a good 10 or 15 minutes later.

I ordered these for a wine enthusiast as a stocking-stuffer. Inexpensive as they are, they are solid, seal well for a short storage spell, and look built to last.The ball tops screw off if you need extra head space in the refrigerator, but this leads me to point out a whole cognitive dilemma for some people, so gifters beware:When I told another liquor-loving friend about these, and about the removable ball-tops, and how you can keep your leftover wine sealed inside or outside the refrigerator, he found this incomprehensible."What on EARTH," he bellowed in astonishment, "is 'leftover wine'?"

I can't judge the product yet, and I'll explain why at the end.What I CAN say is:- They are thicker than regular balloons, for those who criticized that that's all this is, and seem rather durable. I can see getting several uses per pair of pairs.- The dog didn't seem THAT uncomfortable. But in the same way that I don't seem THAT uncomfortable when my sock is bunched up in my boot and it's annoying but not painful every time I put my foot down and take another step, looking forward to removing the boot and fixing my sock. Things could be worse. The dog realizes this.So I'm staying even-keeled in my star-rating.The PROBLEM is that I didn't look far enough into the product info to see that the Size Small batch I ordered is actually the THIRD LARGEST size available. Considering I buy an XS t-shirt for myself, I should have thought to investigate, but I didn't and now I'm paying for it. And to be honest (shame on you, Amazon!) the ordering screen for these things is not the most intuitive of pages on this site. Why they give you a color choice is beyond me, because unless you look closely you won't realize changing colors is ALSO changing SIZES on your order. Beware...The size Smalls DO go up to 2-1/2", but they don't go DOWN to Chihuahua size. My poor girl looked at me as if to say, "you really have nothing better to do but stick party favors on me and laugh? Really? Really..."So I just ordered a batch of the XXS (the SMALLEST size) and we will try again. The one thing I DON'T look forward to is that with the super-too-big ones I tried first (and then gave to a grateful friend with a larger dog) they were indeed easy to stretch open and put on. I can only imagine the proper-fitting boot will also mean a proper struggle to get the dog's paws into them.

Whether it's "Family Guy" or an interview, the beauty of Seth MacFarlane is this:You know you're thinking it; He's thinking it AND says it out loud."Ted" is a prime example of this. As if the madcap and maddening adventures of a 35 year-old with a talking plush teddy bear aren't enough as it is, just as you're sitting there thinking "it would be SO messed up if he said/did/smoked this," either Mark Wahlberg or the bear says it or does it or smokes it.Not for kids, by any stretch. The language is beyond coarse and the action gets racy as well. This is Snuggle the Fabric Softener Bear if the fabric softener bottle is filled with over-proof tequila, and you're fighting over the worm with a stuffed animal with a bacchanalian bent.

It was hard to find an appropriate card case for a gift for my Mom. Having long overstuffed and outgrown her current one, she mentioned her need (as one can only "mention" a need a few weeks before Christmas) for a new one, and lamented the difficulty in tracking down one that would serve her purposes.She doesn't need a coin purse, and this doesn't have one. She doesn't need a cash compartment, and this doesn't have one. She carries a wallet with coin and cash compartments, and just wants to tuck a Twenty and two quarters for a phone call in a spare space as a bonus. This has one.What she really needs is a holder that will take all of her credit cards and gift cards and frequent shopper cards and lord-amighty-I-really-need-to-spend-less-time-in-retail-situations cards, with a receipt tucked in here and there and no need for a lot of digging to find any of it.This has that.It's a double-snap design, so upon opening "page one" of this nice, durable leather wallet, you find a clear ID slot (which can take multiple card-sized items) as well as a tiered display for your most used cards. "Flip the page" to the second snap, and that compartment features two more facing tired storage folios. And it still manages to remain sleek as its gusseted spine is built to be filled. You won't wind up with a 2" thick case that tapers uncomfortably into a bulging "V" at its hinge.It's my guess (and my hope) that she will run out of credit cards and store cards before she runs out of places to store them all in this lovely find of a handbag accessory. A great value, and highly recommended.
Inexpensive, and built accordingly.Fits the phone.Looks cute, not classy.It is what it is and I bought it with that expectation and it doesn't disappoint.

Look: it's a cheap bag that's surprisingly well made for the price, so complaints should be kept to a minimum regardless.But the one thing that vexes me -- and I purchased two of these for gifts -- is that the strap clasp is not placed appropriately.It doesn't matter that the latch on the flap is placed midway up. What matters is that the strap part -- the part on the bag body itself that loops through and back out of the latch to "tie down" the flap -- is sewn way too high for the depth of the flap.Meaning that if you actually needed to fasten the flap closed (personally, I carry a messenger bag with a full-sized flap and no closures whatsoever, so it's not necessarily a must to secure the contents) either the bag must be so overstuffed that the flap doesn't come nearly as far down the front of the bag as it can when empty, or (and this will probably be 90% of your problematic closure encounters) the flap has to be rolled or bunched up in order for the strap end of the closure to be pulled through the latch.Think of it as looking at Venetian blinds, which sit beautifully flat when in their fully extended "down" position, but which are designed to compress accordion-style when pulled taut.This bag will have to pull taut when closed, though it's not supposed to be (and isn't) designed to do so.

This game starts off as a challenge and gets deeper and more perplexing as you move on to the next game in each level.I found that toward the end of the EASY level games it began to take a good, long time to complete the grids. You will be in for quite a sleuthing job (combining common sense, keen attention, math, memory and whole lot of logic skill).A great app.

Don't let the early stages fool you: as you progress through your game, you will find it more and more difficult to complete all the words in each round's list, and even finding the minimum needed to advance to the next level can become vexing.Which is the point of a well constructed word game, so consider this one well done.

Not the most challenging of word games, but it never promised to be.A good go-to when you just need a diversion, like on the subway or when someone is chatting your ear off and you want to feign deep contemplation...I enjoy it.

Myrna Loy and William Powell can do no wrong in my book, and are as flawless as expected in this, the follow-up to the original "The Thin Man".Picking up right off the train that ended the first film, the sleuthing marrieds and their feisty dog Asta are thrust immediately into more intrigue, this one with more twists and turns and surprises than its predecessor.I'm just wondering if, as I move on to the next one, there's a chance that somebody chunky will appear as a likely culprit...

While I'm certain there are more bells and whistles to be found on other, more expensive units, this is an ideal hot air popcorn popper.It's compact size shouldn't fool you: the half-cup kernel capacity will provide a huge bowl of movie night popcorn, and it makes it in about 2 minutes -- with subsequent batches (for longer movies) taking as little as a minute thanks to the unit heating up and staying so hot.I had zero problems batch after batch with fly-away, but what DID take my rating down one star (even though it's very manageable) is the fact that a whole bunch of kernels will blow out before the popping starts, simply because of the super strength of the heat fan.Throw them back in, toss 'em over your shoulder for good luck, chuck 'em in the trash, or whatever -- it'll only be a spoonful, and it certainly doesn't make this any less appealing than the other (MANY other) poppers I've owned.Plus, it cleans up with a shake-and-a-blow, wipes up if necessary, and cools down quickly.An amazing value.

...sadly, I do not.Positives first:- Sleek and good looking.- Lined and warm.- You can indeed manipulate your phone without removing gloves.However -- and here come the negatives...- They run a bit big, so err on the side of going down a size if in doubt.- They are cumbersome. With a smartphone being an extension of the self, practically, it would be great if these were skin-tight, like a latex glove. But they're not.- You have to learn which angle to tap from on the sensor fingers, or you won't be read with precision.- You will never be able to use a real on-board or slide-out keyboard, because the tips are just too glove-like and you will hit 10 wrong keys before finally nailing the one you want.- THIS IS NOT A TYPING GLOVE so don't think you'll be able to text on a virtual keyboard. You can touch your screen and it will read.
