Puritanical nonsense that instills in girls the idea that their worth is derived from their perceived purity. This idea caused me to have a full panic attack and cry for hours and hours when a boy kissed me when I was 13. I thought I had lost my purity and I was then worthless. If you are equating virgin "purity" with virtue and worth, you will end up with children who have all sorts of sexual hangups and self-esteem problems. Definitely skip this kind of sexist junk. Someone gave me this book when I was 8 years old. Why an 8 year old needs to be worrying about her "purity" is beyond me.
This book is old, but it's as relevant as ever. A must-read for anyone who cares about real feminism.

I've cast in resin before, and this is about the most economical and least stinky resin you can get. Keep in mind that even after 24 hours, your pieces will be hardened enough to demold, but still relatively soft and tacky. You'll think you've done something wrong, but this stuff just takes FOREVER to cure. 72 hours, I've found is the best wait time for a full cure. If you're an impatient type, this might not be the resin for you, but you can't beat the price. I've found by adding slightly more hardener than resin (maybe a few big drops worth), I can get my pieces to cure a tich faster (but not much faster). However, your mileage may vary. If you're going to mess up your measurements, definitely DO NOT use more resin than hardener or your pieces will never cure. This resin is pretty thin, so if you're wanting to put a big fat dome on your pieces when you're done, I recommend a thicker type. ICE resin is better for doming but it's more expensive. BUT, you could get ICE resin just for doming and save money by doing your casting with this and your doming with ICE. This stuff mixes fine with inks, pigments, and I've even mixed it with glow in the dark powder and made cool glowing charms. It takes to sanding well, and if you manage to keep the dust out of your workspace, is crystal clear. Overall, it's a great value.One caveat: Just because it's low odor does not mean you shouldn't still have a well-ventilated workspace. I've once gave myself a headache with this stuff because there isn't a terrible stink reminding me to open the window, so keep that in mind when working with it. Open a window and put on a fan!

I mixed this powder with some easycast acrylic and made some super cool glowing cellphone charms for my little sister's birthday. Keep in mind that this powder does not dissolve, so it will turn the acrylic white (you can also add color inks to give it a pastel cast, instead of plain white). If you want to make a piece with glitter or found objects or stickers or whatever, do your first layer with clear acrylic and add your objects. Wait until it's tacky but not completely set, then mix another batch of acrylic with your glow powder and pigments or whatever you like and pour it over the partially set lower layer. This way you still see your glitter and stuff on the front of the piece but the charm will still glow. The powder is very very fine and does not make the acrylic feel crusty or chunky to work with. It also glows very bright! Love it, and the price isn't bad!

I have loved every Animal Crossing iteration and this game is no exception. If you want a fast-paced, challenging game, this game is not for you. The game works in (basically) real time. Shops close at night and open in the morning. There are many things to do in the game which will occupy just about anyone with any interest. I enjoy collecting rare items and landscaping, but my husband is a fan of fishing til he drops. Though kids might not initially want to share their game cartridge with siblings, parents should note that all the AC games work better when the villagers team up to conquer challenges like filling the museum with every type of fish or fossil or insect. Initially I was skeptical of the fact that instead of starting from the bottom up, you start out in the game as the "mayor". However, the game mechanics are essentially the same and aside from having the authority to enact ordinances and place public works projects, you still start out as a "nobody" in the game with a tiny house and no money or items. The public works projects are a great new feature which allow the player to further customize their town beyond what was possible in earlier AC games. The graphics and character designs have been changed slightly (improved, in my opinion), giving villagers a more realistically human body shape, and giving female villagers the option of not wearing dresses all the time, which I found annoying in earlier games, since even "boy" shirts would turn into dresses on a girl character. Different kinds of shoes can be purchased along with socks, which is also a new feature, since in earlier games your character wore the same shoes all the time (though you could customize the color in CF). My favorite new feature, if I had to choose, would be the QR code clothing and pattern feature allowing artsy players to design and share their designs for clothes, ground pattern tiles, and wallpapers, etc. with other gamers. A wealth of QRs can be found online, so even the most un-artistic player can find things to suit them.Gripes:1. There is no option to be nonwhite in this game, and the only way for people of color to get a character that looks something like them is to stand in the sun on the island to get a "tan" or to customize their character with a Mii mask. Because this game has such a diverse following, it would behoove the developers to allow players to customize their skin color if they are nonwhite.2. This one is a gimmie, as I have this issue with every AC title, but moreso in this title as there are many non-reorderable items in the game: Players need more storage space for all the non-reorderable items they inevitably accumulate.3. The town map really ought to be a bit bigger. It was too big in City Folk, which led to lots of wasted areas, so I understand the decision to pare down. However, with the addition of the public works project feature, space becomes a precious resource in this game.4. You can't control where new villagers put their houses. A new villager could potentially plop their house in the middle of your hybrid flower mural of Princess Peach (I'm looking at you, Daisy) or right in the middle of a "road". This headache can be avoided by knowing when villagers are supposed to move in and doing something called plot resetting (google it), but, as this is technically a game cheat, game purists may not want to do this and just end up taking villagers as they come, even if they park their home in the middle of the park or your precious landscaping.
These are super cute, soft, comfortable, and aren't hot at all! Most leggings like this are made of thick synthetics, but these feel more breathable and less stiflingly hot. I really like them!

I just started a sweaty job that was really causing serious detox breakouts that were extremely painful. I had previously been able to control my acne with my diet, but nothing was helping these recent breakouts. I started taking this supplement, and my breakouts immediately disappeared. My face is healing and almost completely back to normal within four days. I am taking two pills per day. One in the morning and one at night. A higher dosage than that is excessive, in my opinion. I have experienced great results with just the two pills and have had no side effects like the ones reported with the high dosage (10 pills per day is crazy). Great stuff!

I was really excited about my new Wacom 5, but I was not excited about the gritty, draggy, toothy feel it had when drawing. I was also concerned about wearing the surface down too quickly since I am not able to replace the surface myself with this model. This cover makes the surface extremely smooth to work on, so if that's what you want (I did) go for it. It should prevent expensive nib wear and help you get more life out of the drawing surface (I use mine 5+ hours a day every day). If you're on the fence because this is a 3rd party product, don't be. It's not terrible pricey, and it does the job. It also seems very heavy and durable. I doubt I'll have to replace it anytime soon. A+++Downside: it does deactivate the touch feature, but I wasn't using it (except as a novelty) so I barely noticed. Thought I'd mention it. I have the large tablet, so I only use it for drawing. Using it as a mouse would take up my entire desk.

Any reviews lower than 4 stars are probably by people who didn't read this book. This book is extremely important, and is a must-read for anyone feeling gaslighted by the transgender movement. It's extremely succinct, well-researched, interesting, and informative. I highly enjoyed reading.

As a kid, my mom made me drink a weird milkshake in the morning that had a bitter and terrible-tasting form of brewer's yeast in it (among other things). I was loathe as an adult to try tasting it again. I'm glad I went with Lewis Labs yeast. It's completely delicious in most of the foods I make, as it imparts a mellow, cheesy, salty flavor to anything it's added to. I consider brewer's yeast to be one of my favorite seasonings next to salt, as there are few things it doesn't improve. Not to mention it is very healthy and nutrient-rich. If you've been scared off by brewer's yeast in the past due to weird flavors, try this one! It's especially delicious with butter on popcorn. Even the cat approves!

I lived in the country as a kid and was really missing the smell of honeysuckle one day. So naturally, I went on Amazon and tried to find something that smelled just like it. This is as close as I have ever gotten. It's not exactly right, but it still brings back memories of hot summer days and the warm sugary smell of honeysuckle growing on the fence. A+

These are not marketed as liquid containers, but I use them to carry face creams when I'm traveling and they work great. I wouldn't put a non-thick liquid in them, but I've never had a leak when using them for cream or lotion. A+

I love this shirt. It looks cool and I wear it when I'm running. It's not really a women's cut, however. I bought the X-Large thinking it was a women's slim cut tee based on how the image looked, but the shirt is really just a regular t-shirt cut. I wanted it to fit loosely like a tunic for comfort when I'm running, but not look like I'm wearing a large men's shirt... but the effect is so cool, I don't really mind that much so I didn't send it back. If you're looking for a cool shirt, this is the one. Just don't size up too much, and don't expect any of the shaping you'd expect in a girly tee, cuz it's not there! They must have pinned it in the back for the model so it would look more form-fitting.

When I feel like slaying bosses or solving puzzles, this game has me covered. When I feel like looking at some pretty scenery, fishing, playing minigames, riding Epona around, and playing in chill sandbox mode, this game still has me covered. I've beaten it 4 or 5 times, and still love going back for the great visuals and effects and to find all the little random details that I might have overlooked (and there are tons of details). It's a little rough around the edges with motion control, but as far as atmosphere, story, and beauty goes, it's a great value and you won't be disappointed. Some of the levels can be quite stressful and challenging the first go round, and I recommend turning the brightness/contrast up a little on your TV so you can actually see, since much of the gameplay features lovely and atmospheric but hard-on-the-eyes darkness. Great for both longtime Zelda fans and casual gamers alike! Don't spoil the game for yourself by googling all the sidequests and treasure chests. It's much more fun to let the game unfold without any help.

Witchcraft, homeopathy, whatever you want to call this stuff. It works. I had these annoying flat warts on my face that were not going away. I didn't want to burn them off because, hello... it's my face we're talking about. I tried just about everything for them and they were going nowhere. I also had quite a few on my fingers and hands, probably how they ended up on my face in the first place (can you avoid touching your face? Me neither...). I thought I was doomed to look bumpy in harsh light forever, but I bought these weird pellets and gave them a go just for fun. Well, honey, they worked. They actually worked. There are no bumps on me at all. I took a total of three containers (tubes?) worth and I haven't taken any since. I look completely normal now. There are some light spots where the warts used to be, but that is quickly fading as well. I don't know how these work and I don't care. But they work!!

After my intuos 4 finally gave up the ghost after 4 years due to the USB connectors coming loose (I have since had the USB cable soldered directly to the circuit board so it would be useable/resellable) I decided to upgrade to the Intuos 5 touch. Since I am bad at estimating sizes and the medium and large were the same price, I went ahead and went with the larger tablet. It is very large, and very substantially made (heavy) and while it has taken some getting used to in terms of heft, I feel I made a good decision. I use my tablet for illustration work, and I've been able to enjoy a freer range of motion with a larger active area and consequently less hand strain and arm strain. This tablet is a far cry from the large intuos 4, which, while being somewhat dimensionally comparable, was more lightly built and, in my opinion, had a more flimsy handfeel. It appears that the junky USB port construction has been remedied in the 5, and since bluetooth is now an option, one can forgo cables entirely and free up valuable desk space (and avoid connector damage). I purchased the wireless kit with the tablet, and only need to leave it plugged in at night to charge. Sometimes I can get a couple days out of it if I'm not working the entire day. All these features coupled with the multi-touch capability, which I confess I am still getting used to, make this tablet a solid, practical, and function-rich product. I'm very happy with it, and have only had good experiences with Wacom products in the past with the exception of the issues I had with the USB connectors on the Intuos 4 (though those issues were late in the life of the product). I'm very pleased with my tablet.
Enjoyable stories that are worth reading. Not horror per se; better to call them dark and disturbing.I gave them a try and don't regret it.

An atmospheric police procedural that would make an excellent movie. A few minor historical inaccuracies, mentioned by another reviewer were happily not enough to stop me enjoying this thriller, nor should they stop you.
Evocative prose tells the story of two young girls lured into the sordid, lethal world of sex trafficking.Once you read this, you'll never, ever forget it.

I enjoyed the late 70s-early-80s feel of this unique novel. All of the characters felt very real and believable; apart from a few exceptions I enjoyed not knowing what was going to happen next. It's a tale that will linger in my mind for quite some time.

I really enjoyed this collection of the author's paranormal experiences. However, most other readers will be put off by the grammar and spelling errors, lack of capitalization for many words, and regular pages of text without paragraphs. Hopefully the author will have this dealt with, and give potential readers an idea of what his book is about. For now, I'll do that.....
An excellent appetizer that left me wanting more from this author.
Well-told ghost stories from a country whose hauntings are less known than they should be.

When I saw this book, I knew I'd read it and left a positive review. It seems the author has changed the title from "Lady Deborah's Case Files" to it's current title. Whatever it's called, it's an exciting and enjoyable read that I can recommend.
Stories that captured my attention and kept it prisoner until the end. Thank you, Mr. Bray!

The usual mixed bag; I found "The Magic Cabinet" "Poppets" and "Now Wash Your Hands" were excellent; the other stories were for me less enjoyable, especially the final two. But they're certainly worth a try
An excellent story with a good build-up; I didnt quite understand the twist at the end, but it was still great!
An intriguing story, with plenty of horrific details. However I would have preferred more of an explanation of what the City was and how it affected the "real" world outside. That's just me....
Even though I could pretty much guess what would happen right from the beginning, I still very much enjoyed this. This authorauthor knows her stuff; this story has awakened my appetite for more!
I just got this for free on Kindle, despite having read my paperback version at least twice. An excellent book, one of manyby this author.
Riveting and unforgettable.
Engrossing and sometimes thrilling; this is a glimpse into an awful time in mankind's history. Recommended for anybody withan interest in Holocaust studies.

The story continues from Part 1 and is just as exciting. I did find Maria's reaction to her son's behaviour a bit over the top at times,but tried to myself into her shoes, as somebody who knew little or nothing about reincarnation or hypnotic regression. Everythingwas nicely explained and tied up at the end, which I always like to see. Andrew Stafford is definitely on my list of authors to keep aneye out for!
The gripping story of Mr. Domanski's "adventures" in the Polish countryside, while avoiding capture by the occupying Nazis.An excellent addition to the literature of Holocaust memoirs.

As a life-time lover of both true and fictional ghost stories, I have to buy and read this book after coming across it by chance.I enjoyed every minute of it, and hope the author does indeed publish another collection (soon!). Tom Slemen has somecompetition now when it comes to Liverpudlian ghost stories...
Amazing story and great characters. I cant wait to start Part 2
Another tasty collection of ghost stories from parts of Yorkshire and Nottinghamsire.I'm very much looking forward to the next in the series....
A very creepy story, unlike any other horror story I've ever read. I have no hesitation in recommending it.
Since I dont care for sci-fi, I only read the first and last stories. Even so, the first story blew my mind, and the last was thrilling too.

Mutated, carnivorous possums eating innocent (and not so innocent) New Zealanders as well as the occasional tourist, for variety.A great tribute to the creepy-creature pulp horror novels of the 70s. Loved, loved, loved it!
DJ-1984 wrote an excellent, detailed review to which I can add nothing except my complete agreement.

An exciting novella that was full of the unexpected. My only quibble is that the style seems like it's written by a non-British person trying to write like a British author would, and not quite succeeding. Also, the author used several modern expressions (ex. "Sure") that I dont think were used in the 1600's; either in England or anywhere else. Those are minor details, though, on the whole I liked this book and can see it continuing in (a) further volume(s) featuring Laura vs. (the not-quite-dead) Nikolas Freeman.

A very long and engrossing novel; Danny, his mother and friends and of course Lee are characters I spent the best part of three days with and will not soon forget. The author writes well and knows how to get inside her characters.
An exciting read, full of twists and turns. It's imspired me to read more stories by this author....

I was expecting a typical gritty serial-killer novel but got something completely different. The author weaves a skillful tapestryof characters, from IRA members to German police officers to Russian sleepers, many of whom go back and forth between three European countries. The possible/main reason for Peter Bennett's hatred of women didnt seem completely plausible to me, but I could overlook it.  If I'd had a better idea of the plot lines and circumstances I probably would have passed on this one, but am glad I didnt. A good, solid story with most of the loose ends tied up at the end.  I'd like to suggest to the author that the title be shortened to just The Devil's Jigsaw, the  rest of it, in my opinion, does more to put off readers than attract them....

This novel has a really different and very very scary premise. It's well written, suspenseful, and has encouraged me to buy the author's shortstory collections. An excellent author to discover if you haven't already.
A superb story!  By no means a "mindless" pulp thriller I was expecting; the characters and their motivations are compellingand memorable.

A well-done fictionalization of the 1962 Hanratty case, in which the accused was convicted and hanged. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because for me, it dragged on a bit, and because the author chose to phonetically transcribe some characters' regional dialects.I would have preferred it if the dialect was indicated and it was left to the reader to imagine their speech, as I sometimes had difficulty understanding the dialogue. Other than that, it was gripping and suspenseful; I liked the way the story was able to be brought forward into the 2000's.
Great stories; I'm glad I came across this author. Quality writing and enjoyable story-lines.
A great story, apart from the fact that there was no resolution at all as to why he saw what he saw in the mirror. Still cool toread, though.

Another reviewer got it exactly right; it's like listening to a relative or friend reminiscing. The author has a wonderfullylight and humourous touch when describing events that must have been excruciatingly frustrating and/or disappointing.It's both amusing and enlightening.....

I wasnt expecting much from skimming the preview for these, but since they were free I took a chance. The firsttwo stories were pretty good; not great but solidly entertaining and well-written. I didnt care for the start of the thirdso didnt read it and cant comment on it.
More great stories from this talented author. Please write more of these!
Having read some free stories from the author's web-site, I couldnt wait to get this volume and the second one as well. The storiesare just as entertaining as I expected them to be.
Be they truth or fiction, I loved all the stories in this book.
Other reviewers have given more in-depth reviews so all I'll add is that it's a great story that kept me up late reading and wondering how it would end.
A great story that had me wondering about alot of things until the end. I'll be keeping my eye out for more of DS Lasser.
I've enjoyed many of Mr. Vasey's books; this is for me the best yet. "New" technology isnt justfor the living anymore....
A good read that I enjoyed, although I guessed how it would end, basically, about half-way through...
I thought this was better than just ok. Believable characters, good plot, lots of excitement, with regular helpings of gore. Good enough to make me want to read Needles 2.

I loved this book; the humourous writing style is great and it's inspired me to keep my eyes open in case I spot any fortunes lying around at garage sales and thrift stores. A section in the book, about 5% is repeated again starting at about the 40% mark, but that's about it's only very minor flaw.
A good story that I also would recommend. I'll think of it the next time I ride a roller-coaster, if I ever do.....
While this was fairly well-written, I thought the reason behind the bees' behaviour hard to believe, and the final paragraph annoying.

Take yourself back to the seemingly more innocent  times of  1950's London as you read about the day-to-day life and experiencesof former police officer Joan Lock. Told with great humour and insight ; it's a glimpse into an era now long gone.
Refreshingly different, with believable characters. Just the right length, with a neatly done finish. Learning about Operation Cornflakeswas a nice bonus....

I gave this free short story a try despite not being able to see a preview. It's enjoyable and well-written butmore of a segment of time for three homeward-bound NY commuters than anything else. Good for aquick read on your way somewhere....

I have owned a knockoff of the popular FURminator deshedding tool for years.  Although I thought that it was doing a pretty good job, my cat would not put up for it for very long.  I would not use this tool regularly enough to make much of a difference because my cat simply did not allow me to comb her with this tool for long.  I decided to try this product based on its high reviews and hoped that my cat would like it a little more.  Now whenever my cat jumps up to be pet, I simply will put this glove on and she seems to like being pet even more.  I stroke the mitt into her back and sides as if I were petting her normally and this tool picks up and incredible amount of fur with great efficiency.  My cat purrs while I groom her.  So far I have had this mitt for a week using it daily and it has picked up considerable amounts of hair every time I have used it; hair that is no longer in the air and on my clothes.  I stop using the glove at the first sign my cat gives me that she has had enough and will then usually give her some loving without the glove on.  I have learned that stroking the area near the tail too hard upsets my cat.  The first time I used it I was careful to present it as naturally as possible so as not to spook her with it.  All cats are different, but If your cat tolerates it, this tool removes more hair more efficiently, with the least amount of stress to the animal of any deshedding product I have tried.

I own a CVA Optima muzzleloader that came with a with a  Konus 3-9x40 scope.  This is my first gun.  I bought it for deer hunting.  The scope retails for around $100 by itself.  Its nothing fancy, but it gets the job done.  I wanted something to protect the scope.  I looked at lens caps and well, this just seemed like a better option for me.  It fits the scope snugly and securely.  I do worry a bit that if left on for too long, that the rubber will rot and snap, but its cheap enough that I would not feel too bad about it as long as I got a couple of seasons use of out it.  If i was leaving the gun in a safe for an extended period of time, I would leave it off.

The craftsmanship of this box is great.  It makes me wonder why bamboo is not a more popular building material.  The individual cut pieces fit together so nicely.  As the product description states; "it [bamboo] holds the promise of a sustainable, cost effective, and ecologically responsible alternative to the widespread clear cutting of our old growth forests."  For all intents and purposes this box feels and looks like wood if you had never seen bamboo before.  I bought this box to store Himalayan sea salt which i purchased along with this order.  The only thing I question is how this box will keep the moisture out.  It is less than airtight, but the top is on a pivot and "locks" with a magnet.  It does have a bit of an oil smell to it, but with a drop of dish soap and a good soak, it lessened the smell.  It is not a concern for me.  After a short time the box will just smell like salt anyway.

Mission Belt is simply the best "ratchet style" belt available.  They are truly incredible.  Mission Belt's customer service is outstanding.  In fact, their customer service is the best of any company I have been a customer of...ever.  Before ordering the belt, I emailed them with a question regarding sizing.  It seems as if I am in a bit of a middle ground of waist size.  I wear a consistent size 32" across the board.  Based on this, I was recommended a small-sized belt, but once I received my belt and tried it on, it was just an inch or two too small for me.  Again, I messaged them and once again received a nearly immediate response.  They immediately sent me a medium-sized belt before I even began the process of sending back the small-sized belt.  I was offered a full refund on shipping.  I received the new medium sized belt in a few days and it fit perfectly.  As an added bonus, they sent me a newer model black belt.  It was very similar, but with a few minor upgrades.  From what I could immediately tell, the ratcheting is much smoother.  Mission Belt and I exchanged a few more emails to ensure that I was pleased with my purchase.Prior to ordering this belt, I had ordered three of the Erik Blaire brand ratchet belts in different colors.  While this company also has great customer service from my experience and similar buckles, the belt strap is really what sets these belts apart.  Mission Belts are dyed leather, as opposed to the Erik Blaire belts which are painted on patterns.  This painting resulted in my belts "cracking" over just a couple of months.  The Mission Belts look like leather, feel like leather...and yes even smell like leather.  Some models are even labeled "yeah...its leather."  I cannot say the same for their competitor.  I do not want to trash the Erik Blaire Belts, because I initially did fall in love with them and their customer service was also very good from my experience, but they are simply not as nice as these.  I recommend these for yourself or as a gift.  I absolutely guarantee that NO ONE would be disappointed with one of these belts.  Oh and one final thing, they even donate a portion of every belt sale to charity to feed the hungry.  Great belt, great companyThese belts are awesome.  Just order one now.

These tripods are truly an amazing accessory for your digital camera.  I have bought the non-magnetic version for myself, not realizing that this one was available.  I use it all the time.  It is small enough that you can bring it anywhere with you.  I bought this one as a Christmas gift for a world traveler that takes lots of pictures.  Frankly, I couldn't say that there has really been a time where I actually could have used the magnetic tripod feet, but had I known it existed, I surely would have bought it for myself.Using a tripod obviously makes for better photographs, but its impractical to carry a full sized tripod around.  This solves that problem and then some.  Being able to wrap this tripod around just about anything or stick it to something metalic can make for some amazing shot angles.  I think that this is a great gift idea for a camera enthusiast.  I'd be willing to bet they had never seen such a device.

Out of the four ink cartridges that came with my HP8500A printer, as expected the black cartridge ran out of ink first, but the yellow was not far behind.  Instead of ordering all four cartridges all at once, I decided to order only yellow and black replacement cartridges.  At this point, the red and blue cartridges were still at about half full.  These cartridges are "XL" size and claim to carry twice the ink as the cartridges that came with the printer.  I have popped both the black and yellow cartridges in, they were immediately recognized as HP genuine products and I have had no issue with them.  They are cheaper on Amazon than at Best Buy.  I recommend buying these ink cartridges.

When debating what size of these to buy, I decided that the 10L size was simply too big for me.  Instead I bought the 6L size as well as a 2L Dromelite bag.  After buying these dromedary bags, I also purchased the MSR shower kit and MSR hydration kit.  I own a camelbak and bought the hydration kit for comparison.  I have not used it yet, but I have used the 6L dromedary bag with the MSR shower kit and it works great.  These bags are clearly heavy duty and have not leaked on me.  I know that MSR stands by their products, so if a leak were to spring up they would replace it for free.  Frankly, I now think that there is no other way to carry large amounts of water.  I will say that they do have the "garden hose taste" that another reviewer speaks of, but it the taste does fade away after multiple uses.  If you've ever lugged gallon water jugs out with you, buy one of these bags immediately.  They make for the perfect base for all of your mobile water needs.

1:42 MinsMy only real concern when purchasing this product was how strong the water flow could possibly be and how quickly the water will drain.  I own many MSR products and was not worried about quality issues.  All I can really say is that the water flows out with surprising force, exceeding my expectations.  I have my kit paired with a 6L dromedary bag and am pretty sure that 2 people would be able to take a quick shower on one fill, although I have not used this in the field yet.  The 10L bag would surely be better for two people to take a shower, but I find it to just be too big for the average single person.  I also own a 2L lightweight dromedary bag and the MSR hydration kit.  Makes for a great backpacking system.For all those curious as to how effective this shower kit can be I have posted a video alongside my review.

I always have two anchors on my 23' boat; the main anchor up front attached to the boats on-board anchor winch and a low cost anchor for deploying in rocky bottoms where retrieval could be an issue.  I lost my cheap anchor a few weeks ago and was going to go to the marina for a replacement, but it was near the end of the day and I did not want to pay marina prices for a cheap anchor.  As I do more and more often these days, I looked right to Amazon.  I thought to myself; is an anchor really something you can just order online...what about the shipping?  Well, Amazon has you covered.  This is a prime eligible item.  Frankly, I don't even know why I questioned Amazon, they will ship just about anything in a timely manner.  When it comes down to it, an anchor isn't even that heavy.  I received this anchor in two days in a slim box packed with packing paper.  This anchor is cheaper feeling than the anchor I just lost and the welds look a bit sloppy, but it will get the job done.  It is what I wanted; a cheap anchor that I don't care if I lose.  I have not used this anchor yet, but unless this anchor just fails me completely, four stars.

I recently bought a 16x20 unframed 3D picture for $10 at...7-11 of all places.  I simply could not resist.  I looked to Amazon to find a nice affordable frame.  There are other choices, but none reviewed as consistently well as Craig Frames.  My main concern when buying this frame was the shipping aspect.  I knew it would take a little while to arrive and was hoping that it would not arrive broken.  The frame arrived at my house within a week, but surely took a bit longer as I ordered the day before Thanksgiving.  The frame arrived packed very securely and the face is some kind of clear poly-carbonate, not glass, so having a broken frame arrive on your doorstep does not seem to be much of an issue here.  I am not going to say that the frame quite exceeded my expectations, but for the price I am extremely happy with it.  It looks simple, yet very nice up on the wall.  I ordered the standard black frame.This frame comes with all the necessary mounting hardware...you put it together yourself.  If you have never done this before, it may initially seem like a bit of a difficult task.  This could be helped if they would included mounting instructions in the box.  The instructions, however can easily be found at the Craigs Frame's website at [...]The screws are self driving, but a phillip's head drill bit will make doing this a snap.  Frankly, I wouldn't want to really attempt this without a drill myself, but I'd think that it is possible.  ONE LAST THING...REMOVE THE FRONT(...and rear) GLASS PROTECTING FILM BEFORE MOUNTING YOUR PRINT.

I am sorry, but this product might be a 5 star idea, but it is not so great in reality. It is a spork with teeth that are too small to make for a decent fork and a depression that only makes for a half decent spoon.  The bottle opener just works OK. The Carabiner clip is made of plastic.  I replaced the plastic clips with metal Nite Ize S biners; a simple enough fix costing a few dollars.  These are just not the home run the 5 star reviews would suggest.  Nonetheless, other than the plastic clip, the quality is solid enough, albeit stamped metal.  I bought two of these.  Right now I have one clipped on my bag and one buried inside, but for all but the most space and weight conscious these are just far from ideal to eat with.

This battery serves perfectly as a backup for my S100.  The factory Canon battery that came with the camera is rated at 1120mAh, quite a bit less than this battery.  I could not say for certain that this has resulted in being able to get more shots per charge, but it would make sense and seems to be the case.  Knowing a little bit about batteries and the battery market, I have no worries about this battery damaging my device.  Quality wise, I just don't think much separates this battery from Canons.  Still, I consider this battery my backup and replace the stock cannon battery when recharged.

Anyone that is concerned with bag storage space, whether it be a backpacker, bike rider, etc., should consider buying one or two of these canteens.  These are great for outdoor situations where space is limited and extra water may be needed.  They also can be loaded with mixed adult beverages, thrown in a cooler, and brought to the beach. ...OR they could be used as a leak-proof urinal.  I feel best carrying these near a more traditional water bottle just in case there is leaking, but I have not had any leaks yet.

Simply attach this seat cover to a 5 gallon(or smaller) plastic bucket and you have a perfectly fine toilet to sit on.  I recommend lining the bucket with a trash bag and adding some kind of absorbent i.e cat litter, wood shavings, especially if its expected to be used multiple times.  This is really great for boat owners who have an on-board head, but do not want to put up with the hassle of cleaning it.  I have to go on a boat so rarely, I do not feel too bad about washing my solid waste into the ocean so I just leave the bag out.  Also girls do not have the advantage of being able to pee off the side of the boat like men do, so having one of these for them is much appreciated.

This kit is just about perfect.  It is not necessarily too big for the lightweight backpacker or too small for the back country gourmet.  The kit is packed only about half full and there is enough room to add a good amount, but all of the cooking essentials are already there.  The extra space could be filled with things like waterproof matches, LED light etc., to make a bit of a cooking survival kit.  Individually, the knife is not anything that special, but is better than I expected and comes very sharp.  The picture gives a very good indication of what you are getting, but you can't see the clip-strap.  I was a bit hesitant to buy this kit at $55 so I waited until it went on sale a bit, but honestly I don't think its possible to put together a better camp cooking set for  around $50.  This is a well thought out product worth every penny.I could not find this information on the product page so I determined it myself.MEASURES 9.5" x 7" x 3.5"WEIGHT: 1.2 pounds

I must admit that I've never been much of a flip flop person. I have had my previous pair of flip flops for 3-4 years and had not worn another pair until receiving theses.  While my previous pair was of similar quality, I did not ever imagine just how much a flip flop's design could affect how they stick to your feet while walking.  The heal is cushioned and raised to make for less "flipping and flopping" while walking.  They are lightweight and simply stick to my feet better than any other pair I've owned.  I ordered two other brands offerings as well and found them to be my favorite out of the box.  Some may prefer a simpler pair of Reefs over these, but I think these are great.  There is a bottle opener.  At around $55 a pair, these are some of the more expensive flip flops available, but I think the price is well worth it.PROS-Lightweight-great design-cushion-quality-bottle openerCONS-price?

Don't let the little blue "stone" on top fool you into thinking that this is some kind of beautiful tamper.  Its alright looking, but i could do without it.  The tamper is made of Stainless steel and surprised me with its weight.  It is a nice heavy piece, that tamps well, albeit a tad too small.  I think that this is probably one of the best tampers at this price.  I bought the Espresso Tamper 50 & 60 Mm Sizes Cast Alloy Hand Coffee for about $7 and its finish was stripped by the dishwasher, rendering it useless and potentially dangerous to use.  Spend a little more money on this tamper and you should not be disappointed.

I purchased the McNett Gear Aid Tent Repair Kit at a local store at around the same time I purchased this kit.  If I were to have only one of these kits on a short camping trip, I would prefer to have the Gear Aid kit because it has the added benefit of being able to repair a tents poles and zippers, while still being able to sew/fix the same types of things.  From a minimalist backpacking perspective, I'd rather have this kit because it is more survival oriented.  Here are the main things that sets these two kits apartBoth kits have duct tape, a patch to sew, and all the basic items to be able to sew.The Gear Aid kit contains, but is not limited to an odor eliminating packet, seam cutter, elastic cord, seam glue, tent zipper and pole repair.The Survival Sewing and repair kit contains, but is not limited to a razor blade, utility cord, plastic ties, kevlar thread, brass wire and 4 nails.While there is some redundancy, these kits make perfect compliments to each other.  The waterproof  5 x 4 Aloksak Bag of this kit nests perfectly inside the Gear Aid kit.  Together they make great additions to a more complete survival kit.

The kit has everything you need to keep your MSR Miniworks/Waterworks purifier in good working order as well as all the replacement parts you might need.  The container is smaller than i expected and is not much bigger than a matchbox.  This should come with the purifier as it is really a necessity to maintain your filter in the field.

I like to use the Banana Boat spray on sunscreen for convenience, but like to apply rub in sunscreen to my face and more exposed areas.  In the past I have had problems with sunscreen running into my eyes to the point that it often kept me from using it anywhere near my eyes.  I applied this liberally over my face on a very hot day at the beach and had no problems with sunscreen causing my eyes to tear.  I trust the Banana Boat name to protect me from the sun and expect waterproof claims to be accurate, so my main concern is how the sunscreen absorbs and if it runs into my eyes.  This product absorbs well, does not leave greasy residue, and does not run into your eyes.  Also the container itself is great.  Its hard plastic and seemingly very leak-proof.  Best sunscreen I have used...

This product seems like a great idea, you're getting the equivalent of a dozen+ tubes of caulk gun type adhesive in a trigger pull canister. Easier on your fingers, less space, and faster to apply. Unfortunately, none of this works in reality.The trigger mechanism is very finicky, you easily go from no flow to spraying like a firehose, it cannot be controlled for proper application.The nozzle design is very poor and easily blows off the can, shooting excess foam everywhere, which is very difficult to clean up. It will be on your fingers for days and days.This really isn't anything more than the typical "great stuff" expanding foam, that is about how it applies, just in a smaller bead. It still puffs up, then settles down, but equally as sticky and messy when it gets where you do not want it.I've noticed the product before and decided to try it while the cans were on clearance for $5 at home depot.They are dumping cases and cases of them at this price, presumably because none of the real contractors and construction guys bought into the gimmick. Stick to regular tube based adhesives, it is much cleaner to apply even if they take up more space and have to be put on with a caulking gun.
Loved it, waiting for more

Limited applications - designated OTA channels only.I had purchased this in hopes of getting an alternate video feed on my dish system.This is a digital only tuner, it has no analog capabilities. It also will only pick up stations that are within the dish guide, meaning stations that dish expects to be there and allows.My hope had been to use an rf modulator to output feeds from my security system recorders to then be able to view the cameras on each tv in the house, rather than having to rely on additional wiring or other more complicated options. I understand that all broadcasts these days are digital only, but it would have been very simple for them to build an analog ntsc tuner function into this at well, giving a lot of extra flexibility for applications such as mine or distributing dvd, etc through the home.Rather than simply  the install that way, I'm now instead using a hdmi matrix solution, and have instead been able to scale back my dish system. Now I'm paying dish far less money each month for fewer receivers and sharing the remaining ones between my tvs. If they could have built a better quality and more robust tuner device, I'd have happily paid for those extra boxes in each room. Their shortsightedness - their loss.

Perfect fit for the powerflow systems. I use this with the face mounted model ( http://amzn.to/1fps8Zn ).It is clearly overkill for my application, but I have severe allergies and use it to allow me to do hobbies such as woodworking and even just chores like mowing the lawn. Filters out pretty much all dust and debris, doesn't do much for smells as there is no carbon layer for nuisance odors, but it works great for particulates.

Disclosure: I received echo as part of the original trial group as a prime member for a discounted (half) price.The echo is sleek and has surprisingly great sound for the small size.Pairing it with your phone and network was very simple.Tip: If you have a "hidden" wifi network (ssid is not broadcast) like mine is, for security purposes, you will need to temporarily make your network visible to connect your echo, at which point you can hide it again and it will remain connected.I'm happy to say I have had no wifi problems or other common network glitches and have never had to reboot the echos, it just works.I put it in the master bath as it is one of the few rooms that doesn't have a whole house music system, and was very pleased when they came out with native pandora support rather than having to stream pandora via airplay.The voice recognition is a bit spotty at times, depending on your volume and distance from the echo. Placing it in/near a corner helps with both the audio quality out of the echo as well as helps Alexa to recognize you better. While there are fun little things you can do with it, just like with Siri (what's the weather, whats the traffic, playing simon says, etc), the best is yet to come. There is so much potential with having a good quality network device that can reasonably pick up your voice commands anywhere in the room. As of now there is some basic developer integration starting to work with home automation controls such as the philips hue lights - that is worthless for a truly automated home system, but once they can get it properly integrated with ISY, Crestron, and AMX, the sky is the limit.There is also potential to start networking multiple echos together, which will be a big competitor for the Sonos systems. If the cost comes down a bit, even to $100, I'd be placing many of these throughout the home just for voice control of lighting, a/v equipment, climate control and security, etc.  Ideally it would be great to see some additional echo mini devices developed that had just a microphone and a small speaker that could piggyback off a central echo processor to let you expand control around the home where you may not need a full speaker.Amazon: Please work with ISY ( http://amzn.to/1LbljqB )to develop native support for the ISY-994 platform. You also have great potential to take a cue from the Denon Heos speaker systems and make an echo with at least analog or preferably digital (optical) outputs that can feed into a whole home system or audio/video receiver.  Add an IR blaster component and you could be telling Alexa to turn on your amp and play pandora through your stereo system.

The construction and materials quality are good, however, the description is misleading. All of these channel plus rf modulators were designed/built back in 2009 (as evidenced by the date in the instructions). The unit will output a large range of uhf and catv (14+) however the output is entirely analog. It is not a modulated digital signal. For my application, this is not acceptable, I needed a true digital output to be compatible with my equipment, so this had to be returned.

No benefit, at least for me.The taste is fine, but a bit chalky, and they are very large. There is a lot of fillers in this, and it coats my tongue with a thick pasty white film that is difficult to get off. The point of buying it was to help reduce tonge film and tonsil stones. This product actually made it worse, not better, despite following the directions and using it for a full 2 weeks, 2-3 times daily, to give it a fair chance.I've since switched to a similar product from Life Extension, which is a better known brand of high quality supplements. The Life Extension product ( http://amzn.to/1KPc93V ) is far superior. It is half the size, not chalky tasting, leaves your mouth feeling much fresher, dissolves more readily, and does not leave a film/coating in your mouth. It is also cheaper, at $10 less per bottle, but also has 25% more tablets per bottle.

Does a great job at keeping mig tip and even the inside cup and electrode on my plasma cutter free of spatter.No strange smells and it isn't greasy or too sticky if you get it on your hands or clothes.
Cheap only goes so far. The description is either inaccurate or the one I received was faulty. The unit I had only worked for channels 64-125.It would not output any of the lower uhf channels at all.

As a suburban wannabe farmer/rancher, tending my lawn and garden and doing general chores around the house and diy projects, I wanted something more sturdy than tennis shoes or flip flops. These are only the 2nd pair of boots I've owned, the first was a cheap generic pair from walmart that were heavy, uncomfortable, sweaty, and fell apart quickly.These are holding up amazingly well and show almost no wear at all even after quite a bit of use. They were comfortable from the moment I put them on, they had no "break in" period, and are extremely breathable. I wore them all day over several weekends and my feet were completely clean and dry after being outside all day in dirt, sawdust, mud, and water.

I was impressed to see that this was made in the US. It seems heavy duty and well constructed. Though it is poly, there are no burrs, no rough spots, etc. It is smooth, polished, clean threads that fit and join nicely with other fittings, etc.  Well made and looks like it will hold up for a long time.
Seems thin, light weight, flimsy.  Made in china.

I won't bother going into the features as they are widely published and reviewed.I'll state my perspective as a custom home theater installer instead: while the included remote works well, and the voice feature is cool, the fire tv is a huge pain for anyone with more than a basic living room tv setup.  Any home theater setup or even just a well designed home that has a centralized media closet will have trouble with a fire tv, because they overlooked the most basic of functions and failed to include an infrared remote control option.  If there were published developer details for IP control, or an IR command input port, serial port, etc, this system could be easily integrated into a home automation system. Without that function or the ability to use discrete remote commands, options are limited. There is a USB ir receiver dongle on the market, but the programming is overly complex to make it work, and it simply should not be necessary.  Anyone buying one of these who wants to have it incorporated into an automation system should expect to spend several times the cost of the actual firetv on install costs from your local home theater installer, because of the additional equipment and programming that will be necessary. Even if you just want to keep your install simple and use a basic logitech harmony or other programmable remote, you're still stuck either cobbling together a workaround option with added equipment and manual programming, or having to use 2 remotes.
Good strong ginger flavor, almost too strong, as it overpowers the lemon flavor. It is better hot with honey than iced.

I bought this looking for an alternative to the chef boyardee type pasta I remember eating as a kid. These raviolis are quite a bit larger, and much thicker. This does make it take longer to cook through if on the stovetop, probably not an issue for microwave heating.  The sauce is a bit thin and bland, it doesn't have a cheesy flavor to the sauce, just a thin tomato taste.

The flavor is as expected, it is after all the standard ketchup we've all eaten our entire lives.  What I do not like is the high fructose corn syrup used.  There is a "simply heinz" version available (3 pack at costco) that is made with white sugar instead. Sure it's still just a condiment, and sugar is sugar in either form, but there are several reasons to avoid hfcs, so given the opportunity to purchase a product without it, I'll choose cane sugar.

Tart and tangy. Has a good flavor, and the pomegranate is a nice change from plain cranberry juice.I rarely buy juices like this because they have far too much sugar, this one is naturally sweetened (primarily with apple juice), but sugar is sugar. I usually mix it half and half with water then add a touch of stevia to make make it taste sweeter without all the added sugar.  I'd prefer to get 100% organic cranberry juice that doesn't have all the added apple juice either, but it is hard to find and tends to be expensive. This is a good balance of taste and price, with natural ingredients (not full of added sugar or corn syrup)

I "upgraded" to this after getting tired of my vonage bill creeping up month after month. The intent was for a cheap home phone service for times when I didn't want to use cell minutes, preferred to be able to use speaker phone, and for emergencies (911). I didn't need to pay nearly $40 a month for such limited use, so I picked up the obi and configured it, with several glitches along the way, to use ring.to.  Ring.to is completely free, unlimited calls, long distance, etc.  You will need to pay about $12 a year for 911 support, which is required, and well worth the minimal cost for peace of mind (you cannot use ring.to without a 911 account through a different provider).  Call quality is not as clear as what I had with vonage, it is a bit crackly/static at times, but passable, no worse than many cell connections.Configuration is not for everyone though, it took a lot of trial and error, both with account (ringto and obi) settings, as well as hardware adjustment of both the device and home router.  TIP: If you are having issues with not getting incoming calls, or if calls drop after 30 seconds to 2 minutes, go into you router setup and disable the SIP ALG (also known as RTSP ALG on some some routers), or you can assign a DMZ port to the obi if needed.

These little knives are very handy to have around the kitchen for various tasks. While not as versatile as a proper chefs knife, they are kept in a canister on the counter for everyday tasks like opening food packaging, cutting up small fruit and vegetables, slicing a sandwich, etc.  They stay reasonably sharp, are easy to maintain an edge with a pass across a diamond steel occasionally, and most importantly are dishwasher safe. The coating on the blade keeps things from sticking too much, and glides nicely through foods.

As with any insteon product, expect a few hiccups now and then, such as a switch randomly failing, not linking properly, needing to be reprogrammed, not responding, timing out, etc. The dual band switches tend to be the most reliable in terms of communication consistency, though I've still had some fail at random.The only complaint I have about the on/off switches (as opposed to the dimmable ones) is the indicator - the "light pipe" used is the same as all other switches. I understand this from a point of manufacturing standardization, but it wouldn't have been difficult to make one that had only a single led which is either on or off. They do this on the plug in products, and they did it with the now discontinued line of "icon" switches. While it really isn't a major concern, for people (family members) who learn how to use these switches, but aren't the ones who actually programmed them or know exactly what everything is, they tend to press and hold paddles to dim or ramp up devices. When they see that full bar, they assume it is dimmabe. and can end up holding a switch too long waiting for some action to take place, and can instead inadvertently alter programming.

Even though it's weird and different from the other seasons, I still love it.  Of course, Northern Exposure without Rob Morrow is like Gone With the Wind without Clark Gable and they made a major error in replacing him with a happily married couple.  And, I'm sorry, but the episode where Maggie and Joel are supposed to be way off on an Aleutian Island and he just walks off toward N.Y. City in the distance just doesn't make any sense.  If it's a dream, then say so, other wise it's just nuts. And what was all that tripe  where everybody was Russian many years before.  Just boring, I fast forwarded it.  Writers need to know when they are getting too weird for their audience.  I wish this show could have gone on and on with Rob Morrow and maybe, in hind site, he does too.

I don't understand how anybody could write such an unlikable heroine and still sell books.  Well, I bought the whole series before discovering how much I despise Faith.  She absolutely personifies everything I despise.  Hung up on THINGS, has to have big name brand clothes, only the best of foods, etc.  She gives what we call in the south "stuck up" a whole new meaning.  The husband is hardly ever mentioned which is a good thing I guess since he is a minister.  Not a very bright one apparently since he married Faith based on sex appeal for sure because she certainly has no good qualities and is less suited to be a minister's wife than I am.  Some of these books that don't feature Faith as much are pretty good mysteries.  One thing about Faith which is refreshing.  When she gets all her precious possessions stolen, you're glad, when her life is threatened, you hope they do kill her off.

Well, I thought it couldn't get any better after season 4 but season 5 is even better.  I had not seen this series previously but love Rob Morrow so ordered the whole series.  What a joy to watch such an outstanding series.  It just continues to get better and better.  I'm already sick that there are only 6 seasons.  What a tragedy.
I can't really smell it much but am hoping that when I spray it I'll get some benefits.

This series really hits it's stride in Season 4. Gets better and better.  Not afraid to be touching and emotional.  This series manages to blend just plain weird with sort of dumb, sort of tiresome, sort of irritating and just plain sweet and somehow come out with something you can't stop watching.  I just love everybody on this series. I had never seen it and bought all the seasons so I could watch from start to finish.  I'm already lamenting that there were only 6 seasons.  But, lucky me, I can start all over and watch them all again when I finish watching the first time.
I guess it's a matter of taste but I don't really care for these.  I use two other flavors of Ricola sugar free and like them very much.

This is perfect for my needs.  Just the right size, does not extend into the tub very much, easy to put on and tighten.  I needed a bar that did not cross the tub but rather ran above the tub in the same direction.  I am 79 years old and have been finding it difficult to turn over and get onto my knees in the tub so I can get out.  I was going to have to give up my bubble baths and settle for sitting on a stool and showering.  I can grasp this bar with my right hand, put all my weight on it and use my left hand just to steady my left side.  I was up in a nano second.  They shipped it really fast too and were very courteous when I contacted them.
I never use any other type of flea control on my cats.  Never have any problems with reactions to it.  It's a great product.  Not the cheapest but it's the best.

I've tried 3 types of spray lotion and Vaseline is the only one with a spray that will actually spray no matter where you are holding it.  There is one area on my back that I can't reach to put on lotion.  I can hold this can up and spray down on my back one time and by the time I finish putting on my regular lotion my back is dry.  I'm really glad to have this as it has been months since I've been able to put lotion on that area of my back.  And, I like to spritz my feet before I put socks on and this works great for someone who has problems raising the foot up where I can reach it.  After all, I'm 79 years old.  Very good price on two of these.

This series really gets going on the 3rd season.  The first two seasons were much shorter and sometimes couldn't seem to figure out where it was going and there were way too many dream sequences.  But, with this 3rd season, it's all there.  It's funny, it's quirky, it's full of heart, you begin to love these people.  I guess you can tell I bought all the episodes and am looking at them first to last.  I'm enjoying it so much that I hate the thought that there are only 6 seasons.

Again, this author seems to drag in way too many people, all of whom seem to be related in some way and usually also related to Vida.  Her character got OLD and TIRESOME  a long time ago as she got to be more and more of a total jackass.  She has so much ATTITUDE that I don't know why anybody puts up with her much less lets her boss them around when she is the employee.  She is out of touch with reality where the worthless Roger is concerned but somehow manages to blame everybody else for his behavior.  I sort of keep hoping that Roger will take an ax to grandma thus showing her what he is really like.  As Emma and Milo have grown closer to the point of being engaged their behavior to each other seems to show less respect.  Milo borders on verbal abuse many times in front of other people.  Is this the small town not very intelligent man's way of showing off in front of his friends.  I hate it.  I hate the fact that they seem to bicker all the time.  They may think it's foreplay but it just sounds rude and mean most of the time.  As with most of her mysteries by the time it is finally resolved you have pretty much forgotten what happened and who the suspects were as she has dragged in so much useless information about uninteresting people.

This movie has it's faults for sure.  Penelope Miller doesn't quite ring true, not quite good enough an actress.  But, she is very attractive and the other cast members make up for her slightly not good enough performance.  I enjoyed it.

I am on my 3rd fan like this in about 20 years.  The first two I, unfortunately, knocked off the table and damaged them as finally they just stopped working well.  I have been more careful with the one I have but I want to always have one extra on hand in case the one I have stops working in the middle of the summer.  I have been purchasing mine from a box store but now I find that the Amazon price is better.  I don't think you can go wrong with this fan.  I use mine in a small bedroom and it is about 8 feet from me.  If you want to cool a larger room you might want to go with a larger fan.  This is an excellent fan.  The best I've ever had.

This is a pretty good movie of it's type.  I've seen better and I've certainly seen worse.  It got sort of bogged down in whether or not the husband was a criminal or an FBI informant turned rogue.  Some of it was never explained.  Like how did the FBI "know where he was all along"?  But, the heroine, though not a terrific actress, is adequate.  It was never explained how she continued to live in the huge gorgeous home when she was "broke".  I didn't understand why, when she finally found her son, she didn't just grab him and run back to her car but that wouldn't have fit with the last scenes, the big reveal so to speak.  The film continued to hold my interest and I enjoyed it.  I wished the detective hero would cut his hair instead of messing with it all the time but that is just a personal dislike.  I recommend it as an interesting, while away a couple of hours movie.

I didn't like the fact that the author dragged in a character who was really only known to people who have read several books before this one.  It just reeked of "who the heck can I drag in now to be the guilty party" and arrange all the facts so that they sort of fit for him as the murderer.  Made very little sense.  It was a surprise ending only in that the reader can't believe what she is reading.  I find Emma's brother's preaching about her relationship with Milo to be ridiculous.  He never said anything about the long drawn out affair with the overrated Tom who was married and stayed that way.  For one thing, it's none of her brother's business who Emma marries.  The very idea of expecting Milo to get an annulment which would make his children bastards is ludicrous.  Can another "wrong" make a right?  And, in what universe would his ex wife agree to it.  So, she is setting up another "no win" situation for Emma with a man who is still tied too tightly to his ex wife and his children.  I find Milo's continuing reference to his ex wife as Mulehide to be nothing less than revolting.  She apparently had enough to put up with in him when they were married, she is the mother of his children and deserves more respect especially now when she and the daughter are right there hanging around his neck again.  Of course, I've always found Milo to be one of the dullest characters I've ever read about.  But, Emma is worse so maybe they deserve each other, to go on bickering and griping at each other all the time with the explanation that "they had a bad day" but still groping each other and falling into bed at every opportunity which is apparently the only place they can agree on anything.  I'm continuing to read this series only in the hope that the horrible Roger will finally get what he deserves or that Vida will finally get a clue about him and actually admit what a little creep he has always been.

This is one of the better books in this series in that it explores more the very complex Vida character.  A real surprise about her near the end which lifts this book out of the ordinary so so books in this series.

I've worked in web marketing and innovations marketplace for over 10 years and read several books annually on web economy or digital marketing.  Vaporized is by far the best digital-technology business economics book I’ve read.The author superbly integrates economics’ concepts such as monopolies, barrier to entry, and peer-to-peer.  Adds pricing and business history and current digital business tactics, e.g. winner takes all,—to write a book that is only slight more challenging to read than casual business books.And author explains many practical principles for those interested in the current digital revolution.  For example, how the digital economy are affected by Moore’s and Metcalf’s laws.  How a switchboard and a market relates to a successful digital businesses.  How app platforms support and lock-in apps.  Big Data metrics.  Impact of robotics.  Bitcoin implications in financial transactions and Person-to-Person transactions.  Peer-to-Peer economy example of Uber.  And many more. In each, the author teaches the underlying economics-business model and the dominant firm’s advantages, so that reader can acquire lasting business tools.This is the best digital business-economics book I’ve ever read because it teaches many principles—that are useful and lasting in many digital endeavors.

Just what I needed.  Heavy-duty, disposable gloves for my bicycle greasy chain and mucky tires, car maintenance, and many of the dirty or skin-irritant uses, e.g. bathroom chemicals.  Much thicker than the nitrile and vinyl disposable gloves I had used.Though designed for single-use, Gloveworks are easier to peel off than my thin vinyl and nitrile ones, which often tear when peeling off.  If I wish to reuse; Gloveworks can be carefully removed and then reused (being mindful of the dirt, of course).Non-disposable thicker gloves fit a bit loose, and fingers can't dig in or press hard enough into the cleaning surface.  And, user's feel of the surface and grasp of small items are greatly diminished  Thin gloves sometimes tear, but moreso, because I fear the tearing, I apply less cleaning pressure.Gloveworks feels stronger than the thin gloves, and its grip while wet was terrific while I cleaned the bathroom basin and toilet.  Because I feared tear less, I pressed harder.  This changes my cleaning--more power, feel more protected and unfortunately, a bit more carelessness to chemicals--though it protects better, it still might break.Fits me like a glove, should.11-15-15  Perfect for bicycle tire repairs.  Previously, my Presta valve, high pressure tire changes always required several hand washes with Gojo.  Using these gloves-- pressing down on pointed Presta valve did not puncture, pulling and pressing on really tight tires onto hub did not tear.  Worked great!

I use disposable gloves when applying glues, cleaning bicycles, wiping floors, cleaning really dirty areas, and for minor car maintenance and inspection.  Past Walgreens vinyl gloves frequently tore during bicycle and auto maintenance.  Learned while trying these nitriles that Ammex has a wide variety of disposable gloves, including an industrial version of Ammex latex gloves for about the same price, and likely better for my uses.As compared to my vinyl gloves, these Ammex nitriles are more comfortable and feels stronger yet more elastic as well.  Nitriles did not tear  for wiping an entire small bathroom using paper towels and scrubbing pad.  And gloves’ texturing provided better grip, including in wet conditions.These gloves are better than Walgreens vinyl gloves, but am planning to try Ammex’s industrial latex gloves, for still better performance.  I only occasionally use disposable gloves for medical examinations, but if user needs just a single type of disposable gloves for most household and medical purposes or wish to avoid latex, these will do.

Remember Plato’s allegory of the cave?  Puppet-shadow shows on dimly lit walls to mislead the cave dwellers?  A truth-seeker climbs out of the cave, sees truthful sunlight, and returns to decry the myths of the puppet shadows.  This allegory applies to business myths too!This book is about shining light on the puppet shows of modern, romantic entrepreneurial myths.  You know how it goes— have an epiphony (sp) moment, web enable idea, everyone else will see its value and adopt it, and then, like Instagram or Whatsapp, be acquired, and become an instant billionaire.  Work four years, change the world, and retire to the tropics.  'And who are the modern puppet-shadow-masters?  Writers of entrepreneurial books.  And the cave dwellers?  Mostly a millennial herd instinct.  For example, books on entrepreneurial leadership praise virtues such as patience, good people skills, communications skills, etc.  Author myth-busts this.  He points out the younger Bill Gates was impatient and difficult to work for, and had Gates taken the time to transform his character to acquire conventional business leadership skills, Gates wouldn’t have time to have built Microsoft.  Pop go the mythical doctrines in thousands of books on how to become a successful entrepreneur.Though author acknowledges there are rare talented young entrepreneurs, as Zuckerberg, Gates, who are youthful Alexander the Greats, book advises that most entrepreneurs will instead experience a roller coaster ride, usually with a downward spiral.The author’s recommendation—climb the arduous path out of the dark cave, this path being one of traditional methods of business development.  The light at the end of the cave tunnel is business acumen and success.The book’s title really should have been about myth busting.  The other entrepreneurial how-to books tell readers the steps it takes to become a leader.  This book tells the flaws of these steps.  It's a great book, so as to analyze the other books properly.In another word, this book encourages one to climb out of the cave, but doesn’t really tell how to climb out very well.  Its message for climbing--trust your gut instincts-- is about the same message as to tell a rock climber to trust your feet.  But it does a terrific job on busting the flaws of the other-books'-business-shadow-puppet-theaters myths.

This book is written mostly for those entirely new to Windows environment.  My question is, is this book also useful for experienced users of Windows 7 or 8?I love Visual series of graphical explanation books.  I tend to skim Visual books to find out what topics are within, and then use it as a quick reference, whenever I want to accomplish something I’m unfamiliar with.  Windows 10 introduced a lot of new usability features, and skimming this picture books is still a lot faster than reading books or even watching online videos.  Overall—worth the $25 retail price for providing introductory explanations.However, Windows 10 is designed to constantly change to updated features, and I would imagine in six months, many features will have changed.  For example, Microsoft’s staff advised me that Gmail’s contacts are not synching properly with Microsoft People.  Such synchronization update  isn’t noted in the chapter on Windows 10 People.  This book needs a reference URL with the updates notes.  Minus 2 stars.A well-written book that is likely to outdate quickly.

Having a moderately deviated septum, I had tried 8 nasal dilators.  Moderately deviated is sufficient to unnaturally shut nostril Frequently, even when uncongested.  Moderately is not severely deviated, but more than common minor deviated septum.  Physicians have a scale for measuring degree of deviation.  Most dilators, including ones for snoring, can be used during daytime, though wearer would be unsightly.  The sports ones, as Rhinomed, have a tight nasal septum clamp, ensuring the dilator stays even during sports.My objective is to occasionally open more my left nostril, enabling nasal fluids to drain, and thus prevent congestion and sinusitis.  It is inappropriate to use dilators continually.  The basic idea is to use dilators occasionally, to prevent congestion and enable nose’s cilia hair to remain healthy enough to do their job of removing mucus. Nasal strips worked the best for nighttime.For daytime, Rhinomed and a soft nasal cone worked best.  The nasal cone fitted loosely and would fall out at times, be particularly unattractive, and was unsuitable for sports, but the nasal cone was far more comfortable than Rhinomed, and only one cone was needed.  Rhinomed uses a septum clip (clamp) to fasten it to nose, but this clip’s pressure hurt.  Over time, my mind could ignore this hurt, but then slight headaches began.  Pressure hurts so much--it's not going to fall out of the nose during athletics.My opinion is that one’s natural body is designed to excel, nostrils open up naturally during sports, and nasal dilators are more likely a detriment.  Instead, learn how to breathe better. However, if have moderate or extreme deviated septum or extreme allergies, Rhinomed can help in sports.  Don’t buy the marketing hype that dilators are suitable for all deviated septums.  Only a small percentage of deviated septums are severe enough to cause breathing difficulties.  Most people have minor deviated septums.  Also, try Grossan's Nasal irrigator before trying this.  One reason nostril may not be sufficiently opening or is congested is because nasal cilia isn't efficient.  By using nasal irrigation to restore a healthy cilia and thereby nose, nostrils will open up naturally better, without having to resort to dilators.Overall a 3 star, because this is one of my favorite daytime dilator, but hurts.10/14/15  If user has a collapsed nasal valves, this might work better still.  There are self-diagnostics tests online that can determine whether one has collapsed nasal valves.

I’m Using a Dean electric guitar, a Fender amp with built-in tuner, and a $12 D’Arddio clip-on tuner.  How does this $50 Polytune tuner cost-justify?Polytune has two modes—single-note and polyphonic.  All three tuners being compared—Polytune, D’Arddio, and Fender tuner-- display single string flat or sharp tones by showing an indicator left or right of the string’s standard frequency mark (my D’Arddio is broken presently, so I’m going by memory.).  Unlike D’Arddio and Fender tuners, Polytune apparently measures too many harmonics initially.  That is, Polytune’s tone-indicator bounces around initially, before settling down, whereas D’Arddio and Fender’s tone-indicators are stable throughout.  As a result, for a single string tuning, D’Arddio and Fender are slightly faster.In the polyphonic mode, Polytune uses one red LED above for sharp and one red LED below for flat to measure each of simultaneously struck 6 strings.  These red LEDs’ light intensity measures how severely the string is off-tune.  By gauging LEDs’ intensity for 6 strings, player can quickly determine which string is severely off-tune, and tune it.Polyphonic can be productive particularly in live, solo performances.  First, no need to first power the amp, as Polytune uses proprietary sensing method.  Second, when playing solo, one can strum all strings without amplification and see that only one string is far greater off-tune than other, then tune that string.  Saves some time.One of my Polytune’s G string’s sensors is sporadic in polyphonic mode.Overall, does save time—so a five star, if not too pricey for the buyer.  Drops to 3 star due to G string sensor defect.9/19-- I've contacted TCelectronic tech support.  Confusing website that caused me to lose 20 frustrating minutes.9/20-- other than the G string problem, this Polytune mode is far faster.  This would be a 5 star except for the defect.9/22--TC Electronic support responded after weekend and gave an intelligent answer, which I'll try out.  +1 star.

For my washing of dishes, sponges are faster.  Even these cloths' larger size simply proves to be clumsier in usage, for me.  But if one prefers using dishcloth, these are ribbed for better cleaning and appear to be more durable than most other dishcloth.  I issue 4 stars for products that meet their specifications and does nothing special.  In this case, subtract 1 star because sponges are superior.Yet, when used as a bath cloth, these removed dead skin and oils faster than my prior bath hand towels.  +1 star here.  4 stars overall.
